loans.name: Zef

texts.en: Zef now wants to buy 100 little chickens and 10 piglets as well as food for them; he wants to raise them and sell them during the summer months.

loans.use: To buy 100 little chickens and 10 piglets as well as food for them

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro tiene 43 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos menores, vive en casa propia de material rústico en una comunidad pequeña ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, una zona donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimor, se dedica a la agricultura hace 14 años y hace 3 años cultiva café por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 43 years old, and has a stable home with his spouse and his three minor children. He owns his own home made of rustic materials in a little community located in the district of Santo Tomás, an area where the population is engaged in agriculture and livestock, in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru. 

He works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of Catimore coffee. He has worked in agriculture for 14 years and has grown coffee for 3 years, so he has experience in this business and good work and personal references in his district. Additionally he is engaged in raising and selling small animals. The loan will be used for the purchase of manure and fertilizer to provide maintenance for his coffee crop. In this way he will obtain good yields and higher incomes in order to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to provide maintenance for his coffee crop

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta in the store located in the village of her residency. She has been operating the store for the past three years. She is 51, is married and the mother of a son. In addition to running her store, she does agriculture as well.

“The money I make from the store is barely enough. Thus, I’ve got to do something else to make a living for my family, and agriculture is what I have been doing for a very long time now. It is hard labour, but what else can someone do in the village, rather than agriculture and livestock?” said Violeta to her loan officer while being interviewed.

Violeta needs this loan to stock her store with inventory items.

loans.use: to stock up her variety store with inventory items.

loans.name: Bukurie

texts.en:
Bukurie is 45 years old and needs this loan to pay for her mother-in-law's medical visitation to a health specialist. She has complained about some pains in her chest and breathing difficulties. 

Bukurie is a married woman with two adult children.  She has raised livestock for  fifteen years. She has two dairy cows and sells two baby calves a year at a price of $600/calf. She sells raw milk to a nearby dairy farm at a price of $0.4/liter. She grows beans, wheat, corn and  fodder that she uses it to feed her own animals.

loans.use: to pay for her mother-in-law's health expenses.

loans.name: Kadri

texts.en:
Kadri wants to buy goats of a good breed and he is seeking your financial help through a loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) to achieve this goal. He is in the photo, with a newly born baby goat.

Kadri is a married father and 55 years old, who during the past almost 20 something years has been doing animal husbandry to earn an income for his family; he’s been buying little calves to raise and later on sell. 

Recently, he added a few goats and wants to add some more, yet, this time of a good breed. 

“Doing this, someone can make money, and I have, certainly. But it requires hard labour and lots of working hours, seven days a week. My wife has it easy; she just plants a few veggies for our family and that’s it,” said Kadri ending the conversation teasing his wife who did not want to be in the photograph, because she was not dressed for the photo occasion, according to her.

loans.use: to buy some goats of a good breed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build some shelves in the grocery store and buy inventory items as well.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyugue y sus tres hijos dependientes en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral como son patos, pavos, cuyes, gallinas, etc, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para invertir en realizar reparaciones y arreglos de su corral donde cria a sus animales ya que se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Jorge espera mejorar su negocio lo que le permitirá incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 42 years old and lives in his own home made of rustic materials with his spouse and three dependent children. He lives in the rural district of Pucará, a community engaged in agriculture and livestock which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Perú. 

He works breeding farm animals such as ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, chickens, etc. He has over 10 years of experience in the industry and has good personal and work references in his district. The loan will be used to invest in marking repairs and adjustments to the corral where he raises his animals as it is in bad condition. With this Jorge hopes to better his business, enabling him to improve the quality of live for him and his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and adjustments in the corral where he breeds his animals

loans.name: Klimeta

texts.en: Klimeta wants to buy potato seeds and prepare the soil for seasonal planting. This year she rented 4,000 square meters of land  to plant potatoes. This land is very prolific and produces good potatoes, according to statistics.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Lirika

texts.en: Lirika has had poor vision for very long time and recently an eye specialist scheduled surgery for her. In addition to her retirement pension of approximately $140/month she grows wheat and corn to sell.

loans.use: to cover the medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Fehbi

texts.en:
Fehbi plans on planting orchards. “I was not really firm in my decision until I accidently met the loan officer who sat down with me and we both went to some detailed plans on a possible farming activity. I liked the idea and the way he explained it to me it seemed okay. I had been planting and harvesting mostly beans, wheat and potatoes, yet never got involved in arboriculture, but now I am excited to challenge myself with some new stuff” said Fehbi to the branch assistant in a way that seemed content, according to her. 

Fehbi is a married man with one child and wan s to buy seedlings and prepare the land to be an orchard.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and prepare the soil.

loans.name: Dora Cecilia

texts.es:
Dora es una famiempresaria, trabajadora, luchadora, vivió y disfruto gran parte de su vida, en su camino logro casarse con su esposo tuvo 4 hijos 3 mujeres y un hombre todos mayores de edad, actualmente es una mujer separada y vive con sus dos hijas menores, trabaja vendiendo productos fritos afuera de su casa, vende bebidas para complementarlos y es así como esta empresaria se gana la vida.

Ella trabaja todos los días a la semana 12 horas cada uno, teniendo que hace resta larga jornada para juntar los recursos necesarios para sostener su hogar.

Ella quiere mejorar sus ventas, aumentar clientes, incrementar su utilidad y sueña con poder comprar una vivienda, un automóvil y dejarles buena herencia a sus hijos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para realizar sus preparaciones, como lo son pasteles, empanadas, buñuelos, arepas con carne, torta de carne, papas rellenas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Dora is a family entrepreneur, a fighter and has lived and enjoyed a great part of her life in her own way. She manged to marry her husband, has 4 children, 3 female and one male, all of them adults. Currently she is separated and lives with her two youngest daughters.

She works selling fried foods outside her house and sells drinks to go along with them. This is how this entrepreneur makes her living. She works every day of the week, 12 hours per day having to work this long day in order to gather the resources needed to sustain her household. She wants to improve her sales, increase her clients and increase her profits. She is dreaming of being able to buy a house, a car and leaving a good inheritance for her children.

She is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her food such as pastries, empanadas, buñuelos (fried dough ball), meat arepas (a flat bread made out of corn), meat sandwiches and stuffed potatoes amongst other products.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make fried foods like prestamos, pastries, empanadas, buñuelos (fried dough ball), arepas (a flatbread made out of corn) and stuffed potatoes.

loans.name: German De Jesus

texts.es:
Germán es un laborioso personaje que tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto con su pareja con la cual tuvo dos hijas, ambas hermosas flores que tienen 18 y 16 años de edad, se dedica a atender un negocio de cibercafé, con ello genera los ingresos para su hogar ya que este depende en la totalidad de él, tanto para pagar las cuentas como para darles los pasajes, y matrícula para el estudio para sus hijas, pero Germán lo hace con mucho gusto ya que esto hace feliz a su familia y ver a sus hijas estudiar y buscar un mejor futuro lo enorgullece.

Germán es muy feliz en su negocio su única preocupación es la inseguridad debido a la presencia de bandas delincuenciales en la zona, pero espera a que con el tiempo esta situación mejore.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en el cambio de algunos accesorios del pc, comprara mouse, teclado, diademas para que sus usuarios disfruten su música y comprara cortinas para que tengan mayor privacidad, con lo que le reste  le hará un mantenimiento preventivo a sus máquinas.
texts.en:
Germán is a hard-working person who is 45 years old. He lives with his partner, with whom he had 2 daughters, both beautiful flowers who are 18 and 16 years old. He is dedicated to his cybercafe business, which generates income for his home that he is totally dependent on, either to pay bills or enable transportation, and enrolment in study for his daughters. But Germán gladly does so because it makes his family happy and to see his daughters study and seek a better future makes him so proud. 

Germán is very happy in his business. His only concern is the uncertainty due to the presence of criminal gangs in the area, but he hopes that with time the situation will improve. 

He wants to request this loan to invest in changing some PC accessories, buying mice, keyboards, headsets for his customers to enjoy their music and buying curtains to improve privacy, with the remainder of the loan to do preventative maintenance on the machines.

loans.use: to buy computer implements (mice, keyboards, headsets)

loans.name: Shyqyri

texts.en:
Shyqyri is a 47-year-old married father of two who are 21 and 17 years old. 

Shyqyri has been the only money maker for his family of four. He has been engaged in retail activity for the past almost 20 years selling mostly clothes. He hasn't had a specific store to run the activity; he’s been a salesman who moves around with his own vehicle selling the goods. He also does transportation of goods for other salespeople and makes approximately $275/month in addition to the money he makes from this activity.

Shyqyri is requesting a loan from you to buy items to sell. “I would very much appreciate lenders' financial help and I promise I will pay them back on time. I am a responsible person. This is my third loan with the same institution and have proved my responsibility the previous times,” said Shyqyri to the loan officer who disbursed the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory of clothes to sell

loans.name: Diris Margoth

texts.es:
Diris es una joven mujer cabeza de familia, la cual tiene 26 años de edad, trabaja desde su casa atendiendo un negocio que puede llamarse sala de belleza pues oferta servicios muy similares pero le falta toda la infraestructura para trabajar.

Gracias a este negocio el cual aprendió pagando cursos y capacitaciones puede generar los recursos para llevar el alimento a su familia conformada por ella, sus padres y su hija de 5 años de edad.

Diris se trazó una meta la iniciar su negocio la cual fue que este será le medio de sostenimiento para su familia, con su sala de belleza no solo llevara el alimento a la mesa, pagara la educación de sus hijos y construirá su casa no en madera si no en material (concreto).

Solicita un préstamo que quiere invertir en varias máquinas e implementos que le hacen falta como lo son una plancha para el cabello, una máquina de motilar, tinturas, tratamientos, entre otros productos capilares.
texts.en:
Diris is a young woman who is the head of her household. She is 26 years old, and she works out of her home operating a business which may be called a beauty salon, since she offers very similar services, but she lacks all of the infrastructure for this work. 

Thanks to this business, which she learned by paying for courses and training, she is able to generate the resources to feed her family, made up of herself, her parents, and her 5-year-old daughter. 

Diris set herself the goal of starting her business so that it would provide the means of sustenance for her family. With her beauty salon, she not only puts food on the table, but she will also pay for her children's education and build a house not of wood but of solid materials (concrete). 

She is requesting a loan which she would like to invest in various appliances and tools which she is lacking, such as a hair iron, an electric hair trimmer, dyes, treatments, and other hair salon products.

loans.use: to buy tools such as a hair iron, an electric hair trimmer, dyes, treatments, and other hair salon products.

loans.name: Shpresim

texts.en:
Shpresim is a married father of three children: 18, 10 and 6 years old. He has been photographed with his wife Viola, and the youngest one, who suffers from some disease.

Shpresim himself was born with limited vision due to some early disease, and as he continued growing, so was the vision decreasing. Some years back he had a surgery that unfortunately resulted in taking the right eye out and replacing it with a fake one because there was no chance of finding a donor for it.

Now he wants to prevent the same thing happening again and wants to have the surgery before the illness destroys the eye that is left. He is begging you all for some compassion to help him with a loan that possibly will save his only eye.

loans.use: to have surgery on the only eye that is left after an advanced disease destroyed his other eye.

loans.name: Selim

texts.en:
Selim has 630 apple trees and he is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for his orchard. He has been doing this type of activity for the past twenty years. 

“Selling apples has been the only source of income for my family; I do take great care of my trees though, and the soil is very prolific for the kind of apples I have. I sell the fruits to whole buyers who then export them to the nearby countries such as Montenegro, Macedonia and Croatia. My plans are that I rent some more land from other villagers and plant orchards such as quinces that our climate weather supports them. So, all in all is good at the moment,” said Selim to the loan officer who visited him while he was working around the orchard.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his 630 apple trees

loans.name: Maicol Jose

texts.es:
Maicol es un hombre de 28 años de edad, reside en la zona de Sahagún, una zona muy afectada por la pobreza, hay pocas oportunidades de trabajo pero lleno de personas con ánimo y sueños de progreso, uno de ellos es Maicol que son su venta de sandalias que es el calzado más usado en la zona busca salir a delante y cumplir sus sueños de vivir en una ciudad junto a su hijo y padres, gozando de bienes y de alegría.

Maicol solicita un préstamo que quiere invertir en sandalias para mujer y niño, con este préstamo tendrá herramienta de trabajo para salir a buscar oportunidades de progreso, contratos, ventas, que no solo ayuden a llevar un alimento a su hogar si no que sean el pinito con el que iniciara a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maicol is a 28 year old man who lives in the Sahagún area, which is greatly affected by poverty. There are few job opportunities, but many spirited people who dream of progressing. One of these people is Maicol who is hoping to use his sandal sales (sandals are the most commonly used shoes in the area) to fulfill his dreams of living in a city together with his child and his parents, happy and enjoying the good things.

Maicol is requesting a loan to buy sandals for ladies and children. With this loan he will have the working tools to be able to look for opportunities to progress, contracts and sales which will not only help him to put food on the table but will also be his first steps towards fulfilling his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a selection of sandals

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Rigoberto es un hombre de 50 años de edad, que diariamente camina por los parques de la ciudad de Medellín vendiendo algodones de azúcar, los cuales incrusta en la madera que sostiene en la foto.
Este empresario inicio su trabajo por necesidad económica, ya que no pudo conseguir empleo y al ser soltero y sin una persona que lo apoye tenía que buscar la manera de generar recursos honradamente.

El señor Rigoberto se esperanza con su forma de trabajar, busca potenciar su empresa, y tiene una muy buena idea para hacerlo pero necesita de un gran apoyo de ustedes, su idea es que primeramente pedir el favor de que le brinden un impulso económico, con un préstamo que destinara a la compra de materia prima para fabricar los algodones de azúcar, fabricara en cantidades porque tendrá vendedores pero no será un contrato por sueldo sino por comisión de acuerdo a lo que venda, por ello  va más seguro y de ante mano las personas que están dispuestas a vender aceptaron los términos de la negociación.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a 50 year old man who every day walks the parks of the city of Medellín selling cotton candy which he places in the stick he is holding in the photo.This entrepreneur started this work out of economic necessity as he couldn't find employment and as a single person he had no one to support him while he looked for an honorable way to make a living.

Rigoberto is encouraged by this method of working ans wants to boost his business. He has a good idea to do it but he needs a lot of help from you people. His idea is first request an economic boost with a loan that will be used to buy the supplies needed to make cotton candy make in large quantities as he has vendors. It will not be by contract and salary but a commission depending on what they sell. So it is safer and the people who are willing to sell have accepted these terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make cotton candy in bulk as he has sellers.

loans.name: Gjela

texts.en:
Gjele is a 45-year-old mother of seven children and grandmother to two who are in the photograph with her. Gjele's oldest child is a 23-year-old daughter who is married and has the two kids in the photo; Gjele's youngest child is 11. 

Her family is indeed poor and falls way below the national poverty level. They live in a very rural area where infrastructure is not the best at all.

For twenty years now, Gjele has been practicing agriculture/livestock and this has been the only source of income for her large family. Currently, she has one dairy cow, seven sheep and ten chickens as well as 3,000 square meters where she only plants feed for the animals and veggies for the family.  

She sells one baby calf each year for $600 and seven baby sheep each year for $700. The mother-in-law, who lives with them, receives a retirement pension of $90 per month as well. 

Gjele is requesting a loan from you to repair a damaged stable.

loans.use: to repair a damaged animal stable

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime is a 58-year-old mother of two who wants to buy a dairy cow of a good breed that will produce more milk compared to the existing cows.

Fatime has been doing agriculture/livestock for the past ten years; she has been planting mostly corn and wheat and uses these grains to secure bread and flour for the entire year. She also plants fodder to feed her animals. The rest of the land she uses to graze her animals naturally.

At the moment she has two dairy cows and a young cow that has not started to produce any milk yet. She sells two calves a year at a price of approximately $600/each and sells 12 liters of raw milk/day at the price approximately $1.2/liter. Whatever she makes from her activity is the only source of income for her family, including her paralyzed mother-in-law whose medical expenses are really high.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow of a good breed: these produce more milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter's university courses since it is an essential tool for her work and research.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with a better education.

To improve sales, Lea would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 35,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Lea hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a soft-drinks retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of soft-drinks and beverages to resell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store business.

Aurelia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more beverages to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Mery

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer versátil, creativa, inteligente de muy étnica en sus manos, ella se dedica a fabricar artesanías en su hogar, productos decorativos y accesorios en general, es madre de 3 hijos y junto con su esposo conforman un sólido núcleo familiar en el cual todos tratan de aportar su granito de arena para sacar la casa adelante y progresar.

Su actividad la cual la aprendió gracias a una amiga, a la cual le da sus créditos y eterno agradecimiento pues desde que le enseño ha tenido la oportunidad de desarrollar una actividad que le genera ingresos y puede apoyar a su marido en el sostenimiento del hogar.

Su consigna es mejorar el hogar, realizar algunas reparaciones, como lo son piso en cerámica, enchapar el baño, pintar su hogar y siempre tener alimento de calidad en su casa.

Ella quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para impulsar su profesión como hace poco empezó no cuenta con mucho capital para trabajar y todo el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mostacilla que es el insumo con el que realiza sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Blanca is a versatile, creative, and intelligent woman who is very clever with her hands. She works in her home making handicrafts, decorative items, and accessories in general. She is the mother of three children, and together with her husband they make up a solid family unit, in which all of them try to do their share to help the household get ahead and make progress. 

She learned her work thanks to a friend, to whom she gives credit and is eternally grateful, because since she learned this profession she has had the opportunity to pursue an activity which generates income for her, and she can support her husband in sustaining the household. 

Her goal is to improve her home, to carry out some repairs, such as laying a tile floor, lining the bathroom, and painting the house, and also always to have quality food in her home. 

She would like to request economic support to further the work that she does, since she started recently and does not have much working capital. She will invest all of the funds from the loan in buying beads, since they are the raw materials she uses to make her handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy beads, which are the main raw material she uses to make her creative pieces.

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena, 55, is a mother of five lovely children seeking capital to start banana farming on her farm. She lives and works on a roughly three acre piece of land with her husband of thirty years. Serena also keeps poultry and grows trees.

Through this loan she will be able to satisfy the demand for bananas in her village which is very high. Profits from the banana business will allow her to expand her business to other markets because the demand is more than the supply. Increased income will allow her to comfortably take care of her family and repay the loan. All that Serena waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To start banana farming

loans.name: Sandra Viviana

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer soltera de 38 años de edad, la cual atiende un negocio que es una combinación entre tienda de abarrotes, con cafetería y bar, ya que oferta productos de la canasta familiar, ricos tintos y cafés, cervezas, aguardiente y ron que son bebidas alcohólicas típicas de Medellín.

Sandra inicio su negocio sola, empíricamente en una apuesta por tener una actividad económica que le generara el sustento diario, y quiso ser emprendedora e independiente porque para ella no hay nada como ser su propio jefe.

La meta que se propuso cuando inicio su negocio fue de recoger los fondos para comprar una vivienda propia y desde entonces apunta todos sus esfuerzos para cumplir este sueño.

Sandra desea un apoyo económico para abastecer su negocio, con granos, abarrotes, frituras en bolsa, dulces, chocolates, cervezas, café, refrescos, aguardiente y ron.
texts.en:
Sandra is a single woman, 38 years old, who attends to her own business which is a combination grocery store and cafeteria/bar. It offers products pertaining to the family basket, rich red wines, coffee, beer, 'aguardiente' and rum, which are typical alcoholic drinks of Medellin.

Sandra began her business alone, empirically in an attempt to have an economic activity that would generate daily sustenance. And she wanted to be an entrepreneur and become independent because for her, there is nothing like being your own boss.

The goal she proposed, when she initiated her business, was to gather the funds to buy her own home and, from that point on, to focus all her efforts on fulfilling this dream.

Sandra desires economic help to supply her business with grains, groceries, bags of fried snacks, sweets, chocolates, beer, coffee, soft drinks, 'aguardiente' and rum.

loans.use: stock her business with grains, groceries, packages of fried snacks, chocolates, sweets, beer, coffee and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mary Jul

texts.en:
Mary Jul is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jul is 34 years old and all of her children are in school.

Mary Jul has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Jul requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Mary Jul has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Mary Jul would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Landi

texts.en:
Landi is a member of the vulnerable ethnic Egyptian Albanians who is seeking your financial help to buy fabric as raw material for his wife who works at home repairing and stitching clothes. He also needs to repair the vehicle he uses for transportation to earn an income. 

 Landi is 43 years old and has only one child in the late teens. They live in the city of Korca where a majority of their community has been living for generations. Nowadays they live in better conditions, compared to some years back when they were discriminated against and their lives were very tough, unfortunately. The majority of them suffered previously from lack of sanitation and education, malnutrition, bullying etc. and they worked at hard labor jobs that the rest of the population in Albania did not do. Those times are gone now for good because the previous regime is gone as well, and Albanians all live in harmony and with respect towards one another these days; that’s for sure.

loans.use: to buy fabric as raw material for his wife who stitches and repairs clothes; also to repair the vehicle he uses to earn income by transporting people

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a doctor's visit.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza wants to start up a livestock activity by buying her first dairy cow. Until now she’s been doing agriculture for the past almost 22 years, focusing mostly on planting and selling wheat, corn, rye, onions and beans. “Over the years, I have come to realize that livestock brings in more income than agriculture. Dairy in our country is consumed a lot and even though there are so many dairy farms and large dairy production plants, there is still demand for dairy products. This made me think that starting a livestock type of activity wouldn’t be a bad move,” said Roza to the loan officer who interviewed her. 

While Roza's focus has been on her chosen activity, her husband has been working as a night man for a pay of $200/month.

loans.use: to start up a dairy business

loans.name: Zisa

texts.en:
Zisa wants to buy fertilizer for his plantations. He is a 60-year-old villager and a married father of two, both in their early 20s. Zisa has been doing agriculture for the past ten years. Currently, he has apple orchards as seen in the photograph and also plants in large quantities tomatoes, wheat and fodder. He then sells the fresh and organic products to wholesale buyers. 

Agriculture has been the only source of income for Zisa’s family all these past years; his plans are to grow it to a larger farm by renting from other villagers and adding some more orchards including cherries and pears, considering the fact that the soil and weather support such trees, according to him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the crops.

loans.name: Angjelin

texts.en:
These are the villagers Angjelin and Laureta; they are married and are both in their early 30s and the parents of a 3-year-old as seen in the picture. They live in the northern part of the country. Livestock and agriculture have been their chosen activity for earning an income.

Currently, they've got one dairy cow from which they sell 1 calf a year at a price of approximately $600 and also sell 10-12 liters of raw milk/day at a price of $0.8/liter. They also have five pigs and they sell about 10-20 piglets/year. In addition to all these, they plant wheat and corn and sell some of it, but the majority is used by the family and their animals.

They need this loan to buy five calves to raise them and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy five calves to raise them for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 34-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple, humble house. Mohammad works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a very low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This loan will help him to provide hot water for the family without using electricity.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Easter

texts.en:
Easter is married with one child. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for five years on a retail basis. Easter has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy crates of beer, spirits, boxes of mineral water, and soda.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, spirits, boxes of mineral water, and soda.

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene is 59 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosene has an internet café business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

Rosene has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Umugisha Group

texts.en:
Pelagie is a group leader, aged 35. She is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 8. Two of them go to school. This group is called Umugisha, which means “Blessing” in English. The group members sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to make their futures better.

Pelagie owns a shop and has been doing business for the past five years, while her husband is a businessman also. With this loan, she would like to buy more salt, sugar, and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more salt, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Saliima

texts.en:
Salima is 25 years old and single with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a gift center and a ladies' boutique, plus a mobile money business where she gets additional income.

She hopes to expand her business and build her dream house, however capital is a challenge that hinders her dreams. She has asked for a loan to buy ladies' bags and invest in mobile money.

loans.use: to buy ladies' bags and invest in mobile money.

loans.name: Miriam Eugenia

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 47 años de edad, con grandes atributos, y cualidades como lo son, la responsabilidad, el respeto, las ganas de progresar, el cariño y sentido de pertenencia, tiene un taller de confección donde brinda 2 empleos, junto a ella se puede ver un operario que trabaja a término fijo, ella es una mujer soltera, tiene su taller ubicado en su casa y prácticamente su familia son su empleados, trabajan y comen en su casa.
 
Ella aprendió de la confección asistiendo a cursos pagos, tenía muy definido que esta sería la profesión que le daría de comer, y desde el año 2011 ha hecho esto realidad.

Ella sueña con comprar una vivienda propia ya que la que se encuentra actualmente es arrendado, quiere si es posible comprar la misma porque representa un gran sentimiento porque fue aquí donde inicio todo y donde quiere terminar.

Miriam solicita un préstamo que quiere invertir en la compra de una maquina doble aguja, las ventaja es que lograra diferentes acabados, podrá confeccionar otro tipo de prendas y posiblemente generar un tercer empleo.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 47 year old woman with great attributes and qualities such as responsibility, respect, a desire to progress, love and a sense of belonging. She has a sewing workshop where two people work. Alongside her you there is an operator who works a fixed term contract.

She is a single woman and her workshop is in her house. On a practical basis her family are her employees, they work and eat in her house. She learned to sew taking paid courses as she was quite sure that this was the profession that would provide her food to eat. She has made this a reality since 2011.

Her dream is to buy her own house as she currently leases. She would like to buy that house as it has a lot of sentimental value as that is where she started everything and would like to finish there. Miriam is requesting a loan as she wants to invest in a twin needle sewing machine. The advantage of this is it can do different types of finishes, she can sew other types of clothing and possibly generate a third person.

loans.use: to buy a twin needle sewing machine.

loans.name: Hector Dario

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre soltero de 27 años de edad que con pocos recursos pero mucha creatividad logro montar un negocio de venta de alimentos contando solo con un poco de cemento, madera y un tarro de comida. Inicio su negocio por necesidad económica ante la impotencia de no poder emplearse en alguna empresa, busco el emprendimiento como una salida a sus problemas económicos y encontró en este una alternativa de progreso y oportunidades de mejora enrome.

No tiene hijos, procura pro ayudarle a sus padres, busca crecer corporativamente para generar empleo, aumentar su inventario, mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Aprendió de las preparaciones de alimentos asistiendo a unas clases y capacitaciones cerca a su hogar y vende principalmente comidas rápidas, aunque de igual manera vende mucho almuerzo.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en insumos y materiales que necesita en su negocio tanto para cocinar como para tener un abastecimiento necesario para cubrir cualquier pedido o plato que le lleguen a pedir.

 Con el aliento económico comprara porcelana, cubiertos metálicos, manteles, pintura, vasos de cristal, cucharones, ollas, e insumos para la preparación de sus platos como bandeja paisa, sudado, sancocho, arroz con pollo etc.
texts.en:
Héctor is a single 27 year old man who has managed, with few resources but much creativity, to set up a business selling food, with only a little cement, wood and jar of food. He began his business due to financial need, after not being able to find work for a company. He looked to the venture as a way out of his economic problems and found an alternative way of progressing and enormous opportunities to improve.

He doesn't have any children, so he his working to help his parents. He wants to expand his business to create jobs, increase his inventory and improve his living conditions.

He learned to prepare food by attending classes and training near his home. He mainly sells fast food and he also sells a lot of lunch.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and materials he needs for his business, both for cooking and to provide the services necessary for every order.

With the money he will buy porcelain, metal cutlery, tablecloths, paint, glasses, ladles, pans and supplies for his meals, such as bandeja paisa [a popular dish traditionally including beans, rice, chicharrón, ground meat, chorizo, fried egg, plantain and avocado], sudado [a type of stew], sancocho [a type of soup], and chicken with rice.

loans.use: to buy porcelain, metal cutlery, tablecloths, paint, glasses, ladles, pans and supplies for his meals

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is James, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to 4 children, and known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, James joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, James plans to send his children to school.

Between the 15 farmers in James's Group, a total of 8 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Shem's Group

texts.en:
Shem is 69 years old and has nine children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Shem is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 9 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Shem started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community.

Shem’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Phridah's Group

texts.en:
Phridah's Group is formed by six farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Phridah, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 55 years old, married, and has three children. Phridah has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Phridah isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Phridah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition because now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Phridah's Group will purchase a total of three solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of three acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvests.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila, age 31, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery materials to sell. This will help him offer more variety to his customers and continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money, he finds this difficult. 

For this reason his wife, Shumaila, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Her husband will purchase an embroidery machine and a variety of embroidery materials. Shumaila is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with this loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to grow her husband's embroidery business by purchasing an embroidery machine and a variety of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Thomas's Group

texts.en:
Thomas is a 53-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader who is often described as a very experienced farmer and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Thomas has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Thomas described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy more land to cultivate.

With this loan, Thomas’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo est une femme mariée avec trois enfants à sa charge. Adzo est âgée de 47ans et travaille dynamiquement pour le bien-être de sa famille. Adzo vit à Adidogomé pour vendre des pagnes dans les marchés et parcoure les quartiers pour satisfaire ses clients. Pour disposer de ses articles en permanence, Adzo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Adzo demande ce crédit pour commander pagnes et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Adzo is a married woman raising three children. She is 47 years old and works hard for the well-being of her family. She lives in Adidogomé and sells pagnes in the markets and walking through neighborhoods so as to satisfy the needs of her clients. 

So that she always has pagnes in stock, Adzo renews her stock two times a month. She is asking for this loan to order more pagnes and grow her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy 12 lengths of brightly colored African print fabric (pagnes)

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 49 years old with 2 children and is a hardworking entrepreneur. Her husband is helping her with their business.

Pamela's business as a wholesaler home products distributor started when she was hit by a retrenchment in the company she used to work for. But instead of finding other work, she used the last payment of PHP 100,000 given to her to start a business of home products distribution.

All Pamela's hard work in getting customers, getting supplies from the manufacturer, supplying their orders, and delivering is finally paying off since customers themselves are finding her to get their orders, and this is growing. She was able to buy a truck for delivering supplies and hired employees in their community to deliver her goods. She was able to build a retail store apart from her wholesale distribution business and was able to continuously put her children in good school.

Pamela, having a good heart, shared her blessing with her relatives by helping her nephew with his dialysis treatment and also taking care of her single old aunt. She also helps her helpers by giving them employee benefits and incentives if the sales are good.

Today, Pamela wants to accommodate her growing customers but her lack of capital prevents her from doing so. Pamela is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to buy 10 boxes of laundry powder, 10 boxes of laundry bars, 10 boxes of shampoo, and 10 boxes of fabric conditioner, since these products were in demand for household use.

Pamela wants to expand her retail store and wholesale home products distribution business to a wider area in the future to save more, provide more for the expenses of the school and their family, and help more in their community.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of laundry powder, 10 boxes of laundry soap bars, 10 boxes of shampoo, and 10 boxes of fabric conditioner.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He is 66 years old and a married father of 8 children, often described as a very hardworking individual.

Although Philip has been a farmer for more than 30 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though he is new to the program, Philip wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Philip hopes to be able to invest in a business.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 2 solar lights, as, even though Philip decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish to earn a living. She is a 55-year-old married woman and has no dependents. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to to buy a fishing net. These could be a big help for Lorenza and her husband to improve their catch. Thus, slowly, her earnings will improve and she will be able to handle her finances. With this, she could expand her fishing business and invest in a possible business venture to have additional sources of income.

Lorenza is very grateful and she is exerting much effort to improve their status of living in order to become more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Mohammad's father works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income that barely covers all the family's needs.

Mohammad took a loan from FATEN to help him buy a solar system for heating water. This loan will help him to provide hot water for his family without using electricity. Mohammad  appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 19-year-old single man from the city of Dier El Balah. He lives with his family in a simple humble house. Eyad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs.

Eyad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water, which will help him to provide hot water for the family without using electricity.

Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 47-year-old mother living in Mitheru, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Like many smallholder farmers in Kenya, she owns a tiny inherited plot of land to live off of, just under three acres, and has always struggled to support her family. Her primary source of income has been crops and some small personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Dorcas passionately loves dairy goat farming but one challenge she has been facing is a lack of funds to buy a goat. She is kindly seeking a loan to buy a superior breed of goat. 

From the loan, she will get a steady source of nutritious milk that she will use for home consumption and she will sell the extra milk to the neighbors. Feeding the goat will never be a challenge for Dorcas because she has planted forage on her farm and will be supplementing this by cutting plants at the river bank for fodder. This will assure her of increased milk production. 

A goat produces about two litres every day, and so Dorcas will use the money she used to spend on milk for essential food and pocket money for her children who are away at school. This loan is going to impact the life of Dorcas positively. She is already thinking ahead and plans to increase her milk production so she can sell to the local market. Other than milk from the goat, she will benefit from the manure, which will improve her farm fertility and result in high productivity. All that Dorcas waits for is for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a superior breed of goat

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a hard-working 45-year-old female who is widowed with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells crude salt and has been in business for fifteen years. She also owns a salt pan from which she gets additional income. She has a dream of building a good house. However, Regina has a challenge of limited capital and weather changes. Regina wants money to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Joyce, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 55 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  She is married and has 3 children.

Joyce is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again because this means she can obtain the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Joyce says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Joyce will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of 3 solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Bao

texts.en:
Bao was a successful businessman previously. After his business failed, he went back to his hometown. Now, he is 36 years old and runs an automobile navigation shop with his wife. They have a 3-year-old child who is in kindergarten. Bao did not read many books when he was a student, and he went to work as a teenager. His poor family let him become a sensible child more than his typical peers at an early age. Bao is diligent and hard-working.

Last year was the most desperate time in Bao's life. His father was very sick and it cost a large amount of money to try to cure him. Unfortunately, his father’s disease didn’t get better. Now, he is recuperating at home and needs an extra person dedicated to caring for him. Bao didn’t shrink from the heavy burden of his family. With the help of a friend, he opened a shop to sell automobile navigation systems.

Bao requested￥20,000 from MicroCred. This is his third loan. He will use the money to buy new products so that he can expand his business and earn enough money to support his family. Bao will try his best to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy new products for his automobile navigation shop

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in Mukuune village, which is in the Central Province of Kenya. This is primarily a maize-growing region. She has a lovely family with James, her husband. To help her hubby provide for the family, Doreen ventured into farming a decade ago. Over the years, she has brought tremendous growth to the business. Today, she keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows a variety of food crops. She is also invested in other personal businesses for additional income.

Doreen is seeking a loan to grow bananas in a bid to increase her farm production. The money Doreen will make from selling bananas will help her to repay the loanand pay for her children's education, which is her highest expense. Doreen stated that, through the loan, she will satisfy the demand for bananas in her village.

loans.use: To start farming bananas

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 39-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a humble house. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income that barely covers all the family's needs.

Mohammad took a loan from FATEN, which will help him buy a solar system for heating water. This loan will allow him to provide hot water for his family without using electricity. Mohammad  appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children who all go to school. She also takes care of one additional member. Betty sells fried cassava and chapati from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years and she works seven days a week. 

Betty has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, cassava, baking flour, and charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Betty's goal is to build a house. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, cassava, baking flour, and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Elias Lucas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
El socio continua dedicándose  a brindar el servicio de taxi, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito  otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el cambio de aceite del carro .
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Nueva Generación lll communal bank, located in Cusco province.

He is continuing to operate his taxi service. He feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make his instalment payments. He is a responsible and hard-working person, and this is how he is supporting his family.

The borrower is requesting the loan in order to change the oil of his vehicle and do other maintenance

loans.use: To change the oil on his vehicle and do other maintenance.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,azucar entre otros.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Nueva Generation lll communal bank, located in Cusco province.

She is continuing with her grocery store business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her installment payments. She is continuing to sell various kinds of products such as rice, sugar, milk and other items, for all her customers who ask her, as this is how she is supporting her family. 

The member is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar and other items.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Anabel

texts.en:
Ma. Anabel is an industrious mother of three young children. She sells household items like kitchen wares, sleeping mats, gas stoves, and ready-to wear clothes like shirts, pants, blouses, and many other things. She is 31 years old, married, and from Talibon, Bohol. 

Ma. Anabel has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stock including blankets, mats, and kitchen wares. With these items, she can meet the orders of her customers and deliver items on time. This will enable her to increase her earnings so that she can meet her children's basic needs. She is determined that she will be able to improve her livelihood for the benefit of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy stock including blankets, mats, and kitchen wares.

loans.name: Restilina

texts.en:
Restilina is a hard-working entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is 47 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Fernando, her husband, works as a tricycle operator. She sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Restilina buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Restilina is taking out PHP 10,000 loan assistance to continue the operations of her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish, which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she wants her business to continue to flourish and she desires for her children to finish schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish which are necessary to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Topchugul

texts.ru: Топчугул, 45 лет, есть 2 детей- школьников, замужем. Образование у Топчугул средне-специальное, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она работает преподавателем по швейному и кондитерскому производству. Вообще у нее очень большой трудовой стаж, работала медсестрой, занималась поставками продуктов питания в больницы. Ежемесячная заработная плата Топчугул от преподавания - 28,415 сом (KGS). Она решила обратиться в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку швейных машин для открытия собственных швейных курсов для студентов. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и обучение ее детей.
texts.en: Topchugul is 45 years old, and married with two school-aged children. Topchugul has a specialist secondary education, and earns the main income for her family working as a sewing teacher and producer of confectionery. On the whole she has a very full working life, has worked as a nurse, and has supplied food to hospitals. Topchugul's monthly earnings from teaching are 28,415 som (KGS). She decided to apply to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sewing machines in order to open her own sewing courses for students. With income from the loan, she plans to invest in the future expansion of the business and the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines in order to open her own sewing courses for students

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is 65 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Esther has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Esther also decided to purchase a solar light with part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Esther's Group will be able to receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Yalile

texts.es:
Yalile es un ama de casa soltera, cabeza de familia, que busca salir adelante y luchar siempre por mejorar su hogar, por su hijo ella quiere demostrar que no solo vino al mundo a sobrevivir, que esta para grandes cosas, hazañas, que impulsara a su hijo para que estudie, sea universitario, sea profesional y exitoso por ello trabaja duramente en su cocina, realizando almuerzos y desayunos que es su fuerzas de venta y con esto se mantiene.

Su hijo tiene 4 años de edad y por ello trabaja en su hogar para estar cerca de él y atenderlo ante cualquier posible eventualidad que pudiera pasar.

Yalile quiere solicitar un préstamo la razón es que busca comprar una nueva estufa con horno y comprar insumos en granos, abarrotes, carnes, vegetales y frutas, este apoyo será muy importante ya que Yalile se encuentra en etapa de expansión y con el honor podrá preparar nuevas recetas, sorprendiendo a sus clientes con un menú más variado.
texts.en:
Yalile is a single housewife, the head of her family. She wants to move ahead and works constantly to improve her home.

For her son's sake, she wants to show that she didn't just come into the world to survive but to do great things. She wants this to motivate her son to study, go to college, become a professional, and be successful. For him, she works hard in her kitchen, making lunches and breakfasts, which is her source of sales. With this, she maintains herself.

Her son is 4 years old, and for him, she works in her house in order to be near him and take care of him if anything should happen.

Yalile wants to request a loan so she can look to buy a new stove with an oven. She also will buy supplies of grains, groceries, meat, vegetables, and fruit. This support will be very important because Yalile is expanding and with the oven she will be able to prepare new recipes, surprising her customers with a more varied menu.

loans.use: to buy a stove with an oven included, to allow variety in what she prepares

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Beatrice, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married, and has three children. Beatrice has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Beatrice isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially because she has learnt a lot from farming trainings. This year, Beatrice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition that will enable her to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and save more money.

Using this loan, Beatrice's Group will purchase a total of three solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Gloria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 61 años de edad que trabaja en un local de comidas rápidas el cual es de ella, es una mujer soltera sin hijos que depende exclusivamente de su negocio ya que no cuenta con una pensión o alguien que le ayude económicamente.

Inicio su negocio pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, genera un empleo, abre todas 16 horas por cada día de la semana, le gusta bastante trabajar y generar recursos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por darse gusto y no negarse nada.

Esta trabajadora mujer quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual le ayudara mucho en su negocio pues todo lo invertirá en materia prima, como lo es panes, papas, arepas, carne, vegetales, salsas de todo tipo, cubiertos,  platos y vasos plásticos, bebidas, frituras en bolsa, entre otros. 

Para ella sera muy importante este apoyo pues le dará un buen material para trabajar por un tiempo, y le permitirá seguir velando por el sostenimiento y progreso de su local de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 61-year-old woman who works in a fast food store she owns. She is a single woman without children who relies solely on her business because she doesn't have a pension or anyone who supports her economically.

She started her business for her love of and inclination toward independent work. She created her job and is open 16 hours every day of the week. She really likes to work and make money to improve her living conditions, to enjoy herself and not want for anything.

This hard-working woman wants to request a loan that will help her a lot in her business. She will spend it all on raw materials, bread, potatoes, arepas, meat, vegetables, sauces of all kinds; plastic silverware, plates, and cups; drinks, packaged fried foods, and other products

This support will be very important to her because it will give her good ingredients to work for a while, and it will let her continue looking after the maintenance and progress of her fast food store.

loans.use: to buy bread, potatoes, arepas, meat, vegetables, sauces of all kinds; plastic silverware, plates, and cups; drinks, packaged fried foods, and other products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 35-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife and son in a simple humble house. Mohammad works as a farmer on his agricultural land where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. It will help him to provide hot water for the family without using electricity.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 37-year-old married man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a simple humble house. Ahmad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. It will help him to provide hot water for the family without using electricity.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with two children, who are 16 years and 24 years old. She operates a retail business, where she sells cooking gas and kerosene, and has been involved in this business for nine years.

Her primary customers are locals. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open more business branches.

This is Lucy's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use this KES 80,000 loan to buy more cooking gas and kerosene to sell.

loans.use: buy more cooking gas and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Essonéya

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans, Essonéya est une femme mariée qui vit avec son unique enfant à Adidogomé. Pour entreprendre une activité et disposer d’un revenu pour répondre à ses besoins, Essonéya vend des chaussures dans tout son quartier. Essonéya achète deux fois par mois au marché ses chaussures pour revendre à ses clients. Pour acheter de nouvelles chaussures, Essonéya demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients et trouver le bénéfice pour permettre à son enfant une bonne éducation.
texts.en: Essonéya, aged 27, is a married woman who lives with her only child in Adidogomé. For her enterprise and to have an income for supporting herself, she sells shoes throughout her district. She makes her purchases of shoes twice a month at the market and resells them to her customer. To purchase new shoes, Essonéya is asking for this loan to finance her order, so as to satisfy her customers properly and to make a profit, allowing her child a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 30 shoes

loans.name: Nua Ngam 14 Group

texts.en:
Thanh, 31, lives in a Thai ethnic traditional house with five other members of her family: her in-laws, husband, and her two small children aged five and one. Thanh and her husband work in agricultural production to provide for the family while her in-laws are at an advanced age and they stay at home to look after the children.

To have enough income to cover living expenses, she diversifies cultivation and animal husbandry with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, growing corn and cassava and raising pigs and three buffaloes for ploughing. Handling the difficulty in lack of capital for investment, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is her fifth loan in the Program and she will use it to buy fertilizer for the corn field. She hopes to reap a good harvest and gain good income.

Thanh dreams of a more abundant life and a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she is wearing a white shirt and standing the first from the right.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for the corn field

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille, Akuvi vend de la bouillie qu’elle prépare à l’aide du maïs et du mil avec des beignets dans son quartier. Akuvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès des fournisseurs du quartier pour disposer en permanence ses ingrédients. Pour acheter du sac de maïs, de mil et de la farine de blé, Akuvi demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et développer favorablement son activité pour avoir plus de rentabilité
texts.en: Akuvi is a married woman, 37 years old, who lives in Adidogomé with her two children. To help her family to thrive, she sells porridge, which she makes with corn and millet, and serves with beignets, in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies twice a month from neighborhood suppliers in order to have her ingredients continuously. To purchase sacks of corn, millet, and wheat flour, Akuvi is asking for this loan to finance her purchase and to develop her business, so as to have a higher profitability.

loans.use: to purchase 12 tubs of corn, 10 tubs of millet, and a sack of wheat flour

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es una buena persona, alegre, compartido, amoroso, fiel, un hombre trabajador el cual tiene una inda familia conformada por su pareja y sus dos hijos uno ya mayor de edad y un pequeño de tan solo 4 años que ha traído alegría a su hogar.

Trabaja en la venta de cerdos y vende leche, es ese típico vendedor de leche que carga en una canasta sus litros de leche que distribuye por el barrio, su profesión la inicio por necesidad económica, siempre apuntando a ser independiente y no tener un jefe.

Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida, darle un buen hogar y calidez a su hijo, crear un ahorro para cuando él sea grande poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, y seguir siendo el hombre feliz que es.

La falta de capital ha sido un obstáculo en sus aspiraciones de crecimiento pero ahora con la ayuda de Interactuar junto con su socio Kiva puede progresar ya que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de leche, pues su idea es promocionar e impulsar mas esta venta pues sus vecinos han tenido buena aceptación y ve en esto una gran oportunidad de negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is a good, happy, sharing, loving, and faithful person and a hard-working man. He has a beautiful family made up of his partner and their two children. One is already an adult, and the other is only 4 years old and has brought joy to their home.

He works selling pigs and milk. He is a typical milk salesman who puts his liters of milk in a basket and distributes them throughout the neighborhood. He started this profession out of economic need, always aiming to be independent and not have a boss.

His dream is to improve his quality of life, give his son warmth and a good home, put aside savings so that when his son is older he can pay for college, and continue being the happy man he is.

Lack of capital has been an obstacle to his aspirations of growth, but now with the help of Interactuar and Kiva, he can progress. He is requesting a loan to use to buy milk, with the idea of advertising and driving up his sales. His neighbors have given good feedback and he sees a big business opportunity there.

loans.use: to stock up on milk to expand distribution to other neighborhoods

loans.name: Alaa Eddin

texts.en:
Alaa Eddin is a 31-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his wife and one son in a simple, humble house. Alaa works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs.

Alaa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar energy system for heating water. This loan will help him to provide hot water for the family without using electricity from the grid.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for heating water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en:
Qasem is a 44-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a simple, humble house. Qasem works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs.

Qasem  took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar energy system for heating water. This loan will help him to provide hot water for the family without using electricity from the grid.

Qasem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for heating water.

loans.name: Shamira

texts.en: Shamira is a female single parent with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a motorcycle transport business as a main source of income and also gets additional income from a restaurant. She has a dream of buying land for settlement and farming. However, the business faces a challenge of accidents and market competition leading to constant mechanical breakdowns which are thus an expense to repair. She is requesting a loan to buy land for settlement.

loans.use: to buy land for settlement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
