Andrea es una madre cabeza de familia de 31 años de edad, ella se separó de su esposo por ciertos inconvenientes y quedó como cabeza de familia de un hogar constituido por ella y sus 4 hijas de 11,  13, 3, años de edad y la menor que tan solo tiene 3 meses.

Su mayor preocupación son sus hijas, son muy niñas y necesitan incondicionalmente que su madre siempre este hay y más ahora que les hace falta esa figura paterna, en el hogar, pero su padre es responsable y le ayuda a su exesposa para el sostenimiento de sus hijas.

Andrea quedo con una gran responsabilidad, aunque recibe ayuda de su expareja, tenía que ingeniarse la manera de generar recursos y al mismo tiempo estar en su hogar para atender cualquier eventualidad con sus niñas, por ello decidió iniciar un venta de helados y es esta la profesión que la ha llevado a progresar, con ella solventa sus deudas, paga los servicios públicos, la alimentación y le da a sus hijos cualquier moneda para que compren dulces en el recreo.

Andrea busca un aliento económico que le permita invertir en la compra de paletas de helado, conos, cucuruchos, conchas, sabores de helado lecherita, salsas de chocolate, mora, chantilly, entre otros, ya que su idea no es conformarse con sobrevivir, por el contrario buscar siempre progresar, y soñar un día con montar una heladería.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 31-year-old mother and the head of her family. She separated from her husband for certain reasons and became the head of a household made up of herself and her four daughters. They are 11, 13, and 3 years old, with the youngest only 3 months old.

Her greatest worry is for her daughters. They are very young and need their mother's unconditional presence, even more now that they lack that father figure in the home. But their father is responsible and helps his ex-wife support their daughters.

Andrea found herself with a large responsibility. Although she receives help from her ex-husband, she had to come up with a way to make money and at the same time, be at home to attend to anything that comes up with her daughters. She decided to start selling ice cream, which has helped her make progress. She is settling her debts, paying for utilities and food, and giving her children whatever change they like to buy sweets while out playing.

Andrea is looking for economic support that will allow her to invest in ice cream bars, ice cream cones, waffle cones, flavors of Lecherita ice cream, chocolate, blueberry, and Chantilly sauce, etc. Her goal is not to settle for surviving, but to always work for progress. She dreams of one day starting an ice cream store.

loans.use: to buy ice cream bars, ice cream cones, waffle cones, flavors of Lecherita ice cream, chocolate, blueberry, and Chantilly sauce, etc.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 26 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Sobia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Sobia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Sobia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Sobia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Amassan

texts.fr: Amassan  est une femme veuve de 61 qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses six enfants. Amassan vend des beignets à base de l’haricot pour gagner son revenu et favoriser une éducation adéquate à ses enfants. Grâce à ce commerce Amassan arrive à faire une bonne épargne et tirer un bon profit de son activité.  Amassan s’approvisionne une fois par mois chez un grossiste du quartier. Afin de commander des bols du haricot et préparer ses beignets, Amassan demande ce microcrédit pour favoriser son achat et réaliser une bonne rentabilité pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Amassan is a widow, 61 years old, who lives in Adidogomé with her six children. She sells beignets made from beans in order to earn an income for educating her children adequately. Thanks to this business of hers, Amassan manages to save some money and derive a good profit. She gets her supplies once a month from a neighborhood wholesaler. To order tubs of beans and make beignets, Amassan is asking for this micro-loan for her purchase and for making a good profit to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 67 tubs of beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and expand his area of work.

loans.name: Puentecito De Illichua Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal PUENTECITO DE ILLICHUA,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo.
El socio Ricardo tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio  de carpintería, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Ricardo, belongs to 'Puentecito de Illichua' group, located in 'Paucartambo' region.

Ricardo is 53 years old, he has a live-in partner and 3 children. He combines his daily activities with his work as a carpenter. He has had his carpentry business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the effort he puts in every day. This is how Ricardo provides for his family.

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy wood.

All the members of the group feel grateful for the loan and are committed to meeting their repayment quotas.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 35-year-old man who is married with three children, who all go to school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Moses has a motor vehicle transport business where he has been working for three years now. He has a future dream of having a big vehicle for transport. However, he is faced with the challenge of car breakdowns due to bad roads, which reduces his profits as he has to factor in repairs. He will use the loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 36-year-old male, married with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Joseph operates a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in that business for two years. He began the business to generate income for his family. He gets additional income from salt winning in salt pans.  Joseph has a dream of educating his children. Joseph wants money to buy sugar, salt, millet flour, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, millet flour, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise like paraffin, sugar and others to sell.

loans.name: Edwin Alonso

texts.es:
Familia, progresar, salir siempre adelante es el pensamiento y prioridades del señor Edwin, un hombre de 34 años de edad que se dedica a la confección de su línea propia de Bóxer, un hombre soltero que vela por el cuidado de sus padres, Edwin cuenta con la ayuda de dos operarios que son los encargados de confeccionar los bóxer, él se encarga de toda la parte comercial y de esta manera inicio a trabajar desde el año 2011.

Aprendido del negocio gracias a su padre quien fue comerciante y ahora heredo todos sus conocimientos a Edwin quien en el momento sigue sus paso y vela por un mejor futuro, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener mayor contratos, generar empleo y sueña en un futuro exportar su producto.

Edwin solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos para la confección, como lo son tela, resortes, licra y pagar a sus proveedores de estampación.
texts.en:
Family, progress, and constant improvement are the thoughts and priorities of Edwin, a 34-year-old man who makes a living by making his own line of boxers. He is a single man who looks after the care of his parents.

Edwin relies on the help of two workers who are in charge of making the boxers, while he takes care of the sales end. This is how the business has been since he started in 2011.

He learned the business thanks to his father, who was a salesman and has passed all his knowledge on to Edwin. He now follows in his footsteps and looks to a better future, improving his living conditions, having better contracts, and generating employment. He dreams of exporting his product in the future.

Edwin is requesting a loan to buy production supplies such as cloth, elastic, and Lycra, and to pay his printing providers.

loans.use: to buy cloth, elastic, and Lycra, and to pay his printing providers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cinder blocks and sand to build a wall around her property.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase his livestock headcount and the volume of milk he can sell

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.ru: Санавар 38 лет, замужем, у нее средне-специальное образование, мать 5 детей. Она известна как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек. Санавар уже 15 лет занимается бизнесом в увеличении поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве. В хозяйстве у Санавар имеется: лошадь, 8 овец, 4 коровы. На 4,77 Га земли выращивают пшеницу, кукурузу. Санавар обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы, часть средств направит на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Санавар планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Sanavar is 38 years old, married, has a specialized secondary education and is a mother of five children. She is well known as a principled, honest and kind-hearted person. Sanavar has already been in business for 15 years, increasing the total number of the livestock on her farm. On the farm, Sanavar has a horse, 8 sheep, and 4 cows. She grows wheat and maize on 4.77 hectares of land. Sanavar applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers for tilling the soil. Part of the funds will be used to purchase livestock. Sanavar plans to use income from the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic wheat and corn, as well as to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Сухроб умный и честный человек. Он современный бизнесмен. Сухроб имеется магазин, где он занимается бизнесом. Он продает печенье, конфеты, напитки, колбасы, сыр, сахар, молочные продукты и другие. Сухроб 15 лет своей жизни продвигает свой бизнес.  Сухроб сам трудиться, и зарабатывает обеспечить семьи. 
Сухроб житель района Мастчох. Он  женат, и отец двоих детей. Сыновьям 10 и 9 лет. Его жена домохозяйка и дома занимается продажей молоко. 
Сухроб хочет расширить деятельность. Он запрашивает кредит, и за счет кредита он хочет приобрести холодильник для продуктов. На оставшуюся часть денег он перевозит ассортимент продуктов, чтобы расширить бизнес и привлечь себе больше клиентов. Сухроб давно мечтал стать хорошим бизнесменом и иметь собственный бизнес. Ваш кредит поможет ему расширить бизнес и стать хорошим бизнесменом. Сухроб верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Не дайте ему терять надежду.
texts.en:
Suhrob is an intelligent and honest man and a modern businessman. He lives in the Mastjokh region and is married with two children, sons aged 10 and 9. His wife is a homemaker and earns money selling milk from home. He has a shop where he sells cookies, candy, drinks, sausages, cheese, sugar, dairy products and other items. He has had this business for 15 years and he works hard to earn money so he can provide for his family.

Suhrob wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan so he can buy a refrigerator to store food products. With the remaining money he will transport an assortment of inventory in order to expand his business and attract more customers. He dreamed long ago of becoming a successful businessman and owning his own business. Your loan will help him to expand his business and become a better businessman. He trusts in you and in your support. Don't let him lose hope.

loans.use: to buy a modern refrigerator and to bring in more inventory

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 19-year-old single lady from Dier El Balah city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her brother works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. Lubna would like to improve the family's living conditions so she took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity.
Lubna appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 54 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, 33 года работает учителем кыргызского языка в школе, получает пенсию. Также на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря неустанному труду и терпению, Бактыгул успешно увеличила размеры своего небольшого бизнеса. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Бактыгул очень приветливая и веселая, а также очень добрая. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса и приумножения прибыли Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На доходы от кредита Бактыгул хочет и дальше развивать бизнес и построить новый дом для ее семьи.
texts.en: Baktygul is 54 years old, and is married with four children. She has a higher education, has worked for thirty three years as a Kyrgyz language teacher in a school, and receives a pension. In addition, over a period of 30 years, she has worked in animal husbandry. Thanks to her indefatigable hard work and patience, Baktygul has successfully increased the size of her small business. There are three cows on the farm. Her combined monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). Baktygul is very friendly and happy, and also very kind. In order to further develop the business and increase profit, Baktygul applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. With income from the loan, Baktygul wants to further develop her business and build a new home for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Khursheed has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Khursheed's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Khursheed also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Khursheed is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne's Group is formed of 11 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Everlyne, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 40 years old, married and has four children. Everlyne has been a farmer for 18 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Everlyne isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Everlyne will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Everlyne's Group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvests of maize.

loans.name: Nyebeyoona - Nakohigu-Fong Group

texts.en:
Damu is a 60-year-old hard working woman from Karaga in the Northern region of Ghana. Damu is married and has 10 children. Damu is the individual pictured with her hand raised among the members.

Damu is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 10 years. The name of the group is Nyebeyoona - Nakohigu-Fong. She earns a good profit from the business simply because the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality parboiled rice for the local market in Ghana.

Damu and the Nyebeyoona - Nakohigu-Fong group have asked for a loan of GHS 6,700. Damu’s share of the loan is GHS 200, which would be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. Damu has planned to produce in large quantities and sell rice to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food and health needs.

Damu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
HELLO, LENDERS! Meet Everline, a 25-year-old jovial mother of three lovely children whom she refers to as her “heartbeat”. Everline hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, a place that has produced some top elite athletes for the world. Everline's area has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming. 

Everline is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past three years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Everline offers extension services to other farmers who are new to the business. 

Being a caring and loving mother, Everline has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming. Although Everline reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing is that the village where Everline lives has only one diesel posho (cornmeal) mill that keeps on breaking down. She seeks to change this situation by buying an electric posho mill. 

Everline is respectfully asking for a loan to buy an electric posho mill. Through the loan she will be able to serve the other villagers by grinding their maize. Maize is a staple food in Kenya and because of this, Everline will be assured of profits and clients. Everline is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality life and securing her children's future. 

Everline has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan. Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: To buy an electric posho (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Benard is representing his group of nine farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Benard has been a farmer for 18 years and this season, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Benard is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 3.5 acres will be planted by Benard's Group, and among them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 52 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Жылдыз в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав почти с нуля больше 30 лет назад, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Жылдыз есть 2 коровы. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 20,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 52 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. Zhyldyz does agricultural work as the primary source of income for her family. She started this work more than 30 years ago from almost nothing, and she now has 2 cows on her farm. Her monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further expand her business, she has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Zhyldyz plans to invest the proceeds from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Dunya

texts.en:
Dunya is a 27 year old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband and three children in a simple house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector. Dunya would like to improve her family living conditions so she took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity.
Dunya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Janakason

texts.en: Janakason is a 42 year old married man with a responsibility of looking after nine children who all go to school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Janakason earns a salary and he also practices agriculture as an additional source of income. He is faced with the challenge of work overload, to the extent that it is hard for him to create time for his family.  He is looking forward to educating his children for a better future. He is requesting a loan to help pay for school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ener Miguel

texts.es:
Ener es un hombre de 33 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 2 años, vive en una vereda y se dedica a ofertar servicios de internet y entretenimiento, ya que en sus máquinas tiene juegos para el disfrute de sus clientes, sus principales usuarios son los adolescentes y es su misión hacer que estos se diviertan y encuentre en su negocio un lugar de esparcimiento y de cambio de ambiente.

Ener quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de maquinaria, juegos, y quiere invertir parte de su capital para reparaciones en su negocio y pintura.
texts.en:
Ener is 33 years old. He has one son and lives in a village. He has a business that provides Internet and entertainment services. His computers have games for his customers' enjoyment. His main customers are teenagers, and it is his goal to ensure that they have fun and see his business as a place for recreation and a change of environment.
Ener wants to apply for a loan to buy new computers and video games, and he wants to invest part of the money in fixing up his business and painting.

loans.use: to buy new computers and video games.

loans.name: Basemah

texts.en: Basemah is a 45 year old married woman from a village near Jenin City. She lives with her husband and five children in a simple house. Her husband has an auto repair workshop. Basemah would like to improve her family living conditions so she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity. Basemah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Mwanamisi's Group

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 48-year-old proud mother of seven children. Often described as a very friendly person, she is a group leader representing her group of 14 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Mwanamisi has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mwanamisi described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize seed, because she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mwanamisi’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Felix Martin

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre de 37 años de edad que trabaja diariamente en su negocio de ebanistería, fabricando y reparando muebles del hogar, con su trabaja logra generar los ingresos para su familia, tiene tres hijos menores de edad de 14, 11 y 4 años de edad, todos ellos se encuentran estudiando, gozan de buena alimentación y son felices, todo gracias a su padre que se esmera mucho por que estén así.

Feliz últimamente ha tenido muchos contratos para reparación de muebles pero lo que lo apasiona es crear piezas diferentes, diseñar algo fuera de lo común y esta es un motivo por los cuales tomo como profesión este trabajo, por ello quiere impulsar más su creatividad y desea solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de madera y aerosoles, con lo que espera en sus ratos libres diseñar y fabricar nuevas piezas para atraer mayor público.
texts.en:
Felix is 37 years old and works every day as a carpenter, building and repairing home furniture. His work provides enough income to support his family. He has three children 14, 11, and 4 years of age. All of them are in school, eat well, and are happy, all thanks to their father, who works hard to make sure that's the case.
Recently Felix has gotten a lot of contracts to repair furniture, but his favorite thing is to create different pieces, design something out of the ordinary. That's one of the reasons he pursued this profession. He would like to nurture his creativity and is applying for a loan to invest in buying wood and spray paint, which he will use in his spare time to design and build new pieces to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy wood and spray paint.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is 35 years old. She is married and has a two-year-old child and also a 6-month-old baby. Faustina is a dressmaker and also a water vendor. She has done the water vending business for a year now.

She finds her business lucrative, however, the only problem she faces in this business is water shortages. Since she depends on piped water, she is not able to sell during periods of water shortage because she is not able to store the water. 

Faustina wants to use her loan to purchase a bigger-sized poly tank to store enough water so that in the event of a water shortage, she will be able to sell and earn more income to help her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a bigger-sized poly tank and be able to store water during water shortage periods

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una joven emprendedora del campo de 22 años de edad, ella junto con su esposo salieron a buscar un futuro prometedor para su familia pues tiene un pequeño de 3 años de edad, sus padres no vieron muy bien le hecho de que se marchara con un hombre, pero con trabajo y resultados quiere demostrar que tiene todas las capacidades para salir adelante y darle una buena vida a su hijo.

Su actividad económica es la cría de ganado porcino, inicio hace poco pero gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre tiene los conocimientos para hacer un buen trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para invertir en su actividad como inicio hace poco, solo tiene un espacio donde tiene a los cerdos, quiere construir unas cocheras, con canales de alimentación, bebidas y de limpieza.

Su sueño es progresar y vivir una vida feliz junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is an entrepreneurial young woman of 22. She is from the countryside, and she and her husband have set out in pursuit of a promising future for their family. They have a 3-year-old son. Her parents were not pleased about her decision to go off with a man, but through hard work and success she wants to prove that she is fully capable of getting ahead and giving her son a good life.
She makes a living from raising pigs. She hasn't been in the business long, but thanks to all she learned from her father, she has the knowledge to do a good job.
She is applying for a loan to invest in this business. Since she started only recently, she keeps the pigs in an open pen. She'd like to build pigsties with troughs for feed, water, and bathing.
Her dream is to find success and live a happy life with her family.

loans.use: to build pigsties with troughs for feed, water, and bathing.

loans.name: Oscar Ivan

texts.es:
Oscar Iván es un joven de 28 años, Casado, tiene tres hijos pequeños, se dedica totalmente a la agricultura especialmente a la producción de café 100% orgánico, y productos hortícolas también orgánicos, dado a las bajas producciones de café derivadas de la afección de hongo de la roya en los cafetales Oscar desea diversificar el origen de sus ingresos por lo que quiere construir un invernadero para producir tomates orgánicos los cuales puede comercializar por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio.
La producción de tomate orgánico en invernadero es una actividad novedosa y con excelente mercado, “la producción y venta es fácil con el apoyo de COCAFCAL lo que basta es querer hacer las cosas” dice Oscar Iván.
Su mayor sueño personal es  ver que sus hijos hayan optado a una educación de calidad y verlos superados, es por eso que se esfuerza a diario para poder ofrecerles todo lo que necesiten.
Un crédito ayudara a Oscar Ivan a que su familia tenga mayores oportunidades de desarrollo y una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Oscar Iván is a young man, age 28. He is married, with three small children.  He dedicates himself entirely to agriculture, especially the production of 100% organic coffee, and other organic horticultural products. Given the low production of coffee resulting from the fungal disease called "coffee rust" on the coffee farms,  Oscar wants to diversify his income sources.  That is why he wants to build a greenhouse to grow organic tomatoes that he can sell through COCAFCAL, of which he is a member. 

The production of organic greenhouse tomatoes is a new occupation, with an excellent market. Oscar Iván says, “The production and sale is easy with the support of COCAFCAL, which is enough to want to do things”.

His biggest dream is to see that his children have chosen a quality education, and to see them be successful.  That is why he makes an effort every day in order to be able to offer them everything that they may need. 

A loan will help Oscar Iván, so that his family may have greater opportunities to develop, and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a greenhouse, such as antivirus netting, wood, nylon, and bags of coconut fiber.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est une femme mariée avec trois enfants à sa charge. Jeanne est âgée de 62 ans et travaille dynamiquement pour le bien-être de sa famille. Jeanne vit à Adidogomé pour vendre des pagnes dans les marchés et parcoure les quartiers pour satisfaire ses clients. Pour disposer de ses articles en permanence, Jeanne s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Jeanne demande ce crédit pour commander des pagnes et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a married woman responsible for three children. She is 62 and works hard for the well-being of her family. She lives in Adidogomé and sells pagnes in the markets and on foot through the neighborhoods to satisfy the needs of her clients. 

So as never to be short of inventory, Jeanne buys more pagnes twice a month. She is asking for this loan to order some pagnes and grow her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy six lengths of brightly colored African print cloth (pagnes)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Ruth. She is a smallholder Kenyan farmer making a living off tea and crop farming. She started farming 15 years ago when she tied the knot with her better half. She did it to help her husband put food on the table for their family. 

Ruth had a difficult childhood, growing up in a poor family. She has become hardened to the realities of life, but she is deeply worried about her children's future. She struggles every day to afford education to ensure that her children lead a more comfortable and fulfilling life. With this request, she is seeking 20,000 KES loan to purchase several goats. The goats will give birth to other goats which will generate income for Ruth. Through the loan she will also benefit from manure from the goats. 

Ruth will use the money from the sale of goat's milk to pay for all her expenses; including the loan debt, and her children's education. Ruth’s family will be very grateful for the loan that will go a long way toward improving their lives.

loans.use: To buy several goats to raise

loans.name: Jose Panfilo

texts.es:
José tiene  51 años, separado con un hijo que aún está en el colegio. Hace quince años él se dedica al servicio de transporte de moto taxi. Con los ingresos de su trabajo apoya los gastos de alimentación y educación de su hijo. Su mayor anhelo de José es ahorrar con el propósito de brindarle a su hijo una carrera universitaria. Adquirió el préstamo para hacer un mantenimiento general de su moto taxi.
Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo recibido.
texts.en: José is 51 years old. He is separated, with one son who is still in high school. He has been providing motorcycle taxi transport service for five years, and with the income from his work, he pays for his son’s food and education. His greatest desire is to save in order to provide his son with a university education. He acquired the loan in order to perform general maintenance on his motorcycle taxi. He thanks the Kiva investors for the support he has received.

loans.use: to perform general maintenance on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Balitusuka Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, is a hardworking woman, dealing in cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the businesses to earn income and meet increasing family demands. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business. Aisha has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

She is a member of Balitusuka group where members guarantee one another for a loan since they don't pledge security.

loans.use: To buy cocoa  to sell.

loans.name: La Promesse Group

texts.fr: Mamboleo est commerçante, membre  du groupe de crédit «La promesse», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère 9 enfants dont 6 étudient et 3 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais dans un marché secondaire de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 30kg de poissons frais. Elle souhaite accroitre ses activités, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mamboleo is a small-scale merchant and a member of the loan group called "La promesse", a client of MFI Hekima. She is married, aged 35, and the mother of nine children, of whom six attend school and three are still too young for school. 

Mamboleo began her business with money received from her husband. She has been selling fresh fish at a secondary market in her town for three years.  She is going to buy 30 kg of fresh fish for resale. She  hopes to grow her business, pay school fees, and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are unable to receive conventional loans.

loans.use: to buy 30 kg of fresh fish for resale

loans.name: Kulpat

texts.ru: Кульпат успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива  и всем, кто помог в финансировании. В хозяйстве Кульпат на сегодня есть 2 коровы, 20 овец и 4 лошади. На 2,0 Га арендованной и 1,20 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль, клевер и перец для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 26,000 сом (KGS). Кульпат обратилась вновь в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 лошадей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кульпат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kulpat successfully repaid her loan, using it as planned. She is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with the financing of her loan. Today, Kulpat has 2 cows, 20 sheep and 4 horses on her farm. She grows beans, clover, and peppers for resale on 2.0 hectares of rented land and 1.20 hectares of her own land. Her monthly income is around 26,000 som (KGS). 

Kulpat has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy 2 horses to increase her livestock headcount. Kulpat will invest the proceeds from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount, and she also wants to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy two horses in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Anabell

texts.es:
Anabell es una madre cabeza de familia, tiene 35 años de edad, es agricultora de nacimiento pues, viene de padres campesinos que le enseñaron todo acerca de la profesión y desde el año 2010 es independiente, tiene un campo de fresas el cual le ha permitido generar los ingresos necesarios para mantener su hogar conformado por sus dos hijas de 16 y 5 años de edad.

Verla trabajar es de asombro el empeño, el amor que coloca en sus actividades, realizando el papel de hombre cargando los pesados bultos, es una mujer de admirar.

Anabell quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de semillas e insumos agrícolas, como lo son abonos, pesticidas, insecticidas y gallinaza.

Con el préstamo podrá ganar en lo siguiente, aumento de ventas, aumento de clientes, sostenibilidad del negocio, competitividad, ampliar su cultivo.
texts.en: Anabell is a mother and head of her household.  She is 35 years old and has been a farmer from birth since she comes from a family of farmers who taught her everything about the profession.  Since 2010, she has been independent.  She has a strawberry field which has allowed her to generate the income necessary to maintain her family, made up of her two daughters, ages 16 and 5.  Watching her work, one is amazed by her commitment and the love that she puts into her daily labor, doing the work of a man and carrying heavy loads.  She is a woman to admire.  Anabell is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies, such as compost, pesticides, insecticides, and chicken manure.  With the loan, she will gain the following: increased sales, more customers, sustainability of her business, competitiveness, and an expanded harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies, such as compost, pesticides, insecticides, and chicken manure.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru:
Комилчон 25 лет. Он молодой житель района Гафуров. Комилчон вместе с родителями. Мама дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Отец находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, он был вынужден уехать, чтобы прокормить меленького Комилчона и его мать. Вот уже несколько лет он находится за приделами границей Родины. Комилчон теперь вырос и стал шустрым, самостоятельным и ответственным человеком. Теперь у него есть собственный маленький бизнес. Он принимает заказы на оформление и декора свадебных кортежей и декорации помещений для мероприятий. 
   Комилчон принял решение расширить деятельность. Он хочет привезти больше элементов декорации и больших количествах для оформления. Он сможет принимать больше заказов и увеличить доход. Тогда он создаст устойчивый бизнес с хорошим доходом, чтобы прокормить родителей и сможет вернуть отца на Родину...
texts.en:
Komiljon is 25 years old. He is a young resident of the Ghafurov region. Komiljon lives with his parents. His mother works at home, sewing women's clothing, and his father is in the Russian Federation for work. It was necessary for his father to leave so that he would be able to feed young Komiljon and his mother, and so for many years he has been away from his native country. Komiljon has now grown up and become a very bright, independent and responsible person. He now has his own small business, where he takes orders for the design and decor of wedding processions and decorating rooms for events.

Komiljon has decided to expand his business. He wants to get more decorative items, and in greater quantities, for setting up his decorations, so that he will be able to take more orders and increase his income. He is building a stable business with a good income so that he can support his parents and so that he will be able to bring his father home.

loans.use: to buy decorative items and expand his business.

loans.name: Las Prosperas Group

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 36  años, separada con dos hijas que están estudiando. Hace cinco años Magdalena se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos de catálogos de una marca conocida en el país. En la actualidad está educando a una de sus hijas que estudia en la universidad. Su mayor deseo es lograr que su hija termine la carrera profesional y así seguir apoyando a la menor  hija. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y zapatos para poder aumentar poco a poco su stock y así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.Magdalena esta a lado derecho de la foto viste polo color verde.
Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por haber recibido el apoyo.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 36 years old. She is separated, with two daughters who are in school. For the past five years Magdalena has been selling clothes and shoes from a catalog that are well known brands in her country. Currently she is educating one of her daughters who studies at the university. Her greatest wish is that her daughter finish her professional education and then continue to support her younger daughter. 

She will invest her loan to purchase clothes and shoes in order to increase her stock little by little and in that way offer her customers a better selection. Magdalena is on the right side dressed in the green shirt. She thanks the Kiva investors for the support.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es: Las ganas de salir adelante es lo que caracterizan a Don Fernando, este es el segundo crédito que solicita ya que el anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para comprar los productos farmacéuticos que comercializa. Su esposa siempre le apoya en el negocio en la parte administrativa y contable. En esta ocasión solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar vitaminas y pastillas para prevenir la gripe. De esta manera podrá realizar más ventas y obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su casa y la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en: The desire to get ahead is what characterizes Fernando.  This is the second loan that he is requesting, as the previous one was a great help to him in purchasing the pharmaceutical products that he sells.  His wife always helps him with the administrative and accounting aspects of the business.  On this occasion, he is requesting a new loan to purchase vitamins and pills to prevent the flu.  In this way, he will be able to make more sales, and obtain greater earnings in order to improve his house and his family’s financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and pills to prevent the flu.

loans.name: Isa's Group

texts.en:
Isa is a 64-year-old proud father of nine children. He is often described as a very experienced farmer and serves as the group leader. His group consists of 11 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Isa has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Isa described his harvest last year as very good but believes he can have a better harvest this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Aside from purchasing fertilizer and maize, he is very excited to be purchasing a solar light as it will reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and allow him to save more money. He plans to send his children to school with the profits from this season’s harvest.
 
With this loan, Isa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and a solar light

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim, pictured above, is 53 years old, married, and has ten children. He has been a farmer for 15 years and is proud to represent his group of fourteen farmers from the Butere District. 

Ibrahim thinks of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014. Ibrahim decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. For him, being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Ibrahim plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Ibrahim’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.75 acres of land. The loan will also allow members of his group to purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for his maize crop

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of cattle sale and purchase for the past three years with her husband (also shown in the photo). She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures. For the improvement of her business, Shaheen has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for resale in the market to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Musa is the group leader of his group in Butere District, and he is representing 8 farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of 3 children. Musa joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Musa decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

Musa's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, as, even though Musa decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bela Nabira -Dekpengli Group

texts.en:
Zuweira is a 25-year-old hardworking woman from Dikpengli, which is in the Northern region of Ghana. Zuweira is married and has three children. She is the one raising her hand in the photo.
   
Zuweira is a member of a shea butter processing group named Bela Nabira -Dekpengli. The group has been in business for the last 20 years. Since the  group has been trained by Grameen Ghana and Planet Finance on how to improve their shea butter processing business, they are able to always produce premium quality shea butter for the local and export markets. Therefore, Zuweira is able to earn a good profit from her participation.

Zuweira and Bela Nabira -Dekpengli are asking for a loan of GHS 3,600. Zuweira’s share of the loan is GHS 200, which will help her buy shea nuts to process. The loan will allow Zuweira to earn more income and support her children's educational needs.

Zuweira thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing

loans.name: Suglo Konbo-Dikpengli Group

texts.en:
Awabu is a 35-year-old hard working woman from Dikpengli in the Northern region of Ghana. Awabu is married and has 5 children with 4 of the children attending school. She is the individual pictured with the hand raised among members.

Awabu is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 15 years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo Konbo-Dikpengli’. Awabu earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets around Bimbilla and non-local markets.

Awabu and ‘Suglo Konbo-Dikpengli’ have asked for a loan of GHS 4,400. Awabu’s share of the loan, GHS 200, will help her to buy shea nuts for processing. Awabu would earn more income to repay this loan and support her family with food.

Awabu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her water business by buying more bags of sachet water.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Joseph, who is the group leader (pictured above). He is 43 years old, married and has 4 children. Joseph has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Joseph isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Joseph will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Joseph's Group will purchase a total of 14 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of water to resell to her clients.

loans.name: Modrat

texts.en:
Hard working Modrat is a 23-year-old married mother of three living in Kasese, Uganda. Modrat has been a shoe vendor for three years to earn income for her family. She is faced with the challenges of inflation and market competition. 

Modrat has requested this loan to buy more shoes to sell. She has a dream of expanding her business into a renowned shoe center carrying classic designs.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is 40 years old and married with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a commercial farmer growing crops such as rice, onions, maize, ground nuts and others. He also has a motorcycle transport business and rental houses which supplement his income. He has a dream of having a permanent residential house. Zephanus wants money to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt: A Senhora Ana vive numa casa propria com a filha, sobrinha e um neto, o marido não vive com eles devido a natureza do seu trabalho, é militar e trabalha nas provincias.  É comerciante e com o presente  empréstimo pretende adiquirir mercadoria tal como frangos, rachel, oleo, arroz, refrescos e cerveja. Tem sonho de ganhar um emprego para além de ter o próprio negócio e terminar a sua obra. Tem como maior desafio de melhorar as condições de vida através de mais financiamentos
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own home with her daughter, her niece and a grandchild. Her husband does not live with them due to the nature of his work, as he is in the military and works in more remote rural areas.

Ana works in sales and with this loan she plans to acquire merchandise like chicken, oil, rice, drinks and beer. Her dreams and goals include finding a second job in addition to her business and to finish a construction project. Her main challenge is to improve her family's living conditions and loans can help her achieve this.

loans.use: acquire merchandise like chicken, oil, rice, drinks and beer.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Ricardo Palma Group

texts.es:
Kenyi es una señorita 18 años de edad, hace un año  ella se dedica a la compra y venta de palillo en diferentes terrenos agrícolas de la provincia.  Paralelo a su negocio ella estudia y se encuentra en el tercer ciclo de la carrera de administración de empresas. Ella eligió dicha carrera por tener la capacidad de liderazgo y culminando sus estudios le gustaría administrar su propio negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más palillo ya que tiene vendedores fijos y así ahorrar un poco para sus estudios. Kenyi es la persona que esta a lado izquierdo de la foto viste polo de color celeste y una lycra de color blanco
Ella agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Kenyi is 18 years old and she has been buying and selling knitted articles for a year in various rural areas of the province. Alongside her business she goes to school and is in the third year of a business administration program. She chose this program so that she could acquire leadership ability, and when she has finished her studies she would like to run her own business. She will use the loan to purchase more knitted articles as she has permanent retailers and this way saves a bit for her studies. 

Kenyi appears on the left of the photo wearing a blue T-shirt and white tights. She is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan granted.

loans.use: To buy knitted articles.

loans.name: Annerita

texts.en:
Annerita lives in Mugwe Village, found in the central province of Kenya, which is primarily a banana and tea growing region. She has four cute children with Mr. Felix, her husband. To help her hubby provide for the family, Annerita ventured into farming a decade ago. Over the years, she has brought tremendous growth to the business. Today, she keeps dairy cattle, poultry, and grows maize among other crops. She is also invested in other personal businesses for additional income. 

Annerita enjoys dairy farming the most. She is seeking a loan for zero grazing. Through the loan she will be able to buy food that will assist the animal in zero grazing and increasing milk production. The money Annerita will make from selling the additional milk will help her to repay the debt and pay for her children's education, which is her highest expense.

Help her out!

loans.use: to start zero grazing.

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en:
Eutiquia is 64 years old and married with five children. Eutiquia works very hard to provide for them.

Eutiquia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, snack foods, cereals, etc. to sell.

Eutiquia has been in this business for fourh years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, snack foods, cereals, etc. Eutiquia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, snack foods, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Antony's Group

texts.en:
Antony's Group is formed by 7 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Antony, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. Antony has been a farmer for 8 years and is often referred to as a very resourceful person.

Antony isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Antony will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Antony's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 40-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Peter has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Peter described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Peter’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Butere District. She is 41 years old,  married and the mother of sixchildren.

Margaret likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Margaret plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy more land to cultivate.

In total, Margaret’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sachet water to sell

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 28-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Peter has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Peter described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Peter’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sandra Clelia's Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. La mayoría de los socios se conocen entre si y son responsables. Este es el segundo crédito que Sandra  tiene con el Grupo “Los Puntuales De José Olaya” .Sandra nos comenta que gracias a su crédito anterior  mejoro la economía en su familia y ahora logro alquilar un local donde tiene una pequeña bodega y los fines de semana realiza diferentes actividades (pollada, truchada , parrillada, etc) con el propósito de  brindar a sus hijos  una mejor calidad de vida. El mayor anhelo de Sandra es apoyar en sus estudios superiores de sus hijos.El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos y abarrotes para su bodega. Sandra esta sentada a lado izquierdo de la foto.
Se siente muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad que les brinda los inversionistas  Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is launching its second loan cycle. The majority of the members know one another and are responsible. This is the second loan that Sandra has had with the group “Los Puntuales De José Olaya” 

Sandra says that thanks to the previous loan she improved her family finances and now is managing to rent a location where she has a small grocery store, and on weekends carries on various activities (preparing grilled chicken, grilled trout and other grilled meats), with the aim of providing her children with a better quality of life. Her greatest desire is to help her children with their higher education. She will use the loan to purchase supplies and groceries for her grocery store. Sandra is seated on the left side of the photo. She feels very happy and grateful for the opportunity that the Kiva investors are offering her.

loans.use: To buy supplies and groceries.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a married male with two children. He is living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a shop of general merchandise. He also practices farming, growing crops such as onions, maize, rice and others. Augustine has a dream of expanding his commercial farming business. However, he is faced with a challenge of pests and diseases, plus poor climatic changes. 

Augustine wants money to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa works hard to support her family. Flordelisa is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Flordelisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Flordelisa has been in this business for 25 years now.

Flordelisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 35-year-old married male with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Edward has owned a textile shop for six years; he also deals in crop farming and motorcycle-transport businesses. He has a dream of trading in wholesale and dealing in first-class clothes, although he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. 

Edward wants money to buy shirts, trousers, skirts and children's wear for selling.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shirts, blouses, trousers, and children's wear to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es una mujer de 50 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos ella es una guerrera que genera sus ingresos gracias a su sala de belleza, actualmente trabaja sola, pero aspira que con los cambios que quiere realizar pueda generar empleo y active más las ventas. 

Su actividad principal es el arreglo de uñas, también oferta servicios de peinados y cepillados, dicha actividad la inicio en el año 2012 por necesidad económica, aprendiendo empíricamente en trabajos anteriores. 

Esperanza quiere que la apoyen, ella busca su ayuda pero para progresar, no para mantenerse, quiere proyectar su negocio más allá de lo que normalmente vemos, ahora busca transformar su sala de belleza en un centro de estética y dará sus primeros pasos, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de una camilla, productos y para dar masajes, espera tener su ayuda y que esta actividad traiga prosperidad a su negocio y vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 50, is single with no children.  She is a fighter, who generates her income through her beauty salon.  Currently, she works alone, but she hopes that with the changes that she wants to make, she will be able to generate employment and encourage more sales. 

Manicures are her main activity, but she also offers brushing and styling services. She started doing this work in 2012 out of economic necessity, learning through experience on previous jobs.

Esperanza hopes for your support and she is seeking your help, not in order to maintain herself, but to make progress.  She wants to project her business beyond what we usually see, and now she is looking to transform her beauty salon into a center for esthetics, and she will take her first steps. That is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a massage table and massage products. 

She hopes that she may have your help, and that this activity may bring prosperity to her business and her life.

loans.use: to purchase a massage table and massage products.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida is a 32-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Farida has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Farida described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Farida’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of sachet water to sell to her clients

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa works hard to support her family. Jesusa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jesusa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Jesusa has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 64 years old and single. 

Rosalina has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food-production business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Jhon Sabastian

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, con ánimos, ganas de trabajar de buscar un mejor futuro para él y su familia, estudiar, ser alguien en la vida y ser un ejemplo para las personas de la vereda donde reside.

Inicio son su negocio de cría de ganado porcino en el año 2013, tal y como se puede ver en la foto en un terreno muy pantanoso, barros, pero su idea es ir adecuando poco a poco este sitio para que sea grande e ideal para iniciar con un gran negocio de cría de cerdos.
 
El sueño de este Joven es claro, ser el soporte de su familia y lo más importante ser exitoso, y por ello trabajara y se comprometerá a realizar sus sueños.

Jhon quiere solicitar un préstamo la compra de cerdos, el total del monto le alcanza para comprar 8 cerdos, con esto abastecerá sus cocheras y será el inicio de su camino hacia el éxito, así que anímate y apóyalo.
texts.en:
Jhon is a young entrepreneur, 22 years of age, with spirit, a desire to work in search of future improvement for him and his family, and to study to be something in life – to be an example for others in the community where he resides.

Jhon launched his pig-raising business, initially, in 2013, as can be seen in the picture, on very swampy, muddy land. But his idea is to keep on preparing the land, and little by little, this plot will be good and ideal for initiating a grand pig-raising business.

This young man's dream is clear; it's to be the support for his family and, most importantly, to be successful, and for that he will work and plan until he realizes his dreams.

Jhon wishes to solicit a loan to purchase pigs. The total amount will cover eight pigs. With this Jhon will supply his stables and this will be the beginning of his road to success. It will motivate his and help him towards that end.

loans.use: buy eight pigs and set up proper stables for them.

loans.name: Porperia

texts.en:
Porperia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Porperia is 66 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Porperia has a general store business in the Philippines. Porperia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Porperia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Porperia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy large quantities of sachet drinking water and sell it to her clients

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is 30 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Florence is representing her group of five farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Florence's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore, save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Florence and her group will receive a total of three solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 3 acres.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr: Paul est un homme célibataire sans enfant âgé de 40 ans. Paul vit à Adidogomé pour exercer ses activités. Paul vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques pour trouver son revenu. Cette activité lui permet d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour répondre favorablement à ses besoins quotidiens. Paul s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois auprès de ses distributeurs. Paul demande ce crédit pour acheter des cartes de recharge afin d’avoir de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et réaliser une rentabilité favorable.
texts.en:
Paul is a forty-year-old single man without children. He lives in Adidogomé where he conducts his business.

Paul retails prepaid credit card to generate his revenues. This business allows him to make the necessary profit to provide fir his daily needs. Paul procures his supplies five times a month from his distributors.

Paul is requesting this loan to buy prepaid cards to offer to his clients, and to reach a favorable profitability.

loans.use: to buy 34 prepaid calling cards

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and five of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells dried fish at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more fish. Her major challenges include the perishability of fish and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy dried fish

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar es una morena de 44 años de edad, ella es residente de la zona de Sincelejo, que es una zona de pobreza y de conflicto, pero sin importar esto la señora María del Pilar se levanta todos los días con una gran sonrisa en su rostro agradeciendo que tiene trabajo y que puede mantener con la ayuda de su esposo su numerosa familia conformada por 9 hijos, lo sorprendente de este caso es la edad de sus hijos pues el mayor tiene 32 años, fue madre desde los 12 años de edad, batallando diariamente por sacar adelante a su familia.

María del pilar se dedica a la confección directa es esta lo que le ayudo en momentos difíciles y ha prevalecido en el tiempo, quiere mejorar y prosperar junto con su familia, ya le toco los momentos difíciles, ahora está segura de que vendrán gratos momentos llenos de rentabilidad para su negocio.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de telas.
texts.en:
María del Pilar is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Sincelejo, an area of poverty and conflict. Unfazed by this, however, María del Pilar gets up every day with a bright smile on her face, grateful that she has a job and that, with the help of her husband, she can support her large family of nine children. The surprising thing about this case is the age of her children - the eldest is 32 years old. She has been a mother since she was twelve, struggling every day to provide for her family.

María del Pilar works as a dressmaker. Her occupation is what has helped her in difficult moments and been with her all along. She wants to improve and thrive together with her family. She has had her share of difficult moments; now she is sure that more pleasant times are coming, filled with success for her business.

She would like to request a loan which she will invest entirely in the purchase of fabric.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fabric.

loans.name: Dancile

texts.en:
Dancile is 57 years old. She is married with six children aged between 9 and 23 years. They all go to school. Dancile is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 11 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different brands of sachet water and sell them in order to meet the demands of her clients.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 58 years old and married with four children. Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, noodles, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, noodles, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, noodles, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Abner

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería en los diferentes cultivos de su distrito y zonas cercanas, se dedica a este negocio desde hace más de 10 años, cuenta con experiencie en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de nuevas herramientas como palanas, baldes, sogas, entre otras, para implementar su negocio, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darles una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 29, is common-law married with two dependent children. He lives in his own house in a rural zone in the Oyotún District. It is a community devoted to agriculture and to raising animals, located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region of Peru’s northern coast. He provides day labor service for various farms in his district and in nearby zones.  He has been in this business for more than ten years. He has experience in the business, and good personal and work references in the zone. 

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of new tools, such as shovels, buckets, rope, and other things, in order to conduct his business. This will help him to keep his tools in better condition and give them a better appearance so that he can provide better service to his clients. This will increase his income level, thereby improving his quality of life, and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new tools, such as shovels, buckets, rope, and other things, in order to conduct his business.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 45 years old and has six children. Melodina is married and three of her children are currently in school.
