Melodina is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Melodina has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Melodina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Melodina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 58 years old, married and has four children.  

Paulina is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Paulina has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Paulina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Paulina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine 32 years old. She is married with three children who are aged between three and seven years. They all go to school. 

Claudine is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past nine years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Quesie

texts.en:
Quesie is age 47. She is married with five children between 7 and 22 years old. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 11 years. Her husband is a farmer also. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en:
Leoncie is 53 years old. She is married with seven children between 14 and 30 years old, four of whom go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past six years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 59 years old. She is married with five children aged between 17 and 38 years, three of whom go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past seven years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packaged food products and cologne in greater volume.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 49 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, and fattens pigs in the Philippines. Rosario requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Rosario has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Rosario would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, Adjovi vit avec ses quatre enfants. Adjovi une femme mariée et âgée de 32 ans. Adjovi est revendeuse de charbon de bois qui gagne son revenu journalier grâce à cette activité. Adjovi stock les charbons dans sa maison et livre ensuite aux clients qui viennent en chercher. Adjovi s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons, Adjovi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer un revenu favorable pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjovi lives with her four children in the district of Adidogomé. She is married and thirty-two years old. She retails charcoal, and make her daily revenues thanks to her business.

Adjovi stocks charcoal in her house and delivers it to clients, or they come get it. Adjovi procures her supplies at the market, twice a month. She is requesting this loan to buy new bags of charcoal and to reach a profitability beneficial to her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy 49 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 43 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Lydia, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 25 years old, is married and has four children. Lydia has been a farmer for three years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Lydia isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farm training. 

This year, Lydia will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Lydia's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 39 years old. She is married with four children who are aged between three and fourteen years. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past seven years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing and to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and all five of her children are in school.

Hilda is in the agricultural business, and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Hilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy technology items such as USBs, microchips, etc.

loans.name: Baumoja Group

texts.en:
Rose is a member of Baumoja Group where members guarantee one another for a loan. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, and she is a hardworking woman dealing in market vending and cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the businesses to earn income and meet increasing family demands.

Rose is challenged by bad weather, competition, and limited capital that hinders the expansion of her cocoa business. Rose has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa seeds to dry and  sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for drying to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of sachet drinking water to resell it to her customers.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 52 years old and is a widow (she lost her husband a couple of months ago, that is why she is still dressed in black). She has her own house. Felisa lives with her grandchildren and she takes care of them because the parents work. Felisa attends her grocery store everyday. Felisa needs a loan to build a bathroom at her house. That is absolutely necessary so she hopes you can help her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
For the past fifty years Lolita has worked hard making and selling food in the Philippines. She also earns more income from her sari-sari, or general store.

Lolita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for the food she sells. She has been successful in her business through her own efforts and with the help of NWTF loans. She is always working to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she makes and sells.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en: Magnolia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 5 years, she has operated a vegetable sales business in the Philippines. Magnolia has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. In the future, Magnolia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Gloria is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and items for her food vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and items for her food vending business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.es: Geraldine de 19 años de edad es la propietaria de una peluquería, negocio que heredó de su madre quien se lo cedió para que fuera independiente en la generación de sus ingresos y está muy relacionado con su carrera de contaduría pública. El mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional es la misión de Geraldine y para ello ofrece servicios de tratamientos capilares, blowers, corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure etc.   Los principales clientes son los visitantes del centro de la ciudad a quienes les ofrece los servicios de contado y para quienes impulsa diariamente el buen servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos  y productos para la venta como  tintes, shampoo, productos capilares  etc. Con esta inversión tendrá más inventarios que impulsaran visiblemente sus ventas y harán de su credikiva una inversión exitosa. Su meta más adelante es tener una vivienda propia e incrementar los activos fijos, a fin de impactar con calidad el servicio a su clientela, quienes son los que impulsan el aumento de sus ingresos.
texts.en: Geraldine is 19 years old. She is the owner of a hair salon, a business that she inherited from her mother who gave it to her so she could be independent in generating her income. It is also very related to her major in public accounting. Geraldine’s mission is to improve her personal and professional image, and to do that she offers hair treatment services, blowouts, haircuts, manicures, pedicures, etc. Her main customers are visitors from downtown to whom she offers services for cash and for whom she is motivated to give good service each day. She is currently applying for a credikiva, the first loan that she has made with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy supplies and products to sell such as dyes, shampoo, hair products, etc. With this investment she will have more inventory, which will visibly drive her sales and make her credikiva a successful investment. Her goal for the future is to have her own home and to increase her fixed assets in order to impact the quality of service to her customers, who are the ones that drive the rise of her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies and products to sell such as dyes, shampoo, hair products, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in her meat stall for her meat vending business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 30 years. Evangeline earns more income from food vending.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her meat stall

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 29 years old. She is married with two children aged between 2 and 4 years, and they do not yet go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past five years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sachet water and resell it in order to increase her income

loans.name: Agathe

texts.en:
Agathe, 38, is married and has four children aged between three and ten years old; two of them go to school. For the past seven years she has farmed maize; her husband is a farmer as well.

With the 1,260,270 RWF loan through Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will use her profits for the family’s welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
45 ans, Justine a 2 filles de 19 et 17 ans qui vont toutes actuellement à l'université. Elle est divorcée, donc elle assume seule la vie familiale surtout ses 2 filles.
Malgré sa situation, elle ne se plaint pas, elle est combative. C'est une femme travailleuse  infatigable.
Comme source de revenu, elle commençait à vendre des vêtements fripes, il y a 16 ans. Et au fil du temps, elle investissait pas à pas sur beaucoup d'autres marchandises comme sacs de voyages et sacs dame, des ustensiles en plastique, des produits de beauté et cosmétiques ( cf sa photo).
Justine a besoin d'augmenter ses revenus pour faire face à ses responsabilités par exemple le frais de scolarisation universitaire est beaucoup plus cher, ce qui justifie sa demande de crédit.
En plus, elle veut voir ses filles finir leurs études jusqu'au bout et avoir de bonne carrière.
texts.en: 45 years old, Justine has two children who are 17 and 19 years old and who both currently attend university. She is divorced, so she alone takes care of the family's lifestyle, especially for her two girls. Despite her situation, she does not complain. She is full of fight. She is a tireless working woman. As a source of revenue, she started to sell used clothing 16 years ago. Over time, she invested in many other products step by step, such as travel bags and women's bags, plastic utensils, beauty and cosmetic products (see photo). Justine needs to increase her revenues in order to face her responsibilities, such as the school costs of the university, which are very expensive, and which justify her loan request. What's more, she wants to see her daughters finish their studies right to the end and have good careers.

loans.use: to purchase travel bags, plastic utensils, some different clothes, some beauty products and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee, aged 50, is married and has 5 children aged between 7 and 16 years, three of them attending school. She is a farmer who has been growing maize for the past 7 years. Fortunee's husband is a businessman. Fortunee would like to use her loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow maize

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice  is 42 years old. She is married with four children aged between 3 and 13 years. Three of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past seven years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for growing maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more water sachets--personal-sized bags of drinking water--to sell.

loans.name: Venancie

texts.en:
Venancie, 47, is married and has four children between the ages of eleven and 22 years old. For the past six years she has farmed maize. Her husband is a farmer as well.

Venancie is applying for a 1,337,233 RWF loan through Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy fertilizer for her maize fields. She will use her profits for her family’s benefit.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her maize fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, corn, cheese, among other inputs.

loans.name: Nozil

texts.ru: Нозил 42 лет. Он житель города Душанбе. Нозил женат и имеет детей. Он 3.5 лет продвигает торговую деятельность. Нозил  научился правильно общаться с клиентами и вести данный бизнес.  У него есть торговая точка, где он занимается продажей мужской одежды. Нозил продает футболки, джинсы, свитеры и разные одежды.  Он решил расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Нозил надеется с увеличением товара, увеличиться доход, по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. На счет денег он перевозит ассортимент товаров.
texts.en: Nozil is 42.  He's a resident of the city of Dushanbe.  Nozil is married and has children.  He's been running a retail business for 3.5 years.  Nozil has learned how to properly deal with customers and manage his business.  He has a space to sell his wares, which consist of men's clothing.  Nozil sells T-shirts, jeans, sweaters and various other kinds of clothing.  He's decided to expand his business and increase his stock of goods.  He hopes that expanding his offering will allow him to increase his income, and has requested a loan to help with this goal.  He'll use the money from the loan to ship in a variety of wares.

loans.use: expand his business and ship in a variety of goods for stocking his store

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es: Emilce de 61 años tiene un taller de confecciones en el que ofrece a su clientela servicios de costura, mediante ventas de contado y a crédito. Ella tiene como meta ampliar su taller más adelante y hacer adecuaciones locativas en su vivienda,  para generar un mayor sosiego familiar. Entre sus productos más frecuentes está el servicio de maquila, la elaboración de vestidos y los arreglos, pues en esta última temporada  le ha generado mucha más rotación de efectivo, ofrecer este último servicio mencionado. Cuando inició su negocio hace 30 años, lo hizo habiéndose preparado para ello, pues estudió técnicamente cada proceso en academias. Emilce siempre ha trabajado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, para conseguir todas sus metas y aun  así tiene sueños por  cumplir. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un mayor volumen de telas que incrementará la producción y le ayudará a ofrecer su servicio a todo costo como ingreso adicional y permanente, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Emilce at 61 years of age has a sewing workshop where she offers her clients sewing services through cash sales and on credit. She has a goal of expanding her workshop in the future and making modifications in her house to generate greater family well-being.

Amongst her most frequent services are machine work, making clothing and alterations. In this past season she has had a great turnover in money offering the above services. When she began the service 30 years ago she worked having the pieces prepared for her and then she studied the processes technically in academies. Emilce always works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening to meet all her goals and she still has dreams to fulfill.

Currently she is requesting a loan from Kiva the first loan she has had through la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy a greater volume of fabric to increase her production and this will help her to offer her services at all costs as additional and permanent income. This will make it a successful Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume of fabric.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, 46 years old, is married and has six children, all in school. Elsie works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Elsie has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as rice, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, lotion, bath soap, sanitary pads, diapers, etc. 

Elsie has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. In the future, Elsie would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita, 52 years old, is married and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, Juanita has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from raising livestock. 

Juanita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. Juanita has previously borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Consessa

texts.en:

Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, Consessa would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 34 years old, is single and has a 3-year-old son. For the past six years, she has operated a business selling toiletries, soft drinks and sachet drinking water. According to Lydia, the demand for her water is very high since her shop is by the street. However, her income is not enough to enable her to expand the business. With this loan, Lydia will be able to buy more sachet and bottled drinking water to sell and earn enough income to cater for the needs of her son and her mother.

loans.use: To buy bags of sachet drinking water and bottled water for resale

loans.name: Tanzanite Grp Group

texts.en:
Sara is in her early 40s, married and has five children who are still in school. For ten years now, she has had a cereals business. She sells from 07am to 09pm each working day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fourth credit request to be apportioned to the two member Tanzanite group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous loans, since successfully repaid to restock cereals. She managed to sell all her stock and earned additional income which she used to plow back into her business in order to grow it. She dreams of expanding her business by selling more cereals.

With this credit request, Sara will invest to buy stock of cereals for her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cereals for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the fast-moving items in her grocery shop, such as mangos, oranges, tomatoes, pineapple, melon, etc.

texts.en: Araceli is a 27-year-old businesswoman from Oroquieta, who runs a little store. She earns a meager income that helps support her husband in raising their family. Araceli is a full fledged member of PMPC, and has previously taken several loans. She has maintained her membership in good standing, without records of default. She has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, and other consumable items. Araceli continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, and other consumable items

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es: Ana se siente agradecida con su credikiva anterior pues con él pudo comprar papelería, accesorios femeninos que vendió rápidamente por tener un mayor inventario aumentando sus utilidades. Ana está muy feliz y quiere manifestar que adquirió su propia vivienda y está más motivada a continuar produciendo para genera más bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  mediante el cual comprará cosméticos y papelería para llenar su negocio de nuevas mercancías y vender mucho haciendo nuevamente de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Ana is grateful for her previous Kiva loan, as with it she was able to buy school supplies and women's accessories, which she sold quickly, increasing her profits by having a larger inventory. 

Ana is very happy and wants to say that she has acquired her own home, and is more motivated to continue producing in order to create a better quality of life.  Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, through which she will buy cosmetics and school supplies for stocking her business with new merchandise and selling more, making her Kiva loan again a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and school supplies.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 36 years old and has three children. Roselyn is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Roselyn has been in pig fattening for six years, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosie Alma

texts.en:
Rosie Alma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosie Alma is 46 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Rosie Alma has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Rosie Alma requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Rosie Alma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosie Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 42 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, Vivian works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, cereals, noodles, bath soap, diapers, etc. to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, cereals, noodles, bath soap, diapers, etc. 

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, cereals, noodles, bath soap, diapers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita de 57 años habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad, donde hace 20 años tiene un taller de confecciones y vende mercancías variadas, con el fin de generar ingresos que aumenten la calidad de vida de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos hoy adultos. Cuando inició actividades comerciales y puso su taller de confecciones al servicio del público, fue determinante la necesidad de genera ingresos para apoyar el sustento familiar, Hoy tiene metas de mejoramiento de la imagen empresarial y debe responder al desafío de encontrar fuentes de financiación para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como tela, pellon, botones y aplicaciones, para aumentar la productividad y mejorar sus inventario de ropa. Su inversión será exitosa, en tanto que incrementa la potencialidad de sus ventas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Jovita is 57 and lives in a municipality in the city's metropolitan area, where she has had a dressmaking workshop for 20 years. She sells a variety of  merchandise, with the aim of generating income to increase their family's quality of life. Her family is made up of her spouse and their two children, now adults. 

When she started her commercial activities and set up her sewing workshop to serve the public, the determining factor was the need to generate income for supporting her family. Today she has goals of improving her business's appearance and must respond to the challenge of finding sources for financing, in order to improve the circumstances of her business. 

Currently she is applying for a kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy materials and supplies such as fabric, trimming, buttons and appliques, in order to increase her productivity and improve her inventory of clothing. Her investment will be successful as long as she is increasing her potential for sales, thereby making her kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: Materials and supplies such as fabric, trimming, buttons and appliques.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Frodouard

texts.en:
Frodouard is a 43-year-old married man, with five children between the ages if 9 and 19, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer, and has been growing rice for the past 10 years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, Frodouard would like to buy more fertilizer. He will use the profits from his  business to pay school fees for his children, and to buy a cow.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Esteban

texts.es:
Juan Esteban es un joven con ímpetu y ganas de progreso que trabaja en una barbería una idea de negocio que inicio por vocación al trabajo independiente buscando ser el pilar económico de su familia, aprendido del trabajo gracias a clases y capacitaciones a las cuales asistió y desde el año pasado tiene su negocio operando en un local arrendado.

Este sorprendente joven brinda tres empleos, su familia está constituida por su pareja y un hijo de 8 años de edad, vive con sus padres y trata de ser muy eficiente y buen trabajador para lograr proyectarse y expandirse en el sector.

Su sueño es tener sostenibilidad del negocio, poder comprar el local donde se encuentra operando, comprar una casa y darle a su hijo educación y un hogar estable.

Juan Esteban se encuentra solicitando un préstamo pensando un poco en su local y la forma en como lo ven los clientes, por ello quiere invertir en adecuaciones como pintura, comprar adhesivos de grafitis y personas representativas de música urbana para ambientar su barbería, también quiere comprar un tv plasma y un sonido envolvente.
texts.en:
Juan Esteban is a young man with momentum and a desire to progress. He works in a barbershop, a business idea that he started because of a calling in independent work. He is trying to be the economic mainstay of his family. He learned this work thanks to classes and training that he attended. He has been operating his business in a rented space since last year.

This surprising youth provides three jobs. His family is comprised of his partner and an 8 year old son. He lives with his parents and tries to be very efficient and a hard worker in order to achieve, move forward and expand in the sector.

His dream is to have a sustainable business, be able to buy the location where he operates, buy a home and give his son an education and a stable homestead.

Juan Esteban, in thinking a bit about his business and the way in which customers see it, requests a loan. Therefore, he wants to invest in improvements like paint and buy stickers of stencils and of people representing urban music for decorating his barbershop. He also wants to buy a plasma TV and surround sound.

loans.use: to invest in paint, buy stencil stickers, a plasma TV and surround sound.

loans.name: Baraka Office Group

texts.fr: Sabimana est commerçante, membre d’un collectif de crédit «Baraka Office», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 38 ans, mère 7 enfants  tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son ancien mari. Elle est vendeuse de fournitures de bureau et propriétaire d’une papeterie  au marché de la ville depuis 11 ans. Elle va acheter papiers, stylos, agrafeuses, perforateurs, etc. Elle  souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Sabimana is a merchant, member of the "Baraka Office" loan association, and a client of the Hekima MFI. She is 38 years old, divorced, and the mother of seven children, all of whom attend school.

She started her business with funds received from her ex-husband. She sells office supplies and has owned a stationery shop in the city market for eleven years. She wants to buy paper, pens, staplers, hole punchers, etc.

She wants to increase her credit loan, educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy paper, pens, staplers, hole punchers, etc.)

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.fr: Nyenyezi est une commerçante, membre du collectif de crédits «Imani», âgée de 39 ans, mariée à un technicien, mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers habillement dans un magasin de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des jupes, vestes, pantalons, chemises, sous vêtements, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Nyenyezi is a merchant, and member of the "Imani" loan association. She is 39 years old, married to a technician, and the mother of five children all attending school.

She has been selling a variety of clothing articles in one of the city's stores over the past 10 years.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her activities. She wants to buy skirts, jackets, pants, shirts, underwear, etc.

She wants to build a house, educate and feed her children, and she thanks Hekima for the support given to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: Buy skirts, jackets, pants, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Marie Clémentine

texts.fr:
50 ans, mariée à un gargotier, Marie Clémentine a trois enfants dont deux déjà mariés et le dernier qui a 15 ans va au collège.
Marie Clémentine vend des vêtements fripes, il y a déjà 5 ans pour aider son mari à soutenir sa famille
Pour développer son activité, elle demande  un prêt et avec lequel elle va acheter une gosse balla de friperie.
Son projet est de faire des ventes en gros car c'est beaucoup plus bénéfique par rapport à la vente en détail.
Donc il faut qu'elle investisse davantage.
Actuellement, la famille habite dans une maison en héritage  pas encore partagé et rêve d'avoir sa propre maison. En plus Marie Clémentine veut un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants. Et pour y parvenir, elle pense épargner davantage avec le fruit de son activité.
texts.en:
50 years old and married to an innkeeper, Marie Clementine has three children, of whom two are already married and the last 15-year-old attends high school. Marie Clementine has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years, to help her husband support her family.

To expand her business, she is requesting a loan she will use to buy a large bale of used clothing. Her project is to become a wholesaler because it is much more profitable compared to retail sales. Therefore she must invest more.

The family currently lives in a house from an undivided heritage and dream of having their own home. In addition to this Marie Clementine wants to ensure a better future for her children. To achieve that she hopes to put more of her activity's profits into savings.

loans.use: buy a large bale of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy ingredients for catering

loans.name: Gulzina

texts.ru: Гульзина, 35 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, работает медицинской сестрой в районной больнице. Также уже много лет она занимается разведением скота и полеводством. У Гульзины в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 12 овец. Она очень спокойная и трудолюбивая. Ее ежемесячная прибыль с учетом заработной платы составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзина обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также на обучение детей в университете.
texts.en:
Gulzina is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education, and she works as a nurse at the regional hospital. She has also raised cattle and grown crops for many years. Today, Gulzina's farm has 12 sheep. She is very easy-tempered and hardworking. Her monthly income, including the wages from her job, is about 15,000 som (KGS). 

To further expand her business, Gulzina has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. She plans to use the proceeds from her loan to develop her farm, and also for her children's university education.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Tablon Central Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tablón Central” is located in a small village near the bustling town of Sololá above Lake Atitlan. Most of the population speak the Mayan dialect Kakchiquel and some Spanish.

The President of the Trust Bank is 38-year-old Santos who has been a widow for 16 years and has raised three teenage children. She sent each to elementary school. As sole provider for the family, she works hard to meet their needs. She is in her fifth loan cycle. Her previous loans have greatly helped her with her jewelry business. Santos has made many beautiful beaded items that she has been able to successfully sell. Currently, along with a sister-in-law, Santos has a small restaurant that the pair began eight months ago. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase corn, beans, rice and other staples including firewood. Her goals are to offer a wider menu and attract more customers.

The ladies of the Trust Bank are hungry for knowledge about the world around them and within them as most have had little or no education. Each month at their meetings, they transact business on their loans and then participate in non-formal educational trainings. A recent topic was goals and dreams and the women had a lot of fun thinking of them. Other subjects include money management, business tools (accounting, budgeting, marketing), women’s rights as well as health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of these educational trainings and small loans “Microcredit Plus.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for your generosity and kindness in funding loans for women like Santos. The women of the “Tablón Central” Trust Bank are taking steps toward a brighter, more prosperous and happier future with their new tools. We will report on their progress.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, rice and other staples including firewood. Her goals are to offer a wider menu and attract more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy potash

loans.name: Ma. Cris

texts.en:
Ma. Cris is from Oroquieta City, in the Philippines. She is 51 years old and is married. She owns and manages a retail store business selling shoes, sandals, bags, and clothing for the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns a good income each month, enabling her to provide for the needs of her family.

Ma. Cris joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Ma. Cris is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory of various items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of various items to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Arlene has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell to her customers.

Corazon has been in this business for 20 years now.

Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 46 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Delma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Delma has been raising livestock for 16 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy tomatoes

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 42 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hoa works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having money to repair her latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hoa hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 66 years old and married with two children.

Margarita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Margarita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Margarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 32 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Felipa has been in pig fattening for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending and gasoline retailing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like tricycle passenger and poultry businesses.

Zaida dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling mangoes in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more mangoes to sell for her business selling mangoes.

Thelma has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic kitchen utensils

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 50 años habita en un municipio cerca de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 10 a 22 años. Ana es una experta confeccionista de hace 30 años, que inició su negocio en el año 2005, cuando continuando la tradición de su familia decidió genera ingresos mediante este bello arte. Ana arregla vestidos, pantalones y todo lo que su clientela necesite hacer, también produce vestidos a todo costo y también los clientes llevan a su taller los insumos y materias primas para que  produzca ropa sobre medidas. Su trabajo lo desarrolla des de las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde durante todos los días y compra a proveedores especializados de confecciones para poder ofrecer precios competitivos y productos de calidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tela en un mayor volumen, con el fin de disminuir los costos de producción y ofrecer un servicio a todo costo, haciendo de su Credikiva una inversión exitosa. Su meta más adelante es genera empleos y sueña con que sus hijos gocen de un bienestar cada vez mayor y su mayor desafío es aumentar sus ingresos para lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and lives in a district near the city with her partner and their 4 children of between 10 and 22. 

For the last 30 years, Ana has been an expert seamstress and she started her business in 2005 when, continuing the family tradition, she decided to make an income through doing this beautiful art. Ana repairs dresses, trousers and anything else that her customers need her to do. In addition, she makes dresses at a fair price and her customers also bring materials to her workshop and she makes them customised clothes. 

She works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon every day of the week and she buys from providers who specialise in dressmaking so that she can offer competitive prices and quality products. 

At the moment, she is applying to CREDIKIVA for her first loan that the Mario Santo Domingo foundation are offering and she will use the loan to buy materials in bigger quantities so she can reduce the production costs and offer a service at a fair price. This will make sure that her CREDIKIVA loan is a successful investment.

Her goal in the future is to have employees and she dreams of improving her children's wellbeing. Her biggest challenge is increasing her income to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Muyange Group

texts.fr:
Pascal fait partie du groupe  Muyange et  habite à  Bujumbura .Il 47ans et est mariée à Azèle,  une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 7 à 18 ans, tous étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant membre de sa famille élargie qui étudie.
Il est tailleur depuis  20 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de tissus  pour la confection des habits à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une vache, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Pascal is a member of the Muyange Group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 47 years old and married to Azèle, who is a farmer.  Together they have five children aged between seven and eighteen years.  All their children currently attend school.  He is also responsible for another child from within his extended family, who is also studying.

Pascal has been a tailor for twenty years.  This will be his fourth loan with the field partner, Turame.  The loan will increase his working capital and allow him to buy a lot of fabric to make clothes for sale.

In the coming years, Pascal would like to buy a cow and see his children continue to study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of fabric for making clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, cassava and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Bumbiri Group

texts.fr:
Tharcisse fait partie du groupe Bumbiri et  habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 45 ans et est marié à Antoinette, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants l'un a 2 et l'autre 32 ans.
Il fait le commerce de vélos et  ses pièces de rechanges  depuis  14 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de pièces de rechanges des vélos, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une terre cultivable.
texts.en:
Tharcisse is a member of the Bumbiri Group and lives in Cibitoke.  He is 45 years old and married to Antoinette, who is a retailer.  Together they have two children who are two and thirty-two years old.  

Tharcisse has been selling bicycle spare parts for fourteen years.  This will be his fourth loan with the field partner, Turame.  The loan will increase his working capital and allow him to buy a lot of spare parts for sale.

In the coming years, Tharcisse would like to buy some land on which to grow crops.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Gilberte Edwige Irmine

texts.fr:
36 ans, mariée, Gilberte a 4 enfants de 14, 10, 9, et 4 ans qui vont tous à l'école (privée).
L'activité génératrice de revenu de la famille est fabrication et vente des salons en simili-cuir (fauteuils et canapés).
En fait, c'est le mari qui effectue la menuiserie (la fabrication) et Gilberte assure la vente et cherche des commandes. L'exercice de cette activité dure déjà 14 ans. Le mari a suivi une formation et travaillait comme employé avant  qu'ils ont monté leur propre affaire donc a de l'expérience.
Elle est très créative. elle cherche toujours de nouveau décor ou modèle pour se distinguer des autres fabricants.
C'est une famille très soudée , aime s'entraider et travailler ensemble. 
Soutenir les enfants dans leurs études est sa première préoccupation afin qu'ils auront de meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
Gilberte is 36 years old, married and has four children, aged fourteen, ten, nine and four years old.  All of her children attend private school.  The family business makes and sells imitation leather living room furniture (armchairs and couches).  Gilberte's husband makes the furniture and she is responsible for sales.  They have run this business for fourteen years now.  Her husband did his training and worked for another company before deciding to open his own business.  

Gilberte is very creative and continually searches for new product ideas and designs to keep them ahead of their competitors.  This whole family is closely bonded together and work hard to support one another.

Gilberte's main preoccupation in life is the good education of her children as this will ensure them a better future.

loans.use: to buy wood, foam, nails, glue and fabric for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Kulpan

texts.ru: Кулпан, 51 год, замужем, есть 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает медицинской сестрой в больнице. Кулпан в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, в 1994 году начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Она приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы , 7 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,50 ГА, где ежегодно Кулпан выращивает кукурузу. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец для откорма с последующей реализацией. В будущем, она планирует расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Kulpan is 51 years old, and married with four children. She has a higher education, and works as a nurse in a hospital. Kulpan is in search of an additional source of income, and in 1994 she began breeding livestock and cultivating crops. She has made every effort to expand her business, and today there are two cows and seven sheep on the farm. In addition, Kulpan has an area of land measuring 0.50 hectares, where she grows maize every year. In order to further expand her business, she applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) in order to buy steers and sheep for fattening and subsequent sale. In the future, she plans to expand her area of business.

loans.use: to buy steers and sheep in order to increase her amount of livestock.

loans.name: Kunduzoy

texts.ru: Кундузой умная женщина в возрасте 59 лет. Она замужняя женщина и имеет шестерых  детей. Они живут всей семей в деревне и занимаются колхозным хозяйством. У нее неплохой заработок, но все же на необходимые условия недостаточны чтобы осуществить все свои мечты. Ее муж также вносит свой вклад в семейный бюджет. У Кундузой большие планы и надежды, но для всего этого нужны средства. Ее муж хочет уезжать за границу на заработки. В данный момент у них не хватает суммы для покупки авиабилета. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд для получение кредита и заранее благодарит за поддержку и понимание!!!
texts.en: Kunduzoy is an intelligent 59 year old woman. She is a married and has five children. She lives with her whole family in the countryside and they work in collective farming. Her income is good, but there are not enough necessary means for her to achieve all of her dreams. In addition, her husband makes a contribution to the family budget. Kunduzoy has big plans and hopes, but for these she needs funds. Her husband wants to emigrate abroad to earn money. At the moment, they do not have enough money to buy an airplane ticket. For this reason, she applied to Arvand for a loan, and offers thanks in advance for the support and understanding!

loans.use: to buy a ticket.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
Emperatriz is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a lumber business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a tricycle taxi.  Emperatriz is borrowing 27,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of hardwood to sell.

Emperatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hardwood for her lumber business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a mango selling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more mangos to sell from her fruit stand.

Lilibeth has been in this business for two years and also earns more income from fattening pigs. She has been sustaining her businesses through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more mangos to sell

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Mr kodjo pour apporter son bien - être à sa famille( enfant et sa femme)revend depuis 2000 des produits d'alimentation et fait en même temps de l'élevage. Son quatrième crédit lui servira d'acheter des produits d'alimentation afin de répondre aux besoins des clients.  Il souhaite à l'avenir, agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il est âgé de 50ans.
texts.en: In order to contribute to his family's well-being (his wife and child), Kodjo has been selling groceries since 2000; at the same time he raises animals. His fourth loan will be used to buy groceries so he can meet customer demand. In the future he would like to expand his business and provide for his family's needs. He is 50 years old.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Peati

texts.en:
Peati is 41 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as toiletries, food stocks, drinks, snacks, etc. She has been doing this for four years. 

Peati needs a loan to buy a new freezer, bags of flour, bags of sugar, boxes of mutton, boxes of chickens, boxes of noodles, etc. 

She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and add more new products to her business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer, boxes of chickens, boxes of mutton, boxes of noodles, bags of flour, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to to pay for school and office supplies to sell at her store. Through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of office/school supplies to expand her product inventory and some grocery items as well, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Rosalie dreams of having a bigger school/office supplies and general store someday. She aims to give her only child the best education to allow her better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for school and office supplies such bond and photo paper, notebooks, pad paper and pencils to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 54 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries for her store, such as snack food and canned goods.

Luzminda has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from tailoring. She aspires to save money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 59 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jessica has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melba is 49 years old and has one child who is in school.

Melba has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy an additional stock of firewood to sell.

Melba has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Quina

texts.en:
Quina is 42 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Quina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Quina has been in pig fattening for 12 years and also earns additional income from selling mangoes.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Fantcheyi

texts.fr: Madame Fantcheyi âgée de 32ans vit avec son mari et leurs enfants de 12ans à Lomé. Elle revend depuis 2012 des céréales, des ignames à domicile et s'approvisionne dans les villes de l'intérieur du pays. A l'avenir, elle souhaite subvenir aux besoins de la famille et agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Fantcheyi is 32 years old and lives with her husband and their 12-year old children in Lomé. She has been selling cereals and yams from home since 2012 and gets her supplies in inland towns. In the future she would like to be able to provide for her family's needs and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and yams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and seeds.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 45-year-old married woman with two children who attend school. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen has run a general store for 16 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

She sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Helen would like to save money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of food products to resell.

loans.name: Lalotoa

texts.en:
Lalotoa is a 33-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has run a small business to sell pancakes and  donuts in her community  for 4 years. 

Lalotoa has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, and cooking oil. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. 

Lalotoa will use her earnings to extend her business and financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, and  cooking oil.

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
Elvio es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está cursando el cuarto año de la carrera Ingeniería Informática en una de las mejores universidades, su aspiración es recibirse y así poder trabajar y, su meta es trabajar en una empresa importante y sobresalir en su profesión. 
Él es una persona muy luchadora que quiere poder salir adelante e ir creciendo cada día. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Elvio is from the city of Paraguari. He is studying 4th year of a Computer Engineering degree at one of the best universities. His aspiration is to graduate and then start work and his goal is to work for an important company and stand out in his profession. He is a determined person who wants to advance and grow every day. He is requesting this loan to pay his university fees, in order to be able to continue studying as he has been. He is grateful for this opportunity to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene como objetivo recibirse como ingeniero en sistema informática, su mayor meta es poder recibirse y así poder trabajar mejor.
Está poniendo lo mejor de si para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y con ello cubrir ese gasto que tiene
texts.en: Liz is from the city of Villarrica. Her goal is to graduate as a information systems engineer. Her greatest challenge is to graduate so that she can get a better job. She is giving it everything she has in order to become someone in life and to be able to help others. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for the costs of her degree, and with it she will cover this cost.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of her degree.

loans.name: Arcele

texts.en:
Arcele is 47 years old and married with three children.

She has earned a living raising pigs for 2 years and is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She earns additional income from food vending.

She  works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with five children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business and earns additional income raising pigs. Sarah requests 14,000 PHP NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

Sarah has sustained her business activities through 4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream  which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 54-year-old married woman with six children, one attends school.

Juanita has raised pigs for 31 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Iluna

texts.en:
Iluna is a 56-year-old married woman with three children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Iluna has had a frozen food business for 16 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy more frozen food to sell.

In the future, Iluna would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a  rice business in the Philippines and  earns additional income making broom sticks. Josie requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase rice to sell.

Josie has sustained her business through 4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream  which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Dallendyshe

texts.en: Dallendyshe, or “Swallows” in English, wants to again buy second-hand items to resell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand items to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of watches, batteries, lamps and accessories to resell.

loans.name: Pelagio

texts.es:
El Sr. Pelagio está casado con la Sra. Ursulina hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos mayores, por quienes ambos están luchando para poder darles todo lo que el no pudo tener.
Ellos trabajan en la venta de productos varios en forma ambulante ya que vive en un barrio muy concurrido de la ciudad, Además trabaja como jardinero en sus horas libres, así de esa manera aumenta sus ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Pelagio has been married to Ursulina for a number of years. They have 4 older children and they both strive to give them everything that they didn't have. They work as street vendors selling a variety of products as they live in a busy neighbourhood of the city. He also works as a gardener in his free time. In this way he can increase his income to improve his quality of life. He is requesting this loan to buy a variety of items of clothing, and he will use it to continue in his line of work. He is grateful for the opportunity that he has been given to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Atelita

texts.en:
Atelita is a 53-year-old married woman with six children, one attends school.

Atelita has raised pigs for 15 years and requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

She has previously borrowed  22 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Atelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 33-year-old married woman with four children who works hard to provide for her family. 

She has run a general store for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  rice, sardines, noodles, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has previously borrowed and successfully repaid nine loans from NWTF. She earns additional income making furniture and providing tricycle transportation services.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy rice, sardines, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Yien

texts.en:
Yien is a 53-year-old widow with six children, one child attends school. Yien works very hard to provide for them.

Yien has run a general store for 8 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, cereal, and snack foods.

Yien would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, cereal, and snack foods.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. 

Jean is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leony works hard to support her family.

She has a mango-sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Leony is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more mangoes to sell to her customers.
