Leony has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар, 38 лет, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывают 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 1995 года занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав с 12,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Нилуфар имеется 0,50 ГА собственного земельного надела и 4,0 ГА арендованного, на котором она ежегодно выращивает лук для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нилуфар обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)для покупки высококачественных семян лука для выращивания. Нилуфар намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к улучшению благосостояния семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nilufar is 38 years old, married, and is raising four children together with her husband. She has a secondary education, and since 1995 has worked in crop cultivation and animal husbandry, having started with 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent hard work, today Nilufar has her own 0.50 hectare plot of land, and 4.0 hectares of rented land, on which she grows onions for sale and for personal consumption. In order to further develop her enterprise, Nulifar applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy high-quality onion seeds to sow. Nulifar intends to get a good harvest, which will certainly lead to an improvement in her family's wellbeing. With income from the loan, she wants to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds in order to grow organic products.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 50 años, habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 20 años. Ella teniendo la necesidad de generar ingresos para responder a gastos familiares y la imposibilidad de obtener un empleo, hace 7 años, se dio a la tarea de emprender el negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos,  como  arroz de lisa, arroz de cerdo, arroz de pollo, agua de arroz y verduras frescas, que compra en diferentes depósitos del mercado de la ciudad, y que su  cónyuge en su vehículo, traslada para su venta a diversos barrios. Su mercado es un poco más fluido que el de los barrios, pues  el tío de Gloria es propietario de bodegas y negocios varios, y le permite  ofrecer a los empleados de estas empresas los productos que prepara, logrando obtener más ganancias. Su meta más adelante es hacer mejoramiento a las condiciones locativas de su vivienda y su propósito es satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, aunque su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, arroz, aceite, cárnicos, pescado, verduras, para incrementar su productividad y así mismo ganar más dinero, con lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Gloria is 50 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and two children, ages 19 and 20.  Having the need to generate income to respond to household expenses and finding it impossible to obtain employment, seven years ago, she took on the task of starting a business selling food, such as mullet rice, pork rice, chicken rice, rice water and fresh vegetables, which she buys in different city markets and her husband transports in his vehicle to different neighborhoods.  Her market is a little more fluid than that of the neighborhoods, because Gloria's uncle is the owner of several stores and businesses, and this allows her to offer the employees of these businesses the products that she makes, which gives her a greater profit.  Her future goal is to make improvements to her home and her plan is to satisfy the demands of her customers, however, her greatest challenge is having sufficient capital to achieve this.  Currently, she is requesting a Kiva loan, first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase rice, oil, meats, fish, and vegetables in greater quantities, to increase her productivity and thus earn more money, which will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, meats, fish, and vegetables in greater quantities.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 53 years old and has two children. Clarita is widowed and has one child who is still in school.

Clarita is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Clarita has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis began his career in sheet metal fabrication in a roundabout fashion. He started to learn about the craft when he worked as a foreman for a company in which he supervised several sheet metal fabrication companies. Through this job, he was required to make frequent visits to the sheet metal fabrication  warehouses and began to become interested in pursuing this field as a career. 

Through his 10-year term as a foreman, he started to save enough money to follow his dreams and start a career in the sheet metal industry. Luis first started by working for a sheet metal fabrication business, doing outside sales, where he learned the actual fabrication process. His hard work led him to become the general manager for this company, and he was able to save enough money to start his own business. 

Luis started his business in January 2009 and has since been able to purchase all of his equipment for the manufacture of metal for wine cooling systems. One of the challenges in this industry is that since all customers are commercial, the payment for the projects does not come until 30 days after the project is complete, meaning that Luis must have the capital up front to complete the project. This has been a struggle, especially for larger projects. Therefore, Luis decided to turn to Kiva lenders for help.
 
Luis will use his Kiva loan for working capital to help supplement his current cash flow. He has some potentially big clients and is looking to be able to service their needs, and the loan will help him accomplish this. 

In the future, Luis hopes to be financially stable, continue to provide for his wife, who stays home to take care of their three children, improve his credit, and earn enough to completely stop factoring and service larger clients, thereby hiring more employees.

loans.use: for working capital to complete bigger projects.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is grateful that she was granted a Php 30,000 loan which she used to buy various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Her store earnings helped a lot to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for another Php 30,000 loan which she will use to buy more grocery items and several sacks of rice to sell either wholesale or retail. Rice is a main staple in the Philippines; it constitutes a dominant portion of the standard diet of Filipinos. Her earnings from her business help to cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Helen dreams that her sales and profits of her store will continue to grow. She wishes for her family to always be happy and loving. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

 All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, mostly rice, needed in her business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Salvacion is 53 years old and has two children who are in school.

Salvacion has a food production business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Salvacion has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 39 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Ofelia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pigs.

Ofelia has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 7 times in the past to sustain the business.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alma has a general store business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Alma has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 59 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nelida has a rice retail business in the Philippines. Nelida requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

Nelida has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nelida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 41 years old and married with three children. All of her children attend school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Viola is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Viola has been farming sugarcane for ten years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and food vending businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and women's clothing.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 19 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Lorena has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Eden

texts.en:
Ma. Eden is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Eden is 31 years old and both of her children are in school.

Ma. Eden has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ma. Eden has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Eden would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
The Sari Makmur group made the repayment of 9,000,000 IDR to MUK on time. They say that there was an increased profit they earned during the loan period of six months. The pigs grew fat and healthy. They could sell the pigs at a high price because of lots of demand from the market. The situation stimulated their spirit to run the business. The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the clients continues smoothly and lasts longer. Ni Ketut, as the head, has been controlling and monitoring the members of her group. She was helped by other boards. She sold all her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She saved all the profit to use for business capital later.

The Sari Makmur group has received a new loan of 9,000,000 IDR. The loan use is for increasing the number of piglets, renovating the barns and purchasing superior feed. The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run the business by themselves. Now they already have savings and use them for capital.

Ni Ketut and the members feel happy receiving the support all this time from lenders, Kiva and MUK. Ni Ketut has used the loan to purchase superior piglets and feed. She hopes she can have enough saving soon and continue the business by herself.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Abla Akofa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et sandales à Lomé et cela depuis 2010, Abla Akofa pour acheter des marchandises demande un prêt à WAGES. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle souhaite agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a pour conjoint un déclarant en douane et a en charge 04 enfants tous scolarisés. L'ainé a 13ans et le dernier 04ans. Abla Akofa quant à elle a 30ans.
texts.en: Selling cosmetic products and sandals in Lomé since 2010, Abla Akofa has requested a loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise. In future she hopes to grow her business and support her family. Her husband is a customs agent and she is raising four children, all enrolled in school. The oldest is 13 and the youngest four years old. As for Abla Akofa, she is thirty years old.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is very energetic at the age of 67; he is actively engaged in timber business. This business is his primary source of income with which he supports his family. He has a gross monthly income of 10,000.

He become a member of Paglaum in 2011, and has continued as an active member with good performance.

Now, Christopher is applying for a loan with Paglaum again. He will use the loan to buy additional coconut trees for timber sales. He is very happy and thankful to Paglaum because he can continue save while at the same time giving a job to his neighbor, who is unemployed.

loans.use: to buy additional coconut trees for timber stocks

loans.name: Baldomero

texts.en:
Baldomero makes a living through his junk shop business. He runs a junk shop in SWP, Calamba, Philippines, and earns a promising income to support his family.

He has signed up for his membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capitalization. Now, he wants to increase his inventory, so he availed a loan to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital for his junk shop.

Baldomero hopes to sustain his business and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional junk for his junk shop

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for natural vitamins to sell directly and also partly to buy ingredients needed in her cupcakes business. Her earnings helped her to support herself in her studies and to help meet her family's basic daily needs. 

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for boxes of Vitamin-Plus to sell, and to buy ingredients for her baking business. She is encouraged by the positive response and sales of her cupcakes, as well as the fact that she already has regular customers. Her customers are happy with the vitamins' health benefits and they are now her regular clients. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and is hoping for a good return on her investment for it will surely fund her schooling and help pay for their everyday needs.

Elena dreams of opening up her own bakeshop when she graduates from college. She continually prays for a happy and victorious family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for natural health drinks and ingredients to bake cupcakes to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 49-year-old single woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and her child is still in school.

Juliet has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, fish, chicken, cooking oil, spices and other utensils and materials for her food production business.

Juliet has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, fish, chicken, cooking oil, spices and other utensils and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 46-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Imelda has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and other items for her food production business.

Imelda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and other items for her food production business

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz Mary de 45 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, para lograr sostener su hogar, trabajaba como empleada del servicio doméstico y con el fin de educar más de cerca a sus hijos,  hace 3 años, se dedicó  desde su vivienda, a la venta de carnes frías  y otros artículos, como sabanas, sandalias ropa y accesorios en general, los cuales vende a crédito trabajando de lunes a sábados en horarios que inician a las 8 dela mañana y terminan a las 6 de la tarde. Para incrementar su capital de trabajo y obtener mas utilidades requiere un fondo de efectivo, y por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carnes frías, ropa de cama y accesorios domésticos para responder a su clientela los pedidos adicionales que ha pedido e incrementar su oferta y ganar un poco más, lo cual hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Luz Mary, age 45, has three children.  In order to support her household, she works as a domestic services employee.  She does this in order to further educate her children.

Three years ago she started selling fried meats and other items like sheets, sandals, clothes and general accessories from her house.  She sells on credit.  She works Monday through Saturdays on a schedule that starts at eight at in the morning and finishes and at six in the evening.

In order to increase her working capital and to get more profits, she needs a cash fund.  For that reason she is currently applying for a Kiva loan.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy fried meats, bedding, and home accessories in order to fill additional customer orders she has, to increase her offerings, and to earn a little more.  This will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy fried meats, bedding, and home accessories.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva works hard to support her family. Geneva is widowed and has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines. Geneva has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits.

Geneva requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy boxes of used shoes to sell in her stall.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of used shoes to sell in her stall

loans.name: Rolland

texts.fr:
Rolland est un homme de 39 ans qui élève 4 enfants avec sa femme dans une petite commune rurale des hauts plateaux de Madagascar. Il est originaire de la ville mais est venu s’installer avec sa famille dans ce village à proximité d’un grand lac pour se lancer, il y a maintenant 10 ans, dans sa propre activité et tenter de vivre de sa passion, la pêche. Rolland fait un élevage de poissons et parallèlement à cette activité, il vend des filets de pêche.

Il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 2 ans. Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter de la farine alimentaire pour son élevage ainsi que des filets de pêche. Il espère ainsi sécuriser son activité principale tout en augmentant son activité complémentaire, à savoir la vente de filets de pêche.

Son objectif principal reste aujourd’hui de garantir l’avenir de ses enfants. Il espère pouvoir un jour devenir grossiste spécialisé dans le domaine de la pêche.
texts.en:
Rolland is a 39-year-old man who is raising four children with his wife in a small rural commune in the upper plateaux of Madagascar. He was born in the city but 10 years ago he came to this village, situated close to a large lake, with his family in order to start his own business and to live out his passion, which is fishing. Rolland runs his own fish farm and alongside this business he sells fishing nets.

He has been a Vahatra partner for the past two years. With this loan, he is planning to purchase cornmeal to feed his livestock as well as fishing nets He hopes to be able to secure his main business while growing his side business, which involves selling fishing nets.

His main goal is to safeguard his children's futures. He hopes to one day become a specialist fish wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal and fishing nets

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
Merry signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the necessary capital to start up a sari-sari store (general store) business.

She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Merry has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wanted to take advantage of this good fortune, so, recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her general store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Hadicha

texts.en:
Hadicha is a strong woman. She was born to a family of workers in 1970. She is divorced and has three children. She is currently living in a small town in the southern part of Tajikistan.

She operates a business cooking traditional Tajik pastries, called “Sambusa”, and Russian pastries, called “Pirozhki”, “Cheburek”, and “Blinchik”. She first started her business by buying and selling bakery products. Now she has a good practice of cooking and baking traditional tasty pastries and she has regular customers that return every day. 

She is asking for a loan from Kive lenders to buy a motorcycle for her son in order for him to help her deliver products to the domestic market. This will make her business better and easier to operate. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle for her son in order for him to help her deliver her products to the domestic market

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 47 years old and married with four children. 

Dorothy is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Dorothy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Dorothy has been raising cattle for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dorothy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelina is 29 years old and both of her children are in school.

Adelina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for the business.

Adelina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 39 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of items to sell in her store. Marife has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, toothpaste, candies, etc. 

Marife would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 46 years old and married with six children. With six children who are still in school, Rose Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Rose Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, juice, soft-drinks, milk, coffee and personal care products.

Rose Marie has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, juice, soft-drinks, milk, coffee and personal care products

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina works hard to support her family. Joaquina is married and has a bread-vending business in the Philippines.

Joaquina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Joaquina has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Joaquina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn is 21 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Angelyn is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Angelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Angelyn has been raising cattle for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Angelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and single. She works hard to provide for herself. 

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending, and farming rice and sugarcane.

Arlene aspires to saving and building her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat products, sauces, and new fixed assets.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Rosa has been in this business for 4 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, fish, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Sala

texts.en: Sala is 28 years old and a single mother with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Sala has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, etc. She joined SPBD in March 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sala will spend it to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ausage

texts.en:
Ausage is a 38-year-old woman with 4 children and a partner of over 10 years. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, beans, tomatoes, etc, to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year.

Ausage has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, rakes, bush knives, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2015.

With her profits, Ausage hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed spray, vegetable seeds, rakes, a wheel barrow, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Oliana

texts.en:
Oliana is 54 years old with three children and divorced. 

Oliana makes and sells weaving fans, Samoan bowls and weaving baskets to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. 

Oliana has requested a loan to  buy coloured paints, knives, polish, wood, nails, etc. 

Oliana plans to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy colour paints, knives, polish, wood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Hamrojon

texts.en:
Hamrojon is a capable woman. She was born in 1959 to an agrarian family. She is now living in a beautiful small town where people are very gentle and hospitable. She is divorced and has two children.

She has a small store where she sells food products like sugar, butter, milk, candies, cakes, bread, etc. She has been in business for almost 11 years. 

Hamrojon raised her children alone through the hard times of her life. She tried to feed her children and educate them well. Now, one of her children is working abroad and he sends her money to support her. She feels happy because her children are safe and they love her.

She needs financial support from Kiva lenders to renovate her house because many years have passed since her house was built and now it is in bad condition and is unsuitable for living in. She hopes to live better now, in her old age.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Munisoy

texts.en:
Munisoy is a bright woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is living in rural area where agriculture is the most common business. She is married and has five children. Her family is big and to feed them she needs support and money. Her husband works abroad in order to earn money and send to his family for living.

Munisoy has 22 years experience of keeping livestock. She was taught from her childhood how to keep cattle. She has a land to plant agriculture and space to keep cattle. She and her husband did a business in this sphere until her husband go to Russia. Munisoy had to do the business alone.

She used a service of IMON and asked for advice. They conducted her about the support of women entrepreneurs and she decided to get a loan from KIVA lenders to buy seeds and fertilizers. She wants to get a good harvest next season to feed her family. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with six children. Regina is 50 years old and two of her children are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Regina has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines. Regina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as nail nippers, a nail clipper, cotton, nail polish and other tools for her business.

Regina has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as nail nippers, a nail clipper, cotton, nail polish and other tools for her business

loans.name: Chazel

texts.en:
Chazel is 30 years old and married with one child. Chazel works very hard to provide for them.

Chazel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Chazel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Chazel would like to save money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is 47 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Cayetana is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Cayetana requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cayetana has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 8 times in the past to sustain the business.

In the future, Cayetana would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Kanwal

texts.en:
Kanwal is a 25-year-old woman and mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a food stall selling different types of edible items such as samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha, etc. Her husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage their household.

Kanwal's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavourable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Kanwal has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of edible and other items for her husband's business

loans.name: Emelie

texts.fr:
Emelie est une femme dynamique de 32 ans. Elle vit dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux de Madagascar avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Elle fait un élevage de cochons depuis de très nombreuses années. Cette activité est inscrite dans la tradition familiale : petite, elle a longtemps observé et aidé ses parents. Une fois devenue adulte et toute jeune maman, c’est assez naturellement qu’elle s’est lancée dans cette activité. 

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis une dizaine d’année. Grâce aux bénéfices de son activité, elle a déjà réussi à acheter un  terrain. Emelie est une femme courageuse qui a choisi  d’exercer, parallèlement à son élevage, une activité complémentaire pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et continuer à faire de l’épargne. Ainsi, avec ce prêt, elle compte  acheter quelques cochons ainsi que de la farine alimentaire mais également quelques articles divers tels que des radios, piles, briquets pour son activité de vente ambulante au grand marché de la ville.

Cette mère de famille responsable pense en premier lieu à ses enfants, elle met tout en œuvre pour tenter de sécuriser leur avenir et leur permettre de faire des études. Elle espère dans quelques années, pouvoir également construire la maison familiale sur le terrain qu’elle a acheté.
texts.en:
Emelie is a dynamic woman of 32. She lives in the urban community of Antsirabe on the High Plateau of Madagascar with her husband and four children. She has been raising pigs for many years. This is a traditional family business: as a child she observed and helped her parents with it. When she grew up and was a young mother, she naturally went into this business. She has been a partner of Vahatra for some 10 years. Thanks to the profit from her business, she has already been able to buy a plot of land. 

Emelie is a courageous woman who has chosen to run a complementary business, alongside her pig-raising activity, so as to support her family and continue to set aside savings. Thus she will use this loan to buy some piglets and feed but also various items such as radios, batteries, and lighters for her itinerant sales business in the main town market. 

This devoted and responsible mother thinks first of her children. She does all she can to try and ensure their future and permit them to study. She hopes in some years also to be able to build a family residence on the plot of land she bought.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Molia

texts.en:
Molia is a 42-year-old married woman with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbage to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Molia has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, rakes, vegetable seeds, weed sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014.

With her profits, Molia hopes to extend her business and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, rakes, bush knives, plastic bags, fertilizer, weed sprayer, vegetable seeds, etc.

loans.name: Sirojid

texts.en:
Sirojid is a strong man. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. He is living in a rural area where doing business in agriculture is the most common. He is single and lives with parents. Sirojid is honest, goal oriented and hardworking boy.

They have a big family and do business together. They have a good condition to keep cattle and plant agriculture. After classes he always helps his parents with agriculture. They are planting potato, tomato and cucumbers. They also have a fruit garden with grapes and apples. They are selling their products in a domestic market.

The business that his family does covers all expenditures of every day life like food and clothing. They were informed about IMON’s service and requested a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to gain a good harvest. He hopes that KIVA lenders and IMON will support young generation. The young boy as Sirojid wants to help his parents with earning money to live.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for a good harvest.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 55 years old and married with four children.

Anatalia earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Anatalia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anatalia has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Anatalia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 62 years old and married with four children. Alita works very hard to provide for them.

Alita has run a general store in the Philippines for 12 years and sells a variety of items. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like canned goods, detergent soap, vinegar, coffee, sugar, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

Alita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like canned goods, detergent soap, vinegar, coffee, sugar, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 47 years old and married with three children. With all her children presently in school, Luisa works very hard to provide for them.

Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, coffee, spices and other groceries.

Luisa has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, coffee, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Felisa has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 43 years old and married with nine children. Four of her children are presently in school.

Mildred is in the agricultural business, farming sugar cane in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mildred has been in this business for 5 years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal an ambitious woman wants to be productive in her community. She does not want to depend on anyone, even her husband. Because of that she started her own business to help her husband in the household expenses and achieve her goals.

She started her beauty salon business in her home, and then after she became well-known in this field, she decided to expand her work. She rented a small store and opened a beauty salon independent from her home.

Nawal is applying for a loan now to help her buy tools and develop her work to increase her income and improve the standards of living of her family.

loans.use: to help her buy tools and develop her salon work.

loans.name: Gatimakeza Group

texts.fr:
Siméon   fait partie du groupe  Gatimakeza et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Aline, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1 à 7 ans, dont  2 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce des habits   depuis  11 ans. 

Il est son à troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire une grande maison, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Siméon is part of the group called Gatimakeza and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and is married to Aline, a small-scale merchant. Together they have three children aged between one and seven years old, of whom two are enrolled in school. 

Siméon has been selling clothing for 11 years. He is on his third loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he is going to grow his working capital and buy lots of clothing to resell so as to earn more. 

In the years to come, he would like to build a big house and see his children study.

loans.use: to grow his working capital and buy lots of clothing for resale, so as to earn more

loans.name: Hantanirina

texts.fr:
Hantanirina est une femme dynamique de 30 ans Elle vit sur les hauts plateaux de Madagascar dans la commun urbaine d’Antsirabe avec son mari et ses 2 enfants. Elle exerce une activité de vente de sandales en plastiques pour enfants et adultes depuis maintenant 7 ans. Elle est vendeuse ambulante et se déplace sur les différents marchés des villes et villages de la région où l’offre est moins importante et donc la demande plus intéressante.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 3 ans. Elle compte, avec ce nouveau prêt, renouveler son stock de marchandises et commencer à s’orienter vers la vente de nouveaux types de chaussures comme les ballerines et les tennis. Grâce aux bénéfices de son activité, elle déjà acheté plusieurs cochons ce qui lui permet de faire de l’épargne en nature. 

Elle espère pouvoir un jour acheter un terrain sur lequel elle construirait sa propre maison. Mais sa priorité actuelle reste l’éducation de ses enfants, elle rêve de pouvoir leur permettre d’étudier jusqu’à l’université.
texts.en:
Hantanirina is a dynamic woman of 30. She lives on the High Plateau of Madagascar, in the urban community of Antsirabe, with her husband and her two children. She has been selling plastic sandals for children and adults for seven years now. She sells in an itinerant fashion, going to different markets in towns and villages of the region where there is less on offer, so higher demand. She  has been a partner of Vahatra for three years. 

Hantanirina intends to use this new loan to renew her inventory and begin to turn toward selling new types of shoes such as ballerina shoes and running shoes. Thanks to the profit from her business, she has already managed to buy some pigs, which will allow her to put aside savings in physical form. She hopes one day to be able to buy a plot of land on which she could build her own house. But her present priority remains the education of her children; she dreams of being able to permit them to study up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sandals and running shoes for children and adults

loans.name: Isteqlal

texts.en:
Isteqlal is 26 years old lives in Amman. She is a very optimistic lady. She could not complete her education because of the financial situation of her family, so she decided to help them with household expenses and improve their standards of living. That is her goal now.

She opened a beauty salon. She is getting good income from her work but because of the high standards of living she decided to expand. Therefore she applied for a loan to buy tools and supplies for her salon. Isteqlal hope this will improve the quality of her work and raise the quantity of her costumers.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en:
Gulruhsor is a hardworking woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in small town where women are talented and hardworking. She has one child and is divorced with her husband.

Gulruhsor has a business of sewing traditional women dresses. Almost ten years she has experience of doing business. She was taught by her mother and loves this activity. Gulruhsor has permanent customers and is well-known among sellers and neighbors.

Now sheneeds to work hard and earn money to feed and care for her child. She is asking for a loan from KIVA lenders and IMON to be treated in medical clinic. She will be healthy after treatment and continue business and can feed her child. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to be treated in a medical clinic.

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en:
Iulia is 35 years old and married with no children. She runs a small business selling ice-cakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Iulia has requested a loan to buy new freezer, plastic cups, Chinese lollies, cordial, tangs etc.

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Iulia will spend it to extend her previous business and develop another new business.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer, Chinese lollies, plastic cups, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, weed sprayer, plastic bags, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Ziedamo

texts.en:
Ziedamo is a strong woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1984. She is living in small town where beautiful ladies like her are responsible and talented. She is married and has three children.

She trades kid’s clothes and perfume. More than 5 years she does the business. She seeks to enlarge her assortment in order to attract more clients and earn money.

She feels responsibility for her family and husband to support him with finance. She used the service of IMON and asked advice on how to expand her business.

Ziedamo is asking a loan from KIVA lenders to buy a new assortment of kid’s clothes. She wants to be helpful to her family.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of kid’s clothes to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 47 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Melanie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 46 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lucia has been in the pig fattening business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

Ritchel has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 42 years old and married with three children all of whom are in school. Flordeliza works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, shampoo, sugar, and other groceries.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money in order to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn is 31 years old with two children. With one child in school, Juvilyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Juvilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, and other groceries.

Juvilyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Juvilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jhoannie

texts.en:
Jhoannie is a 26-year-old married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jhoannie has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 43 years old and married. She has four children with three in school.

Dioscora is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Dioscora requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dioscora has been farming rice and corn for 5 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dioscora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maxcelenda

texts.en:
Maxcelenda is 27 years old and has two children. She is married and both children are sent to school.

Maxcelenda is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. Maxcelenda requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her goats.

She has been raising goats for six years.

In the future, Maxcelenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her goats.

loans.name: Trextanie

texts.en:
Trextanie is a 23-year-old married woman.

Trextanie is in the agricultural business, farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Trextanie requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Trextanie has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll, 35, is married and has three children. Her children are in school.

Cheryll is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed twice from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain her business.

Cheryll has requested a new loan, of 5,000 Philippine pesos, through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Cheryll would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 33, is married and has four children. Her children are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for six years. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 45 years old and has two children.

Nenita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nenita has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Tolojanahary Lydia

texts.fr:
Âgée de 41 ans, Lydia est divorcée et mère de 3 enfants. Son mari l'a quitté il y 10 ans. Elle assume seule ses responsabilités  depuis.C'est une femme très courageuse, combattive, travailleuse. elle vit seule avec ses enfants.  
Elle possède une petite quincaillerie, elle exerce cette activité depuis 2012 pour soutenir sa famille. Mais elle vend aussi des vêtements friperies.
Le crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter et de diversifier ses marchandises. 
Lydia projette d'épargner encore plus pour ses enfants. En plus, elle veut de l'avenir plus brillant pour ses enfants, et elle pense y parvenir avec son travail acharné.
texts.en:
Lydia, 41 years old, is a divorced mother of three children. Her husband left her 10 years ago. She has taken on the responsibility alone since then. She's a courageous woman, combative and  hard-working. She lives alone with her children. 

Lydia has a little hardware business; she has been in this activity since 2012 so as to support her family. However, she also sells used clothing. This loan will permit her to grow and diversify her merchandise. 

Lydia plans to save even more for her children. Besides that, she wants her children to have a brilliant future and she thinks she can manage that with her unremitting work.

loans.use: to buy electrical outlets, cables, and various screwdrivers

loans.name: Uanona

texts.en:
Uanona, 37, is single and has no child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Uanona joined South Pacific Business Development in March 2015 to gain access to capital. She has requested a loan to buy bags of sugar and flour, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags, etc. 

With her earnings, Uanona will expand her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bags of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La Sra. Mariela es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá , proviene de una  familia humilde de artesanos, viajó a la Argentina en busca de mayor  oportunidad de donde pudo ahorrar para volver e invertir en las confecciones.
Ella es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que ya tiene muchos clientes que siempre le llevan muchos pedidos. Pide este préstamo para  invertir en la compra de hilo y telas  para la confección de sobrecamas y alfombritas que  comercializa  a mayoristas de la zona. Ella vive en pareja tiene hijos menores que van a la escuela, y por quienes ella se esfuerza.
texts.en:
Mariela, a very hard working and selfless person, lives in the city of Carapeguá, and comes from a modest family of artisans. She traveled to Argentina to find more opportunities to save up so that she could return home and invest in sewing.

She is very good at what she does, which is why she has many customers who make many orders. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread to make bedspreads and rugs which she sells to local wholesalers. 

She lives with her partner, and has three young children who go to school. It is for these children that she makes an effort.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Malofou

texts.en:
Malofou is 53 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for five years.

Malofou has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, etc. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Malofou support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Yulduzhon

texts.en:
Yulduzhon is a generous woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1984. She is living in a small town where each season is more beautiful than another. She has one daughter but unfortunately is divorced. She has been challenged a lot in her life. 

Yulduzhon has a business selling and buying kids' clothes. She has two years' experience doing business in the domestic market. It is hard for Yulduzhon to run a business and raise her child. Her child is three years old now and needs her mom’s attention. She wants to enlarge her business and buy a new assortment of kids' clothes. It would help her to earn money and raise her child. She is asking for a loan to buy a new assortment of kids' clothes. 

She awaits the kindness of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of kids' clothes

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She is married and has three children. She lives in a small town where in the eve of spring the flowers are in blossom which is very pretty.

For almost five years she has worked in government. She is a powerful, responsible and generous person. Her work deserves more attention and responsibility.

Now she is sick and wants to be treated in hospital, so she requested a loan from KIVA lenders. Then she will be healthy, active and more productive. She can earn money to live.

loans.use: to be treated in a hospital.

loans.name: Celia Beatriz

texts.es:
Celia Beatriz tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de bazar y belleza como cremas de belleza, perfumes, cosméticos, aguas tonificantes, entre otros, sus clientes en la mayoría son mujeres, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le permitirá ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que va a mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Celia Beatriz is 48 years old. She lives in the district of Zaña, a community that works in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry, located in the province of Chiclayo, belonging to the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Perú.
She works selling general merchandise and beauty products such as beauty creams, perfumes, cosmetics, skin toners, among other things. Her customers are mainly women. She has experience in this business and good personal and work references from the inhabitants of her district. She is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of beauty products to increase her business's stock. This will allow her to offer more variety of products to her customers, which will improve her income and in this way her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beauty products to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Asbel Santos

texts.es:
Asbel tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de albañileria, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años, dicha actividad la realiza en las diferentes construcciones de la zona de Oyotún y zonas cercanas, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas como son tablas, palanas, cemento, entre otros, para realizar su trabajo, esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes lo que incrementará sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Asbel is 36 years old and has one child. He lives in the district of Oyotún, a community where the people work in agriculture, commerce and raising animals. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

He works providing bricklaying services and he has been doing this for 3 years. He works in the various construction sites in the Oyotún and surrounding areas. He has experience in the field and has good references in the district. He is requesting a loan to invest in buying tools like boards, shovels and cement amongst others so he can do his work. He wants to provide better service to his clients which will increase his income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in supplies like boards, shovels and cement amongst others.

loans.name: Milogen

texts.en:
Milogen is 32 years old and married with three children. With all of her of her children in school, Milogen works very hard to provide for them.

Milogen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Milogen would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old and married with one child in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Virginia has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad's age is not an obstacle to achieving his objectives. He possesses the character of an ambitious and optimistic man and has the willpower to achieve his dreams. Mohammad is 62 years old, lives in Amman and is married with two children.

After he retired from his work, he decided to open his own small business because of his refusal to sit at home without being a productive man. He opened a food supplies market with a low quantity of products, and now he dreams to expand his work.

Therefore, he applied for a loan to help him buy more products to sell and increase his incomes to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell and increase his income.

loans.name: Frelyne

texts.en:
Frelyne, 29, is married and has one child. Her child is in school.

Frelyne is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for one year now and has borrowed once from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain her business.

She has requested a new loan, of 5,000 Philippine pesos, through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Frelyne would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Olga Virginie

texts.fr:
Âgée de 24 ans, Olga Virginie est mariée et mère d'un enfant de 5 ans qui suit ses études primaires dans une école privée. 
Achat et revente des slips est l'activité génératrice de revenu de Mme Olga depuis 2010.C'est une activité exercée seule par son mari avant leur mariage.
Elle demande un crédit pour augmenter et diversifier les stocks de marchandises (pointure et gammes)afin d'attirer différents clients.
Les deux époux savent travailler ensemble et sont très dynamiques.
La famille dispose d'un terrain sur lequel est construite une maison en bois. Leur rêve est de pouvoir construire une maison en dur.
texts.en:
Olga Virginie, age 24, is married with a 5-year-old child who attends primary school in a private institution. 

Olga has been buying and selling underpants since 2010. Her husband alone was engaged in this activity before they married. 

Olga is seeking a loan to bolster and diversify her inventory (sizes and styles) in order to attract a broader range of customers. 

The couple work well together and they are very dynamic. 

The family has some land with a wooden house. Their dream is to build a permanent dwelling.

loans.use: to buy men's and ladies' underpants for resale.

loans.name: Alefa

texts.en:
Alefa, 37, is married with two children. She runs a small business selling furniture, groceries, drinks, cigarettes and other products in her community. She has been in this business for four years. 

Alefa joined South Pacific Business Development in 2012 to gain access to capital. She has requested a loan to buy freezers, mutton, chicken, noodles, toiletries, snacks, etc.

With her earnings, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy freezers, noodles, mutton, chicken, onions, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Me is 55 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling freezers, food stocks, materials, drinks,cup cakes,toiletries and more. She has been in business for seven years. 

Me needs a loan to buy a vehicle to deliver her cup cakes, a new freezer and stock. 

She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. Me became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to deliver her cup cakes, a new freezer and stock.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 40 years old. He is a widower with six children and lives in Oroquieta, Philippines. Ruben is managing his fishing business and owns fish cages, as well. He earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of his big family, especially his children's education and other needs. 

He has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase new nets and other fishing accessories to improve and expand his fishing business. In the future, Ruben hopes to own another fishing boat to have higher income for his children.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and other fishing accessories to improve and expand his fishing business

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various items for resale

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn, 36, is married with three children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for six years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her family. She already used loans previously to purchase additional stock, and now she is reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna has mastered her skills in making bread. She has her own unique bread recipe, and she is known for her homemade sweet bread. This has kept her business going for more than five years now. 

Recently, Digna requested a loan to buy a bread slicer to make her tasty bread neat and clean. Digna hopes to expand her business by displaying in more store outlets.

loans.use: to buy a bread slicer

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 48-year-old, single woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows cucumbers, cabbages, pumpkins and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Eseta has requested a loan to use to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since this year. With her profits, Eseta hopes to save and support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, rakes and a weed sprayer

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria tiene 51 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de Pomahuaca, es una comunidad mediana cuyas actividades principales son el comercio y la agricultura, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales caprinos, actividad que la viene realizando desde hace más de 10 años ademas cuenta también con aves de corral como son patos, gallinas, etc. Cuenta con corral propio amplio donde cría a sus animales. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales caprinos para luego engordarlos y comercializarlos, con esto Maria espera lograr mejores ingresos y de esta manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old. She lives in her own house alongside her spouse in the Pomahuaca district. It is a medium-sized community, whose primary activities are commerce and agriculture. The community is found in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

She makes a living by raising and selling goats. She has been in this line of work for more than 10 years. She also has poultry such as ducks, hens, etc. She has her own large pen where she raises her animals. 

The loan will be used to invest in buying a larger quantity of goats, to later fatten them and sell them. With this, Maria hopes to obtain better income and reach an acceptable profit level to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in buying a larger quantity of goats, to later fatten them and sell them.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Cecilio tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijo de 17 años en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona rural de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, esta comunidad se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cecilio se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de borregos, desde hace más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio. Él solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento de engorde para estos; con esto Cecilio espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilio is 54 years old and married. He lives with his wife and his 17-year-old son in his own house in a large community in the rural area of Cayalti. He has good personal and professional references from his neighbors. This community is found in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

Cecilio makes a living by raising and selling sheep. He has made this business his career for more than 10 years. He is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of animals as well as food to fatten them. With this, Cecilio hopes to offer a better variety of animals to his customers. This will allow him to generate more income which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals as well as food to fatten them.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa, 49, is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Adelfa has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Adelfa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Florylee

texts.en:
Florylee, 24, is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. She sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

Florylee has requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Florylee would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses, a 36-year-old male, is married with six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Moses practices commercial farming, mainly growing tomatoes, and earns additional income from making a local brew. He has a dream of becoming a model farmer and educating his children. However, he is faced with the challenges of a prolonged drought, price fluctuations, and low harvests. Moses needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Maria works very hard to provide for the family.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, 38, is a married with two children who attend school. She works hard to provide a good and comfortable life for her family . 

Amal has runs a blanket retail business in her home and she requested a loan to buy more blankets to sell to increase her income.

Amal has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Licuadoras, útiles del hogar, planchas, y todo tipo de ropa consta el negocio de Pedro, quién desde muy de mañana ordena su mercadería para ofrecerla al público y clientes. Pedro se siente muy agradecido con un crédito anterior que obtuvo, puesto que tuvo grandes beneficios con los que basteció la demanda de sus clientes y surtió su negocio con nuevos productos. Además que hubieron alzas en el capital de trabajo, Pedro quién también cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien ha logrado administrar y trabajar con la recuperación de las líneas.
Esta vez Pedro acude a solicitar otro financiamiento para seguir abasteciendo la demanda de sus clientes y volverse en un comerciante mayorista, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para la compra de productos del hogar, como cafeteras, hornos, utensilios domésticos y ampliar la línea de ropa. Pedro piensa seguir trabajando con MiCrédito por la confianza y el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Blenders, household items, irons and all kinds of clothing are Pedro's business. Very early in the morning he arranges his merchandise to offer to the public and his clients. Pedro is very grateful for the previous loan as it was of great benefit in that he supplied the demand of his clients and stocked his business with new products.
