He also increased his working capital. Pedro can also count on the support of his wife who manages to administer and work with restocking the goods.

This time Pedro has requested another loan to continue to stock the demand from his clients and become a wholesale merchant. He has faith in the loan to purchase household products such as coffee makers, ovens, kitchen utensils and an expanded line of clothing. Pedro wants to continue to work with MiCrédito due to the confidence and support they provide him.

loans.use: to buy coffee makers, ovens, domestic utensils and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase silver wire coils to make bangles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bricks to construct a house.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie earns a living by preparing and selling home made meals like pansit (noodles), fried lumpia and snack foods like puto (rice cake) and kutsinta ( steam rice cakes). She is a 51 year old married woman with four children ages 10-19. Her husband has an income to help defray the family's expenses.

Rosemarie is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, meat, seasonings, and other supplies. With these items, she could display and sell various home meals  and snack foods. 

Increased profits will help Rosemarie augment her income and pay her obligation. She could provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

In the future, Rosemarie hopes to expand her business and support the schooling of all her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, meat, seasonings and other supplies.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a very active and hardworking mother of three children.  She loves doing farming activities and planting varieties of fruit and vegetables to maximize the space of her agricultural land.  Because of her tender loving care of the land, it generates a bigger income which allowed her to finish her previous loan with Paglaum in only two months. 

Now, Felisa is applying for another loan which she will use to pay additional labor and buy fertilizer for her growing fruit.  She hopes and pray that God will continue to bless her plants so that she can help others.

loans.use: to pay additional labor and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old. She is a widow with four children and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Philippines. She has a flower garden that earns a meager income. Recently, she purchased bananas and resold them to earn a living. 

She has requested a loan to purchase bananas and vegetables to sell. 

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies and support the college education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Oblitas

texts.es:
Oblitas tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su propia mototaxi, se dedica a este negocio hace 5 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Oblitas espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oblitas is 23 years old. He lives with his spouse and his younger child in the Pucará district. This is a community where life is peaceful and the population works in agriculture, commerce, and breeding animals. It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

He makes a living by providing transportation services in his own moto-taxi. He has been in this line of work for 5 years, and therefore has experience in the business and good references in his district. Additionally, he makes a living by raising and selling small animals. 

The loan will be used to complete repairs and maintenance to his moto-taxi, because it is currently in bad condition. With this, Oblitas hopes to provide better service to his customers. This will have a positive impact on his income level and will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to complete repairs and maintenance to his moto-taxi, because it is currently in bad condition.

loans.name: Robelin

texts.en:
Robelin is 34 years old and married with three children. All of her children are attending school. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Robelin is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for ten years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 52 years old and widowed with three children. With one child in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for her family.

Thelma runs a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice for resale.

Thelma has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 42 years old, married with five children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a shop, selling general merchandise, and also practices farming, growing crops such onions, maize, rice and others. 

Bosco has a dream of expanding his business to new market areas in order to increase his sales. However, he is faced with the challenges of pests and diseases, plus poor climatic changes. 

Bosco will use the loan to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 31 años, nació en la provincia Andrés Ibáñez del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia, vive con sus padres y su pequeña hija a quien le dedica cada minuto de su tiempo libre.
Actualmente Luis trabaja en el área de Call Center de una empresa de Sistemas, su principal motivación en la vida además de lograr superarse, es poder retribuirles a sus padres todo su esfuerzo y darle un buen futuro a su hija. Su sueño es trabajar en una empresa transnacional del sector petrolero, y manifiesta que lo que le hace diferente de los demás es su determinación ya que pese a que se convirtió en padre desde muy joven logro vencer cada obstáculo que se le atravesaba, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito educativo para poder culminar sus estudios en la carrera de Contaduría Pública ya que considera que esto le permitirá optar por mejores puestos de trabajo, logrando de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia pues los ingresos que ahora genera solo le alcanzan para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 
A Luis lo emociona el hecho de saber que hay gente dispuesta a ayudar a otros, esto lo hace sentir feliz y lo motiva a culminar sus estudios universitarios, expresa que este tipo de ayuda es una gran oportunidad para aquellas personas que han tenido que afrontar obstáculos en la vida desde temprana edad. Les agradece a todos y les pide que sigan adelante con esta noble misión que tanto bien le hace a la juventud en el mundo entero.
texts.en:
Luis, aged 31, was born in the Andrés Ibáñez province of the Bolivian Santa Cruz Department. He lives with his parents and his young daughter to whom he dedicates every minute of this spare time.

Luis currently works in a call center for a systems company. His main motivation in life, apart from bettering himself, is to be able to repay all of his parents' efforts, and to give his daughter a good future. His dream is to work for a multinational company in the oil sector. He says that what makes him stand out from the crowd is his determination, as despite becoming a father at a young age he has managed to overcome every obstacle in his path. This is why he is requesting a loan to complete his studies towards a degree in public accounting, which he believes will allow him to aim for better job positions. This will in turn help him to improve his family's quality of life as the income he currently earns is only just enough to cover the household costs.

Luis is moved by the fact that there are people willing to help others. It makes him happy and motivates him to finish his university studies. He believes that this type of help is a great opportunity for those people who have had to confront obstacles in their lives from an early age. He thanks everyone, and asks that they continue on with this noble mission which is doing so much good for young people all over the world.

loans.use: to pay for his public accounting degree

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna’s husband owns a vehicle spare parts shop, where he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He sells brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient amount to afford household expenses. 

He is the only person who supports his family and elderly parents, too. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with the future expenses. Therefore, Lubna has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband.

Lubna is the mother of four children; some of them are very young and fully dependent upon their parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her children. She hopes that her husband will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. Lubna thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her husband with purchasing vehicle spare parts to sell at his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for sewing ladies' bags, such as imitation leather, zippers and buckles.

loans.name: Ailini

texts.en:
Ailini is a 53-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a business selling elei clothing (traditional Samoan decorative fabric) in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Ailini has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, material, color paints, thread and needles. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2011, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, color paints, a sewing machine, thread and needles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing (10 lengths of African print cloth and a bale of used clothes) for resale

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 32-year-old married woman from Ramallah city. She is a mother of five sons. Her husband is a construction worker. He gets a low and unstable income due to the low demand for construction in the winter. Mervat has a store selling clothes and home products. It is a good business and provides the family with a good income. 

Mervat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy some products for her store to resell. By taking this loan, sales will increase as will the  family's income. 

Mervat appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Dúo Dulce Fragancia Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dulce Fragancia
La señora Jelen es originaria de Sumpango, es Viuda y tiene dos hijos hace un año termino de pagar un crédito y gracias a Dios lo pago muy bien sin atrasos a pesar de que su esposo falleció cuando aun estaba vigente el crédito, ahora necesita nuevamente otro crédito para poder invertir en su negocio que es una pequeña venta de ropa pero no tiene capital para poder invertir, esta muy contenta porque sus hijos estan estudiando y su sueño es darles estudios a sus hijos, y seguir con su negocio, agradece a kiva la ayuda que le han brindado por medio de los credito  para su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Fragancia” duo

Jelen is originally from Sumpango. She is a widow and has two children. One year ago she finished paying off a loan and, thanks to God, she paid it off on time, even though her husband died while she was repaying it. 

Jelen now needs another loan to invest in her business, a small stall selling clothes. She does not have enough capital to invest in it herself. Jelen is very happy as her children are both studying. Her dream is to give them an education and continue with her business. 

Jelen thanks Kiva for the support provided through loans for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
Mamlakat is a strong woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is now living in small city with beautiful nature. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a construction worker and his work is seasonal. 

Mamlakat has had a business for about four years. She buys and sells women's and children’s clothes. She has a place in the domestic market where she sells her goods. Her family lives in poor conditions because the money that they earn depends on the season and customers each day.

She wants to grow her business and buy seasonal goods to sell. She is asking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a collection of women's and children’s clothes. She hopes she will have good business and earn money to feed her family. She awaits you kindness.

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of women's and children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make clothing.

loans.name: Diego Samuel

texts.es: Diego es un hombre de  36 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango, él cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior logro mejorar la casa que necesitaban de sus puertas y ventanas, y que esto lo ayudo a tener una casa más cómoda para la familia, pero él ahora sea dado cuenta que su casa deberá tener una mejor presentación por lo que ha considerado repellar su casa, aunque una de las dificultades  que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente por tal razón solicita un crédito de Q 8,000.00 para comprar cal arena, para repellar la casa. Diego tiene las esperanzas de poder conseguir el crédito para que su vida siga cambiando para el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a 36 year old man, living in a community in Chichicastenango. 

Thanks to his previous loan he was able to make improvements to his house which needed doors and windows, which helped him to provide a more comfortable home for his family. 

He has now noticed that it should be better presented, so he has thought about plastering the walls of his house, although one of the problems with this is that he does not have enough money to do so. This is why he is requesting a loan of 8000 Quetzales to buy lime and sand, to plaster his house. 

Diego hopes to be able to obtain this loan so that he can continue to change his life for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: to buy lime and sand to plaster his house

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy, 51, is married with five children. She lives in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. She manages her meat shop with her husband and has had this business for years. 

Amy has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase 100 kilos of pig. This will serve as additional inventory to display and sell to the local community.  

Amy wishes to earn more from her business to continuously help her family.

loans.use: to pay for 100 kilos of pig for additional inventory to display and sell to the local community.

loans.name: Porferio

texts.en:
Porferio is a hardworking father from Oroquieta. He has a small coconut farm and also engages in making copra (dried coconut meat used to extract coconut oil), for which he buys whole coconuts. 

Porferio has signed up for membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. He applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra, and to pay for the materials needed for his coconut dryer repair. 

Porferio hopes to succeed in this business in order to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts for making copra, and to pay for the materials needed for his coconut dryer repair.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married with four children and is living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a retailer and a farmer at the same time, growing and trading in cocoa, and is also engaged in motorcycle transport that earns him more income. 

He started the business 12 years ago, but faces challenges of inadequate capital and delays in payment by credit customers. This hinders progress of his business, but he hopes of expanding it into wholesale. Charles has asked for a loan to buy items like sugar, soap, salt, maize, flour, cooking oil, tea leaves and sodas for selling at his shop.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, soap, salt, maize, flour, cooking oil, tea leaves and sodas for selling at his shop.

loans.name: Josselin Estefania

texts.es:
Josselin, es una joven estudiante proveniente de Huaral, ciudad que se encuentra a 2 horas al norte de Lima. Ella vive sola en Lima en un cuarto alquilado, ubicado muy cerca a su centro de estudios, porque sus padres viven en Huaral. Por necesidad de superación tuvo que dejar a sus padres y venir en busca de un mejor futuro profesional.

Sus padres se dedican a la agricultura, ellos cultivan su chacra (campo), teniendo un promedio de ingresos mensuales mínimo, lo que no les permiten poder apoyar a Josselin. Por eso, están solicitando el apoyo de KIVA para que Josselin pueda continuar con sus estudios y llegar a ser una excelente profesional.

Si ella no tuviera el acceso al crédito, hubiera tenido que retirarse temporalmente para que pueda buscar un trabajo que le permita reunir el dinero y continuar estudiando. A ella le gusta mucho su carrera y le llama la atención el procedimiento para fabricar prendas de vestir, en el futuro ella quisiera tener un taller y así beneficiar a su familia y a la comunidad.

Ella está agradecida con el apoyo que KIVA le brinda, piensa que es muy bueno para estudiantes como ella porque les ayuda a solventar sus estudios y así evitan la posibilidad de abandonar su carrera por falta de medios económicos.
texts.en:
Josselin is a young student who comes from Huaral, a city that is 2 hours north of Lima. She lives alone in Lima in a rented room located close to the place where she studies as her parents lives in Huaral. Seeking to improve she had to leave her parents and come search for a better professional future. Her parents work in agriculture. They cultivate a plot of land receiving a minimal amount of income per month, which doesn't allow them to support Josselin.

So Josselin is requesting the support of Kiva so she can continue with her studies and become an excellent professional. If she can't get the help she will have to temporarily drop out and find a job that will permit her to amass money and continue with her studies. She likes this profession a lot and the procedure of making clothing attracts her.

In the future she would like to have a workshop and thus benefit her family and her community. She is grateful for the support that Kiva provides. She thinks it is very good for students such as herself as it will help her pay her studies and avoid having to give up her schooling for lack of economic means.

loans.use: to pay for her apparel textile course.

loans.name: Etihad

texts.en:
Etihad is a 31-year-old married woman from Ramallah city. She is a mother for four sons. Her husband works as an employee in a local factory, where he gets a low income. Etihad has her own business, which is making herbal soap of different kinds and selling it to the local stores. She invented a new product now, which is a natural soap from olive oil.

Etihad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy raw materials for making her new product. By taking this loan, Etihad will be able to improve her business and expand it.

Etihad appears in the photo while she was participating in a local festival for national products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making her new product, a natural soap from olive oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronics repair parts for his new store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy an industrial sewing machine and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.en:
Salomatshoh is a young and cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is living in a remote area. She is divorced and has one child. 

She has four years of experience doing business in the market. She buys and sells vegetables and fruits. She likes to work and has regular clients every day. 

She wants to get a loan from Kiva lenders to buy additional fruits and vegetables. She hopes to have more income and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 33 años, casado, tienen 4 hijos varones de 12, 8, 5 y 1 año, y su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es buen padre, paciente, generoso, optimista, responsable y mus trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Santa Fé’ un área residencial al sur de la ciudad, dónde antiguamente se pastaban las ovejas del lugar, de clima templado y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados. 
Pablo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja en el mismo negocio y con sus hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela. El hijo menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la cerrajería; él se encarga de realizar todo tipo de trabajo en metal, como; muebles, puertas, ventanas, casilleros, etc., actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana en su taller ubicado en su casa. “me inicié trabajando como ayudante, aprendí el oficio y luego me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede trabajar en su casa y estar al cuidado de sus hijos, la desventaja es que es un trabajo pesado y sacrificado. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de muebles metálicos, él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una sierra eléctrica para corta planchas de metal. Esta es la 5 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pablo solicita un préstamo para la compra de una sierra eléctrica para cortar planchas metálicas para fabricar puertas y ventanas para alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 33-year-old man. He is married and has 4 male children of ages 12, 8, 5, and 1. He works as a metalsmith. 

He is a good father, patient, generous, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking. He carries out his business in the Santa Fe zone. The Santa Fe zone is a residential area in the south of the city where, in the past, the sheep of the area would graze. It has a mild, dry climate, with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 4-16 °C (39-61°F). 

Pablo has dark skin, short black hair, brown eyes, a short stature, and a medium build. His native language is Aymará, which is what he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and because of his business. He shares his life with his wife, who works in the same business, and their children. The 3 older children study. The youngest child still is not old enough for school. They live in a rented home made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. The house has potable water, electricity, and plumbing.

He works as a metalsmith. He does all kinds of work with metal, such as furniture, doors, windows, cabinets, etc. He carries out his business every day of the week in a workshop in his house. “I started working as an assistant. I learned the business and later I became independent…” he comments. The advantage of his business is that he can work at home and take care of his children. The disadvantage is that it is a tiresome and demanding job. His dream is to open a store to sell metal furniture. He wants to expand his business by buying an electric saw to cut metal sheets. This is his fifth sequence of loans with the institution in his 15 years in this business.

For these reasons, Pablo is requesting a loan to buy an electric saw to cut metal sheets to make doors and windows to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric saw to cut metal sheets to make doors and windows to feed his family.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RETROCEDER NUNCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.


El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de combustible,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de combustible.El socio solicita el credito para comprar combustible.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the “Retroceder Nunca” communal bank, located in the Santa Ana district of the La Convención province in Cusco department.

The borrower continues to work at his business selling petrol. He works from 8am to 5pm. He has had the business for eight years, and it is going very well. The borrower’s dream is to expand his petrol business. The borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy petrol.

The borrower is happy with this loan and promises to make the repayments

loans.use: to buy petrol.

loans.name: Los Alamos De La Estacion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ALAMOS DE LA ESTACION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tania ella es soltero y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Los Alamos de la Estacion" lending group. This group is located in the Urcos district of the province on Quispicanchis in Cusco. 

Tania, one of the members, is single, 36 years old and has one son. She runs a grocery store and a restaurant. She sells basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She hopes to get ahead through this business. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman whose dream is to expand her grocery store. She is seeking a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The other members of the group work in business that include: clothing sales, selling cakes, grocery stores and restaurants. The members are grateful for the help that they are receiving to make their dreams come true, and they are committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RETROCEDER NUNCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Jorge se dedica al negocio de ganaderia, el socio los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. El socio solicita el credito para comprar ganados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Retroceder Nunca” (“Never Go Backwards”). The bank is located in the Santa Ana district, which is part of the La Convención province in the Cusco department. 

Jorge makes a living by raising cattle. He fattens and grows the cattle and later sells them to different markets. He works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Through this work, he wants to get ahead. His dream is to expand his cattle sales business. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa, la socia continua con su  negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua elaborando  chompas, chalinas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas, hilos, tejedores entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tejidos de chompas, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de restaurante, venta de mates, venta de verduras.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members all belong to the "Las Palmeras" lending group. This group is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco in Cusco. 

Teresa, one of the members, continues to run her business selling artisanal crafts. She is grateful for those who are taking part in making her dreams come true through this medium, and she is committed to making the payments on time.  The members makes sweaters and scarves, among other products, for her customers who order them.  This is how she has been able to get her family ahead.

Teresa is seeking a loan to purchase wool, thread, knitting machines, and other supplies.  

The other members of the group work in businesses that include: selling artisanal crafts, selling sweaters, taxi services, restaurants, selling mate tea, and selling vegetables.  The members in the inset photos asked permission to come to the meeting late because of work.

loans.use: purchase wool, thread, knitting machines, etc...

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita lives in Talibon, Bohol. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities ranging from beverages, canned goods, soft drinks, condiments, noodles, and many others. She is married with four children. 

Her oldest child is 21 and the youngest is eight years old. Her husband works in a construction company.

She has requested a loan to buy merchandise like soap, shampoo and soft drinks. These goods will fill her store and enable her to attract more customers. Thus, in this way, it will improve her daily sales and she could start to expand her business and be able to manage her finances.

Tomasita is determined to manage her current business for sustainable living in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale, like soap, shampoo and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married and makes a good earning with every cropping on her rice farm in Dumingag, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting their family with her husband. 

Elsie has been able to provide her children with a good education, until they graduated and secured stable jobs. 

Elsie pawned her 1-hectare rice land when her children entered college. Now, with the help and support of her youngest son, she wishes to access a PMPC loan to pay for the acquisition of her pawned rice land. Elsie has high hopes that she will have a higher yield on her rice farm next cropping, and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of her pawned rice land

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is hardworking mother of six children. Farming is the family's primary source of income. Her husband is a farmer and works on their rice land.  

Josefina applied for a loan in Paglaum in the amount of 5,000 PHP to pay labor and milling fees for their harvested rice. Josefina is very thankful of Paglaum that trusted her, and hopes that she can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to pay labor and milling fees.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Flora is 52 years old now.

Flora has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Flora requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, like shirts, pants, etc..

Flora has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, like shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lerma is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lerma has a meat vending business in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

Lerma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lerma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
Emperatriz is 40 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Emperatriz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emperatriz requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Emperatriz has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed loans five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emperatriz would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise like Splash, washing soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is female. She is married with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Flavia operates a textile shop and has been in business since 2001. She has a dream of growing her business and educating her child. However, she is faced with challenges of limited capital, high transport fees and market competition, which greatly affects her returns. 

Flavia intends to use the loan to buy men's, ladies' and children's clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy men's, ladies' and children's clothes for selling

loans.name: Byron Arturo

texts.es: Arturo esta pasando por sus 22 años de edad, Arturo vive en el campo junto a su madre que se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores y comenta que es de ahí que le enseñan a estas actividades,  Arturo  pide el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos que le ayudan en sus ingresos, Arturo tienen la aspiración de entrar  a un curso para capacitarse y aprobar a ser policía, en la actualidad tiene una fractura en su pierna izquierda ya que comenta que esta entrenando duro para conseguir su aspiración.  Arturo desea mejorar su negocio y que este le permite tener los ingresos para pagar el curso al que desea ingresar.
texts.en: Arturo is 22 years old. He lives in the country with his mother who works raising small animals. He states that he learned his trade from his mother.  Arturo is seeking a loan to purchase pigs to help improve his income.  Arturo aspires to attending school so that he can train and become a police officer. At the moment, he has a fracture in his left leg, which he injured training to reach his goal.  Arturo hopes to improve his business since it will allow him to pay for the class that he wishes to take.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is 42 years old and has five children who are in school.

Vilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her business.

Vilma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her business.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es una mujer de 50 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano. 
Ella es buena emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de Julio’ que se caracteriza por la procedencia de sus pobladores; Aymarás y Quechuas, situado al norte de la ciudad, migrantes del todos lados se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Candelaria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo hasta la altura de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su vida la disfruta con sus familiares que trabajan y son independientes, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otra tienda en el mismo rubro en otro mercado. “inicié mi negocio vendiendo peluches, con el tiempo mi comercio fue cambiando…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende constantemente porque tiene un puesto fijo de venta, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es tener sus tiendas propias en 2 mercados, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. 
Es por esos motivos que Candelaria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abrir una tienda de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a 50-year-old woman. She is single with no children, and she has a business selling second-hand clothing.

Candelaria is entrepreneurial, patient, persevering, responsible, and very hardworking. Her business is located in the '16 de Julio' area that is known for the origin of its inhabitants: Aymarás y Quechuas. Situated to the north of the city, migrants from everywhere appropriated this area and created an area commerce that is continually growing. The weather here is cold and dry, with temperatures that vary between 2-14 degrees centigrade during the day. 

Candelaria is dark-skinned with brown eyes and long black hair down to her shoulders. She is short with a robust physical build. Her native language is 
Aymará, which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish for general purposes and in her business. She enjoys her life with her relatives who work and are independent. They live in a home owned by the family, which is made of bricks and cement with a corrugated iron roof. The house has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Candelaria has a business selling second-hand clothing such as pants, polo shirts, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, jackets, coats, etc. She needs to stock her business with a greater variety and quantity of clothing to compete in the market. Also, she would like to open another store in the same area in another market. "I started my business selling stuffed animals, but my business gradually evolved over time..." says Candelaria. The benefit of her business is that clothing constantly sells because she has a permanent stand to sell from. The drawback is her lack of capital to be able to invest and make her business grow.

Candelaria's dream is to have her own stores in 2 markets. She would like to invest in her business by purchasing second-hand clothing at wholesale. For these reasons, Candelaria is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing at wholesale in order to open another store that sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing at wholesale in order to open up a store that sells clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy children's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU HUAMANGA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Lares, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Hilda  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank APU HUAMANGA. The bank is located in the district of Lares, in the Calca province in the city of Cusco.

Hilda makes a living in agriculture. She has an area of land, and she grows cocoa and coffee beans. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has been in this occupation for several years now, and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the area of land that she cultivates. She is requesting a loan to buy seed and fertilizer.

Hilda is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to fulfill her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dúo Vencedores En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Vencedores en Cristo
La señora Amanda es la encargada de este grupo. Tiene una venta de pañal desechable, papel higiénico, jabón, detergente para ropa, gelatinas en el mercado del pueblo. Tiene varios tipos de venta desde hace 15 años y su negocio necesita mucho capital para comprar más cosas que le están pidiendo sus clientes.  Por eso necesita  un crédito para seguir acreditando su negocio y aprovechar las ventas de verano para tener muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
These two people go by the name the Vencedores en Cristo. 

Sra. Amanda is in charge. She sells disposable diapers, toilet paper, soap, detergent, and jello in the local market. For 15 years she has had various types of businesses. She needs a lot of capital to buy the items that her customers are seeking. For this reason she needs a loan to continue with her business and take advantage of the summer when she can earn more money.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her stall

loans.name: Mkonga Road Group

texts.en:
Ashura, who is in her mid 30s, is single with two children who are both still in school.  For six years, she has been running several projects including selling clothes and bites like mandazi, chapati, samosas, beans, and serving tea. She works from 6 am to 2 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ashura's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to start selling clothes door to door and also increased the bites stock. She has paid back her loan successfully. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  The members can now support their families and take their kids to good schools.  Ashura used her profit to pay school fees, repay the loan and cover household expenses.  

She will use this loan to increase her clothes stock and meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of buying a plot of land and building a house with a shop.  Then she'll be able to sell her clothes in one place instead of moving up and down, door to door looking for customers.

Ashura will share this loan with her loan group Mkonga Road which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her clothes stock and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Tommy

texts.en:
Tommy engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He is a 20-year-old man with a 1-year-old dependent. He lives in Talibon, Bohol. Aside from fishing, he is also a laborer. To be able to continue his fishing livelihood, he decided to take a loan.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to buy materials for the boat repair like wood, nails and epoxy. These materials will help boost his ongoing catch. It will help Tommy sell more fish on the market. Slowly, his earnings will improve and help his income. In this way, he could set aside some savings for emergency purposes.
 
He is hoping that he could expand his fishing business for the improvement of the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for the boat repair like wood, nails and epoxy

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 39 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Rosalia works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell at her store, like beverages, junk foods, home care products, and groceries.

Rosalia has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like beverages, junk foods, home care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Madeline is 51 years old and two of her children are in school.

Madeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Madeline has been in this business for three years. In the future, Madeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce is a 46-year-old married male with 11 children living in Kasese, Uganda. He owns a hardware shop, having been in that business for six years. He gets additional income from selling veterinary drugs. He has a dream of buying a motor vehicle for transport and building his dream home. However, he is faced with challenges of limited capital and high rental and license fees. 

He wants a loan to buy construction materials like sand and bricks, and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand and bricks, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Tania Maricela

texts.es: A sus 29 años de edad Tania es madre soltera, sus 2 hijos tienen 1 y 6 años de edad, el mayor de ellos está estudiando, Tania se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, y de igual manera trabaja de mesera en el restaurante que le pertenece a su madre, Tania va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de pollos y por medio de la crianza y comercializacion le quede ganancias y aumentar  sus ingresos que le permitan pagar los estudios y mantenimiento de sus hijos.
texts.en: At 29 years of age, Tania is a single mother. Her two children are one and six years old and the oldest is in school. Tania works raising small animals and also as a waitress at her mother’s restaurant. Tania is going to invest the loan money into buying chickens and through raising and selling them she will make earnings and increase her income, which will allow her to pay for her children’s school and care for them.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilia is 49 years old and two of her children are in school.

Lilia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her store.

Lilia has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell to customers

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a married woman with ten children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alberta is 59 years old.

Alberta has a nipa weaving business in the Philippines. Alberta requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves for her business. Alberta has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future, Alberta would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kids' clothes for his new stall to resell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 51 years old. She is married and has six children. She has a retail business selling lumber.

In 2012, she applied for her membership in Paglaum-Multi Purpose Cooperative in order to seek financial services and insurances. Since then, she has been a good member and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for financial assistance in the amount of 50,000 PHP to finance farming activities such as ploughing, levelling, cleaning of dikes and buying of farm inputs. 

She has found assistance for her family's financial needs through PMPC and is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to finance farming activities such as ploughing, levelling, cleaning of dikes and buying of farm inputs.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita has been considerably preparing for the post-harvest operations of her palay (rice field) in Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage, processing and milling of her rice harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan.  

Paulita hopes to see all her family in good living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations of her "palay" (rice field)

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives for business start-ups. Dina tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Dina borrowed another amount to pay for bags of fertilizer and pesticides. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Dina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for bags of fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liezel is 25 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Liezel has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Liezel has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Liezel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as groceries, meat, etc.

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es:
Este  grupo está conformado por vecinas de la comunidad de Darizara, se les realizo una visita para reforzar el tema de reunión y ahorro, los cuales son indispensables para continuar con el crédito grupal. 

Todas iniciaron con poco capital de trabajo, pero con el tiempo han logrado permanecer con su actividad productiva y ampliar su cartera de clientes.

Sindy es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es madre jefa de hogar y por medio de su actividad productiva la cual es venta por catálogo, logra generar ingresos para pagar los gastos del hogar y darle a sus hijos para que paguen algunos gastos del colegio y escuela como: pasajes, libros y fotocopias. Ella logra distribuir sus catálogos en las diferentes casas del barrio y lugares aledaños, tres días después vuelve a pasar para saber que le han pedido y poder solicitarlo, para entregarlo 8 días después y que le paguen en un plazo de 15 días.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería que le han solicitado su clientela. 

Eligió Fundación Mujer por la buena oportunidad que brinda y la baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
This group is made up of neighbors from the Darizara community. They were paid a visit to reinforce the themes of reunion and saving, which are indispensable to continue with group credit.

All of them started with little working capital, but over time they have been able to keep their businesses going and expand their customer base.

Sindy is one of the members of the group. She is a mother who is the head of the household. Through her business, which is catalogue sales, she is able to generate income to pay for household expenses and give money to her children so that they can pay some of their school expenses such as tickets, books, and photocopies. She is able to distribute her catalogs in the different houses in the neighborhood and the neighboring locations. Three days later she returns to see what orders they have placed. She then requests the items and gives them to the people 8 days later, and they pay her within 15 days.

She needs this loan to buy merchandise that her customers have requested.

She chose Fundación Mujer because of the good opportunities it provides and the low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elena Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda es una joven alegre, tiene 27 años de edad, junto a su esposo tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 8 años mismos que se encuentran estudiando, Esmeralda vive en el campo y se dedica a la crianza de vacas y de estas saca la leche para vender este producto,el esposo de Esmeralda trabaja de obrero en una empresa de alimentos, Esmeralda paga por la hierba para tener sus  vacas y el dinero del credito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, Esmeralda desea seguir trabajando y asi seguir adelante sobre todo en la educacion de sus hijos.
texts.en: Esmeralda is a happy young person. She is 27 years old and with her husband she has two children, ages 6 and 8, who are in school. Esmeralda lives in the country and works raising cows and selling their milk. Esmeralda’s husband works at a food business. Esmeralda pays for the grass for her cows and she is going to invest the loan money into buying a cow. Esmeralda wants to continue working and in this way get ahead, especially with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for his new store.

loans.name: Dúo Manos Trabajadoras De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Dúo Manos Trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa
La señora Eulalia tiene 25 años de ser una vendedora ambulante.  Vende ropa de tela  para damas, caballeros y niños de diferentes precios y calidad.  El verano se aproxima y le hacen falta algunos estilos de blusas, camisas y trajes de niños en el negocio, sus clientes le han encargado varios tipos de prendas de vestir pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por tal motivo nuevamente pide otro préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus compradores y ofrecerles las prendas de vestir que piden.  Su sueño es seguir ayudando a sus hijos con sus pequeños negocio de ropa y cada día enseñarles a ser buenos vendedores.
texts.en:
Dúo Manos Trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa

Señora Eulalia has been a traveling saleswoman for 25 years. She sells clothing for women, men and children, and her products vary in price and quality. Summer is coming, and her business's inventory is lacking several styles of blouses, shirts, and children's suits. Her customers have requested various types of clothing, but the money she has isn't sufficient to fulfill these requests. For this reason, she is requesting another loan to retain her customers, and be able to offer them the clothing that they request from her. Her dream is to continue helping out her children with their clothing businesses, and teach them everyday to be good sales professionals.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: In 2011, Gina learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Gina tried her luck on starting a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her success to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Gina is requesting another amount to pay for seedlings and compost for her flower garden. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Gina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy materials and fertilizer for her flower garden

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en: Dildora is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is living in small town near to hills. She is single and lives with her parents. She works in an international company as an operator. After her mother got sick, she has tried to work hard to pay for the treatment of her mother. She used IMON's service and asks to be supported. She wants to get a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to help her pay for her mother's treatment in the medical clinic. She loves her mother and wants see her healthy.

loans.use: to pay for the treatment of her mother in a medical clinic

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Her name is Irene, 34, and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Sam, a tricycle driver, she has three children who are still in Elementary level at school. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household needs, and for the schooling of her children. 

Irene is into the food business, she has operated an eatery stall for four years already. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight especially in populated areas.  The working class usually buy their meals at food stalls sold at reasonable prices for convenience, and to save money than cook at home. The working class just eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family. She is a good cook; that is why her food stall is popular in their area with neighbors and the local working community as her regular  customers. She earns a minimum of Php900 net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Irene is requesting for a Php10000 loan to buy additional raw ingredients like pork, fish, chicken, and seasonings that are needed for her cooking. She believes that with this financial assistance  her sales and earnings will increase. Her earnings from her food stall will surely meet her family's everyday personal and household needs, and fund her children's schooling. She is thanking God and you in advance for your great help. 

Irene dreams to build and expand her business to secure the education of her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fresh meat, veggies, seasoning, and rice needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aurora is 38 years old and has one child in school.

Aurora has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines. Aurora requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spices to sell in her business.

Aurora has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Aurora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell in her business

loans.name: Mirian Dalila

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 21 años de edad, es casada tiene un hermoso  hijo de la edad de un año, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Sololá.
Mirian con el objetivo de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa, se dedica  a la venta de papas fritas, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace un año en el lugar de su domicilio, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también trabaja como costurera.
Mirian gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende a los clientes y la calidad de su producto, cuenta  con  mucho demanda,  por lo que ella ha considerado mejorar la presentación de su pequeño negocio, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder comprar una carreta donde pueda preparar y exhibir mejor las papa que ella vende.
Mirian tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder mejorar la presentación de su negocio y poder mejorar sus ingresos, ella anhela poder tener una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes y un local exclusivo para su venta de papas fritas.
texts.en:
Mirian is a 21-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful one-year-old son. This lovely family lives in a neighborhood in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Sololá.

In order to earn income and help her husband take care of the household, Mirian makes a living selling french fries. She has operated this business out of her home for one year, and she also works as a seamstress to earn additional income.

Thanks to the kindness she shows when dealing with her customers as well as the quality of her product, Mirian's french fries are in high demand. For this reason, she has thought about improving the appearance of her small business, but one of the difficulties she faces is a lack of capital to be able to purchase a cart where she can prepare and better display the french fries that she sells.

Mirian hopes to obtain this loan to be able to improve the appearance of her business, and be able to earn more income. She aspires to have a shop for buying and selling groceries as well as an exclusive place to sell her french fries.

loans.use: to buy a cart for preparing and better displaying the french fries that she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some tools and repair parts for his new business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a mother of a nine-year-old son residing in Talibon, Bohol. She engages in buying and selling various books.  She has been engaged in this business for almost four years. She is a 31-year-old  married woman. Her husband earns a living by being an electrician by profession.

Rosa is asking for a loan to purchase a variety of books. In this way, she would be able to purchase various books, depending on the orders of  her  customers and deliver the books on time,and slowly her finances will become stable. She would be able to provide the needs of her growing child and prepare healthy food.

In the future, Rosa dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a  variety of books

loans.name: Democrita

texts.en:
Democrita is 65 years old and married with six children.

Democrita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Democrita has borrowed and paid back 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and selling seafood.

Democrita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emiliana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more additional groceries to sell.

Emiliana has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Emiliana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 60 years old and married with five children. Pacita works very hard to provide for them.

Pacita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to resell.

Pacita has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Pacita would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to resell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a man, 25 years of age, married with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a textile shop where he has worked for five years. He does farming as an additional source of income. He ventured into business in order to uplift himself. He is a hardworking man, dreaming of expanding his business into a Registered tailoring school, despite being challenged by inadequate capital. He needs a loan to buy cloth (bitenge) for men, ladies and children's wear to sell.

loans.use: to buy cloth (bitenge) for men, ladies and children's wear  to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt, sugar, bread and others to sell.

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 61 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maricon has a food stall business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to resell.

Maricon has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Maricon would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to resell

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 24-year-old married mother of two children who has been running her grocery store since April 2014. Her shop's income is mainly targeted to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.

Malak is working hard to develop her business, but, unfortunately, her family's increasing living needs are barely covered through her business-acquired income. For this reason, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages in addition to special-offer products.

Malak hopes that in the future she can expand her business and diversify her products in a well-managed way, and make sure she can provide her children the best education.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages in addition to special-offer products.

loans.name: Redemptna

texts.en:
Redemptna owns and manages a vulcanizing shop. It has been four years now that she has been engaged in that kind of business. She is a 50-year-old married woman with three dependents. One of her children is still attending school. She resides in Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to purchase stocks for the store for start-up and for additional capital for the operation of her vulcanizing shop. These are very important materials in augmenting her sources of income. Her daily income will improve and start to balance her finances. In this way, she can continue to finance the schooling of her youngest child. She may be able to expand and to search for any possible ventures for a sustainable livelihood.

Redemptna hopes that her business will be successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for the store for start-up and for additional capital for the operation of her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en: Abdusalom is an active man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1962. He is living in a rural area in a small village where the men are working hard to feed their family. He has 33 years of experience doing business. He is married and has three children. Abdusalom has a good condition to plant agriculture and keep livestock. In his village, women are not permitted to work if there is a man in the house. His wife helps him in business and keeps their children. It was hard for him to do business in agriculture because some seasons they did not get a harvest and his family struggled. They live very poorly. He even flew abroad to find a job and earn some money to feed his family. It did not seem a good chance to earn money so he decided to come back and do his business more productively and accurately. Now he is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant and produce a good harvest. He hopes this season he will get a good harvest and feed his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant and produce a good harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 39 years old and married with two children, both of whom go to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Riza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Riza has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Riza would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Grace has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Grace would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asa

texts.en:
Asa is 60 years old and still strong married with eight children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He runs a general merchandise shop and gets additional income from poultry farming and rentals in order to look after his family.

Asa has a dream of expanding his poultry farming project and buying new breeds called croilers that mature quickly so he can make more and quicker profits. However, he is faced with a difficulty of market competition plus pests and diseases. He wants money to build a poultry house.

loans.use: to build a poultry house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 53-year-old female widow with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She runs a general merchandise shop that she started after the death of her husband in order to look after her children. She gets additional income from rental houses.

Grace has a dream of renovating her family house, though she is faced with the challenges of market competition and price fluctuations of retail products, which reduces her expected returns. Grace wants money to buy paint, sand and cement to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy paint, sand and cement to renovate her house.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 32-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is the mother of three sons. Linda and her husband have a sweets store in the city where they make different types of sweets, especially Arabic sweets. It is a very good business and the demand is always high.

Linda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy raw materials and some tools for her sweets store. This will increase the productivity and also the income.

Linda and her husband appear in the photo in their sweets store.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and some tools for her sweets store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is a 35-year-old married man from Dier El Balah city. He lives with his wife and three kids, one son and two daughters. For the past five years, Jameel has had his own business, which is a stall for selling cleaning products. It is a good business but the income is not enough to cover all the family needs.

Jameel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more cleaning products to resell in his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income.

Jameel appears in the photo while he is working.

loans.use: to buy more cleaning products to resell in his stall.

loans.name: Dúo Concepción De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Dúo Concepción de Sumpango
Doña Lidia es originaria de Sumpango, ellas es casada y madre de familia,quien tiene dos hijas las cuales están estudiando, tiene su propio negocio, tiene un puesto en le marcado local de Sumpango,donde elabora y vende ropa tipica por lo mismo necesita de capital para poder surtir su negocio y así incrementar sus ventas,ella está solicitando un crédito a kiva para invertir en su negocio ya que el sueño de ella es que sus hijos finalicen el ciclo escolar, promete pagar cada fecha indicada.
texts.en:
Duo Concepción de Sumpango.
Lidia is a native of Sumpango and she is married and the mother of 2 children who are in school. She has her own business and has a stall in the local market in Sumpango where she makes and sells traditional clothing. She needs capital to supply this same business with the goal of increasing her sales. She is requesting a Kiva loan to invest in her business as her dream is that her children finish school. She promises to make all the repayments.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. 

Luisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Luisa requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Luisa has been raising pigs for twenty years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Lindy

texts.en:
Lindy is 41 years old and is married with 3 children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for all of them.

Lindy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lindy has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Lindy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 37-Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Van is a 59-year-old farmer. She is pictured in a white shirt first from the left. She makes about $35 every month working in the rice paddies. Van is a single mom with a grown married son, but her son's health is not good so he doesn't have a stable job or decent income. Due to economic hardship, they have not been able to install a hygienic toilet at home. However, as a member of the local Women's Union since 1990, she recently joined a campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene. With this loan, she and nine of her peers will each build a hygienic toilet at home that will improve their family's and the community's quality of life. With ten households making a commitment, this neighborhood will be able to enjoy better health by avoiding many of the common infections and diseases associated with the unsafe latrines currently being used.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Nhóm 34 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Nguyen, 21 years old, works in agriculture production where she earns a monthly income of about $35. She is married and preparing to have her first child soon. Currently, their family uses an unsafe, unhygienic latrine. However, her local women's union, where she has been a member since 2013, has recently started a campaign to improve sanitation and hygiene. Therefore Nguyen is totally aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her child, her family members, her community and environmental contamination. A portion of Nhóm 34- Bình Xuyên Group's loan will help Nguyen as well as other group members build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. In the photo, Nguyen stands the first on the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, skirts and children's wear for selling.

loans.name: Naomi Cesarina

texts.es:
Naomi es una joven estudiante que vive junto a su padre y 2 hermanos. Su madre se separó de su padre cuando era muy pequeña, lo que le afectó mucho. Los ingresos en su familia lo genera su padre a través de su trabajo como profesor, pero ese ingreso es mínimo porque no tiene un trabajo permanente.

Debido a que su padre tiene que ver por la educación de ella y sus hermanos menores que aún se encuentran en la escuela, ella recurre al apoyo de KIVA para que pueda continuar estudiando Procesos de Producción Industrial, carrera que le gusta mucho porque es nueva e interesante y le permitirá ayudar en la economía de su hogar.

De no contar con el apoyo de KIVA ella lamentablemente correría el riesgo de abandonar sus estudios, porque su padre no cuenta con los medios económicos que le permitan apoyarla.

Naomí está muy agradecida por el apoyo que está brindando KIVA a jóvenes como ella que tiene los deseos de superación profesional y lo pueden concretar gracias a su ayuda.
texts.en:
Naomi is a young student who lives with her father and 2 siblings. Her mother separated from her father when she was very little, which affected her a great deal. Her father earns the family's income by working as a teacher, but this income is small because he does not have permanent work.
Because her father has to see to her education and the education of her younger siblings who are still in school, she requested help from KIVA to be able to continue studying Industrial Production Processes, a degree that she likes very much because it is new and interesting and will enable her to help with the household expenses. 
If she does not have the help of KIVA, she would unfortunately run the risk of giving up her studies as her father does not have the economic means to be able to support her. 
Naomi is very grateful for the support that KIVA offers to young people like herself who want to become professionals and she can make this goal real thanks to your support.

loans.use: to pay her expenses to study for a degree in Industrial Production Processes.

loans.name: Fabian Elias

texts.es: Fabian esta casado, tiene 55 años de edad, Fabian y su esposa tiene  una hija de 20 años que asiste a la universidad, Fabian se dedica a trabajar a  la agricultura, Fabian necesita el dinero del credito para comprar abono y fungicidas para tener sus cultivos sanos y de este negocio  aspira  tener buena cosecha y formarse un  capital para comprar a futuro una casita para tener una vejes digna.
texts.en: Fabian is married and is 55 years old. Fabian and his wife have a 20 year old daughter who attends the university. Fabian works as a farmer and needs this loan to buy fertilizer and fungicides to keep his crops healthy. He hopes to have a good harvest and to earn some capital so that, in the future, he can buy a small house so that he can have a dignified old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Laila's Group

texts.en:
Laila and Aida are partners in work and they have been friends for a long time. They learned from life that willpower, ambition and hard work are the key factors to success.

Laila is a married woman who has three children, while her friend Aida is a 25-year-old single lady. They could not complete their education because of the financial situation of their families, but they wanted to improve the standards of living for each one of them. Therefore they opened their own business, which is cattle breeding, with the help from Laila`s husband who is working as a butcher and has good experience and knowledge of sheep and cows.

Laila and Aida expanded their work to include poultry and bird breeding to increase their income. Now they applied for a loan to help them insert technology by buying a diary machine to improve the quality of work and to buy more sheep to increase their production.

loans.use: to insert technology in their business by buying a diary machine to improve the quality of work and to buy more sheep to increase their production.

loans.name: Nhóm 39 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Phuc, pictured first from the left, makes about $35 every month working in the rice paddies. She is 54 years old and has four grown children but they don't have stable jobs or decent income yet. Due to economic hardship, they have not been able to install a hygienic toilet at home. However, as a member of the local Women's Union since 1985, she recently joined a campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene. With this loan, she and nine of her peers will each build a hygienic toilet at home that will improve their family's and the community's quality of life. With ten households making a commitment, this neighborhood will be able to enjoy better health by avoiding many of the common infections and diseases associated with the unsafe latrines currently being used.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.
